loans.name: Shibani Shg Group

texts.en:
Arati, who is a 48-year-old married rice farmer with five children, two of them married, can only make 500 INR per day to support her family. Arati resides in a rural area of Bolangir District, Odisha, India. She has been involved in this work for nearly 20 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Arati, along with her group member, would like to get a low-interest, Kiva-funded loan from People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standard.

She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for less fortunate people like her. She is the one standing on the left-hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house.

loans.name: Nabiha

texts.en:
Nabiha is a 52-year-old married woman of seven children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started nine years ago working in the cleaning domain to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. 
Nabiha is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to prepare for her son's wedding. She wants to make his wedding day very special and memorable. She hopes to stay capable of providing her family with descent living conditions.

loans.use: to prepare for her son's wedding

loans.name: Maria Gina

texts.en:
Maria Gina is a sari-sari store (general store) owner. She is a married woman and lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte. Her husband works hard as a construction worker to raise their family. Maria Gina started this business few months ago to help her husband uplift their financial stability.

Thus, she is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy commodities such as drinks, noodles, chips, candies, biscuits, bread, canned goods, spices, sugar, salt, toiletries, powdered milk and chocolate drink. Maria Gina wants to improve her business in the future to be able to enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy drinks, noodles, chips, candies, biscuits, bread, canned goods, spices, sugar, salt, toiletries, powdered milk and chocolate drink

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is 22 years old. He is married with two children. He has had farming business for three years. He will be using the loan to purchase more livestock and hopes this will help him to open other businesses. His hopes and dreams for the future are to live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase  more livestock to help him to open other businesses

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services and has been in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of products.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to expand and open other branches within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 38 years old and has three children, twins aged 14 years old and little girl 5-years-old.
Armen works as an agriculturist following his family tradition, keeping big livestock and cultivating some crops (wheat and barley). Armen's cattle is large including 12 cows, 8 calves, 5 sheep, 4 sows,6 piglets and 20 hens.

Because the arable land that Armen owns, is not big, he is not able to cultivate as many variety of crops as he would like to. So, by requesting this loan, Armen plans to pay for one hectare of land and enlarge his agribusiness, so income gathered for his family will be increased.

Armen hopes that the income gathered with the help of this loan, will enable Armen to cover nutrition and clothing expenses of his family.

loans.use: to pay for one hectare of land to enlarge his agribusiness and earn more income for his family's daily living .

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is from the city of Mafraq, an area that is distant from the country's capital. She is outlining a plan to be able to get ahead, and for this she is studying and dedicated. The degree that she chose is accounting.

This is her last year at the university and she says that her greatest desire is to graduate and be able to work in her field. Her family is facing financial problems since they are living in an area that was affected by the Syrian Conflict, and by the number of refugees coming in.

This has led Haneen to ask for a loan to pay her university fees.

loans.use: to pay her university fees for next semester.

loans.name: Doure Group

texts.fr:
Mr ALI est le responsable du groupe DOURE. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 04 ans et le moins âgé a 06 mois.  Aucun enfant ne va à l’école et il a 10 personnes  en charges.
Mr fait de l’élevage depuis 03 ans et pratique aussi l'agriculture. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché  de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 10 poules et 02 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour aider sa famille et payer la scolarité des ses enfants. Il ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Ali is the representative for the Doure Group. He is married and father to two children. The eldest is four and the youngest is six months old. Neither of his children attend school yet. Ali is responsible for providing for a total of ten people.

Ali has been raising livestock for three years. He also grows vegetables. He buys his animals from the local market and will use this loan to buy ten chickens and two sheep.

With the profits he will earn, Ali will help his family and pay school fees for his children. His dream is to become a large scale farmer one day.

loans.use: to buy 10 chickens and 2 sheep.

loans.name: Saher

texts.en:
Saher is a single man from Irbid. He is studying for a bachelor’s degree, majoring in the French Language and is in his third year. Due to the fact that he is lacking the finances to pay his third-year university fees, he would like to request a loan.

With this loan, he will be able to go through the third year at the university successfully. In the future, he wants to find a good job with a decent salary and to improve his family’s living.

loans.use: pay for his third year at the university.

loans.name: Nageena

texts.en:
Nageena is 32 year old young school owner who started her school in 2006. Today there are 249 students in her school with a healthy percentage of female enrollment. Nageena discussed the challenges faced by our society today with her loan officer while requesting for a loan worth Rs 75,000. She believes that today the foremost need of our society is access to quality education and her aim is to contribute to the literacy rate of her community by improving her school.

In her school lack of space to accommodate her students is a constant challenge and her plan now is to use the loan amount to construct additional space as well as bring in computers to the school for students and teachers.

loans.use: to construct additional space as well as bring computers in the school for students and teachers.

loans.name: Sahizer

texts.en:
Şahizer is married and has a child. She is making meerschaum necklaces, rings, paternosters and wristbands from raw meerschaum stone and selling them in her shop. She has already had loans four times. With the help of the loans she bought bulks of raw meerschaum, processed it, sold her products and gained money. With the help of her new loan she is planning to buy raw meerschaum, process it, make money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Şahizer hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Lületaşı işi yapıyor lületaşını işlenmemiş olarak alıyor kolye, yüzük, tesbih, bileklik olarak işleyerek tezgahta satıyor. Şahizer hanım dört kez mikro kredi kullandı. Aldığı mikro kredi ile lületaşını ham olarak aldı işledi satarak para kazandı. Yeni aldığı mikro kredi ile lületaşını ham olarak alacak ve işleyerek satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy raw stone

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water tank and pipes to improve his water supply system.

loans.name: Wiliamo

texts.pt:
O senhor Wiliamo de 31 anos de idade é comerciante, casado pai de 3 filhos dos quais 1 ainda menores e 2 a estudarem,  sustenta 2 irmãos que vivem com ele na  casa própria construida num espaço cedido pelos seus pais.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar  blocos, cimento, e varões para dar continuidade a sua obra tipo 3.
O seu sonho é crescer no seu negócio, ter um estabelecimento próprio, terminar a construção de sua casa e reabilitar a sua carrinha mini-bus para fazer transporte de alunos.
Diz que o seu maior desafio e o financeiro, tem  estado a fazer transporte de passageiro para minimiza-los, e pretende tomar mais vezes o emprestimo para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
Wiliamo, 31, is a businessman. He is married, and the father of three children; one is still very young, and two go to school. He sustains two siblings that live with him in a house he owns, built in a piece of land given to him by his parents.

He says that with the requested amount, he is planning to buy bricks, cement, and beams to continue building his three-bedroom house.

His dreams are to expand his business, open his own establishment, finish building his home, and repair his minivan to transport students.

He says that his major challenge is financial in nature, and he has been transporting passenger in order to minimize it. Also, that he is planning to apply for more loans to overcome the difficulties and reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and beams.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has three children. Her oldest child is 10 years while her youngest child is one-year-old. Marilyn is so happy to have her family even if she married earlier. Her children are her inspiration to go on and continue believing that in the future they can have a better means of living.

To help her husband augment their livelihood she started her own business. She does hog raising business. She has been doing this for three years. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and buy feed as well. Marilyn wants to enhance this business in the future so she could have enough money to give good education to her children for them to have better life.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 45-year-old man who lives in the town of Calape in Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has a five-year-old son. He has raised his family with income from driving a tricycle (a motorcycle with a covered sidecar that seats anywhere from one passenger to as many as the driver will allow).

A tricycle is a common mode of public transportation in the Philippines, and Anthony has been doing this for six years, ever since he started his married life. He works hard to provide the needs of his family and to give a good education to his son.

Thus, he is asking for a loan for tricycle maintenance, such as an overhaul and new tires. Anthony dreams of improving his livelihood in order to have a better means of living in the future.

loans.use: pay for tricycle maintenance, such as to overhaul and to buy new tires.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 24-year-old single man, main financial supporter of his family.
He runs a chocolate and candies selling shop for three years, and he is working hard to develop this business and specialize it upon customers needs.
His acquired YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, will be invested in increasing his merchandise with special requested Autumn and winter cereals and hot drinks.
He hopes to expand his business and open a wider working place in the future, with diversified products.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with specially requested autumn and winter cereals and hot drinks.

loans.name: Vehasi Group

texts.fr:
Joseph fait partie du groupe  Vehasi et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 37 ans et est marié à Josiane, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 2 à 11 ans, dont  4 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce des habits     depuis  10 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter un champ pour cultiver et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Joseph is part of the Vehasi Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 37 years old and is married to Josiane, a farmer. Together they have 5 children between the ages of 2 and 11, 4 of whom are in school.

He has sold clothing for 10 years. 

This is his fourth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that he receives, he will increase his capital and buy several items of clothing, which he will sell in order to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a field for farming, and he would like to see his children continue their schooling.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy several clothing items that he will sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Nongtaaba De Bazoule Group

texts.fr:
Mr OUMAROU est représentant du groupe NONGTAABA DE BAZOULE. Il est marié et père de 10 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il a 10 personnes en charges.
Mr fait du jardinage depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé il compte acheter 02 boîtes de semences de tomates et 02 boîtes de semence de persil.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour aider sa famille et payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Il ambitionne devenir un grand jardinier.
texts.en:
Oumarou is the representative of the 'Nongtaaba de Bazoule' Group. He is married and father to ten children. The eldest is twenty-four years old, and the youngest is two years old. Four of his children attend school and he is responsible for a total of ten people. Oumarou has been growing vegetables for ten years. He buys his supplies from local markets.

Oumarou will use his loan to buy two boxes of tomato seed and two boxes of parsley seed. His earnings will help his family and pay for schooling for his children. One day, he hopes to become a large-scale vegetable grower.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of tomato seed and 2 boxes of parsley seed.

loans.name: Nahartenga Group

texts.fr:
Mr MAHAMOUDOU est responsable du groupe NAHARTENGA. Il est marié et père de 10 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20 ans et le moins âgé a 08 mois.  04 enfants vont à l’école et il a 12 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l’agriculture et pratique aussi l’élevage et le jardinage depuis plus de 05 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 10 sacs d’engrais, 05 boîtes de graines et 01 carton d'herbicide.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Il ambitionne  acheter une parcelle construite.
texts.en:
Mahamoudou is the Nahartenga Group's representative. He is married and the father of 10 children. The oldest is 20, and the youngest is 8 months old. Four children go to school, and he supports twelve people.

He is a farmer and has also been raising livestock and gardening for over five years. He purchases supplies at the nearby markets.

With the money received, he intends to purchase 10 bags of fertilizer, 5 boxes of seed, and 1 box of herbicide.

He would like to use the profits from the loan to increase his business. He hopes to purchase a developed piece of land.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of fertilizer, 5 boxes of seed, and 1 box of herbicide.

loans.name: Tugce

texts.en:
Tuğçe is single. When she was a student she gained her own money and also supported her family financially by selling cosmetics and cleaning products through a network system. She graduated as a teacher she was not assigned for a school so she kept on working for the network system. She used loan for three times. With the help of the loans she bought bulks of products, sold them, gained money. With the help of this new loan she is planning to buy cosmetics and cleaning products in bulk, sell them and develop her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Tuğçe hanım bekar. Öğrencilik yıllarında netwörk sistemiyle kozmetik ve temizlik ürünleri satışı yaparak ekonomik destek sağlamış aileye, okul bittikten sonra öğretmen olarak mezun olmuş fakat atanamadığı için netwörk sisteminde çalışmaya devam etmiş. Üç kez mikro kredi kullandı. Aldığı mikro kredi ile kozmetik ve temizlik malzemelerini toptan alarak ve satarak para kazandı. Yeni aldığı mikro kredi ile de toptan temizlik ve kozmetik ürünleri alarak satarak işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic and cleaning products

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone.

As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members, and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Noyaa 1 Group

texts.en:
These members belong to the Noyaa 1 Group from Teshie branch, which is located in the northern part of Accra in Ghana. They are into the sale of jersey, saucepans, cooking bowls, local chewing sponge, waakye (cooked local rice and beans), slippon, rice, beans and gari (cassava flour).

Eva is one of the members. She is 42 years old, married, and has one dependent child. She has worked by selling waakye, (cooked local rice and beans) for 10 years now. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 12 afternoon. Eva has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. She wakes up at 4:00 a.m., sets the fire and cooks the rice and beans together and prepares stew to eat with it.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy ingredients for cooking rice and beans, and also vegetables to prepare stew to sell to her customers. Therefore, she promises to complete her repayments according to the established terms. This is her 10th loan cycle with ID-Ghana and 3rd with Kiva.

Therefore, she promises to complete her repayments according to the established terms. This is her 10th loan cycle with ID-Ghana and 3rd with kiva.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking rice and beans, and also vegetables to prepare stew to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Safiya is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone.

As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Safiya would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Safiya will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season, when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize, at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Safiya now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yield

loans.name: Zayya

texts.en:
Zayya is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Zayya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Zayya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Zayya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Zayya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Zayya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Halliru

texts.en:
Halliru is a Babban Gona maize farmer. As a Babban Gona member, Halliru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Halliru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Halliru will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay selling it until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Halliru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Halliru hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en:
Inusa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Inusa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Inusa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Inusa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Inusa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Inusa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yaú

texts.en:
Yaú is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Yaú has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yaú would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Yaú can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yaú will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Yaú is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Legbawe  Abidé

texts.fr: Legbawe est une femme mariée âgée de 42 ans résidante à Tokoin. Mère de trois enfants, Legbawe est une restauratrice de riz qui expose des jouets pour enfants et des biscuits à côté de sa marchandises à la devanture de son domicile. Legbawe s’approvisionne du nécessaire deux fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt, spécialement pour commander des sachets de jouets et des cartons de biscuits. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Legbawe compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider ses enfants à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Legbawe, age 42, is a married mother of three children and a resident of Tokoin. She is a rice cooker and also sells children's toys and cookies next to her food in front of her house. She buys merchandise and supplies twice a month at the market, and she is seeking this loan specifically to purchase cartons of cookies and bags of toys.

Legbawe will use her profits to improve her sales performance, and to ensure that her children thrive and get a good education.

loans.use: to buy 11 cartons of cookies and 10 bags of children's toys.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Suzana has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Suzana would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Suzana can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Suzana will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

She is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family, and she looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.fr: Lydia est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec ses quatre enfants à charge. Agée de 37 ans, Lydia est une femme dynamique et courageuse  qui vend du maïs sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile afin de disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Lydia s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs afin de financer son activité et trouver un bon rendement pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire des enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman who lives in Tokoin with four children in her care. Aged 37 years old, Lydia is a dynamic and brave woman who sells corn under a canopy in front of her home in order to have a good financial capacity.

To reach her goals, Lydia gets her supplies twice per month at the market. She would like this loan to order bags of corn to finance her activity and earn a good return to provide for her daily needs and help her husband to pay the children's school fees for the new school term.

loans.use: to buy two bags of corn.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor de 45 años de edad, tiene 30 años de habitar en vivienda propia en donde vive al lado de su compañera de vida y sus hijos de 14 y 19 años de edad. Víctor es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador que en busca de mantener la economía del hogar y que a su familia no le falte nada, se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas. Actividad que realiza desde hace 20 años, y lo que le permite que a estas alturas sea muy reconocido por los comerciantes, y estos lo prefieran para comprar sus productos. Este trabajo es el medio principal con el cual Víctor logra satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia, y así también es el medio con el cual poco a poco busca mejorar su calidad de vida. Ya que gracias a un crédito que adquirió anteriormente logró construir un cuarto  en su propiedad. Y por lo que hoy solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cables eléctricos, poliductos, tomacorrientes, y demás accesorios necesarios para la instalación de la energía eléctrica en su cuarto. De esta manera ofrecerle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is 45 years old and has lived in his own house for 30 years. He lives with his life's companion and their children, ages 14 and 19. Victor, a very responsible man and worker who seeks to maintain their household economy, assuring that his family lacks nothing, dedicates his efforts to raising vegetables, which he has done for 20 years. As a result, he is widely known among local merchants, and they prefer to buy their vegetables from him. This work is Victor's principal way of satisfying his family's basic necessities, and also the means whereby, little by little, he attempts to improve their quality of life.

Thanks to a loan he acquired earlier, Victor has constructed a new room on his house. And that's why, today, he is soliciting a new loan through FUSAI, to invest in electrical cables, wiring, outlets, and other accessories needed for installing electric energy in the new room.

In this manner, Victor will be able to offer a better condition of life to his family.

loans.use: invest in electric cables, wiring, outlets, and other accessories necessary for installing electric energy in the new room in his home.

loans.name: Tala Emmy

texts.en: Tala Emmy is a 35 years old married woman with 4 children. She runs a small business selling donuts,chicken roll, sausage roll, pie, drinks and more in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Tala Emmy has requested a loan to  buy a  bags of flour, a baking soda, bags of chicken legs, vegetable oil, a fryer and a bag of onions. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tala Emmy will expand her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a  bags of flour, a baking soda, bags of chicken legs, vegetable oil, a fryer and a bag of onions

loans.name: Iress

texts.en:
Fishing is one of the most common livelihoods in some areas of the Philippines. Iress and her husband are undertaking this livelihood to sustain the needs of their family.

They are blessed with a 14-year-old daughter, who is the center of their lives and their inspiration to work harder each day.

Iress is asking for a loan to buy fishing net that can help her and her husband enhance their catch. She wants to improve their livelihood in the future so as to have enough money to send their daughter to college and finish a degree.

With the help of the money we entrust to her, we certainly hope this woman and her family reach their goal.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Marecel

texts.en:
Marecel is 40 years old and married with two children.  With two children in school, Marecel works very hard to provide for them.

Marecel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Marecel has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Marecel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Memrafi

texts.en:
Memrafi is a married woman with no kids. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
Memrafi has operated a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 23-year-old single young man from Ajloun city. His father is retired and receives only a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Husam is a student in the university where he studies applied physics. He wants to get the degree and find a job in the future to support his family.

He applied for a loan that will help him pay the university fees for the semester. With this loan, Husam will be able to register in the university for his last year.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the semester

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang, 46, lives with family members in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is still in school and other one is too young. For a living, she has grown rice as her main source of her income for 26 years. She also works as a labor for others to supplement her income. The insects have destroyed her rice, so her rice did not give her good yield.
This is her fifth cycle with VisionFund and she wisely paid back her past loans on time. Her rice has grown well with her previous loans. She will spend her loan portion to buy more fertilizer to input her rice farm in order to gain good yield than last year. She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her farmland and to upgrade her lifestyle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to input her rice farm to get higher yield to sell in order to improve her family's living.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is 37 years old and she is married. She has four dependent children, two of whom are in school and the remaining two are too young for schooling. She is growing rice to earn main source of income and works for others for a fee to add more income. She earns about USD10 per day and can save approximately about USD8 each day for future needs.
She decides to form a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields; she hopes she can generate more income to meet her dreams of improve the standard of living and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields to improve the standard of living and to keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Micah has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Micah would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Micah can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Micah will benefit from this marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile est une femme mariée âgée de 46 ans résidante à Adidogomé. Sans enfant, Cécile est une revendeuse des céréales qu’elle s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar au marché également. Cécile désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs et des bols du haricot. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Cécile compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement.
texts.en:
Cécile is 46 years old, married, and lives in Adidogomé. She has no children.

Cécile works selling cereals, which she procures six times a month from the market. She makes her resales in the same market.

Cécile is seeking this loan to make an order of corn and beans.

With her profits, Cécile plans to improve her point of sale and help her family develop in a good way.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of corn and 19 baskets of beans.

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Célibataire et sans enfant, Enyonam est une femme vivant à Adidogomé. Agée de 30 ans, Enyonam est une marchande de pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché.  Enyonam revend les pagnes en parcourant les quartiers pour gagner son revenu. Enyonam sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pagnes en vue d'avoir plus d'épargne et bien relancer son activité pour subvenir à ses charges quotidiennes.
texts.en: Unmarried and without children, Enyonam is a woman who lives in Adidogomé. 30 years old, Enyonam earns a living through selling traditional pagne cloth which she purchases twice monthly from market and sells as a street vendor in her local area. She is requesting this loan to purchase pagne cloth so she can generate more savings and rekindle her business to pay for her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase eight pieces of traditional pagne cloth

loans.name: Djigbodi

texts.fr: Agée de 31 ans, Djigbodi est une veuve femme  qui vit à Tonkoin avec un enfant à charge. Djigbodi est une revendeuse de foyers qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route. Djigbodi demande ce prêt pour commander des unités de foyers à charbon et des pierres à écraser. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Djigbodi va pouvoir aider son enfant dans son éducation scolaire puis prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en:
Djigbodi, age 31, is a widow who lives in Tonkoin with a dependent child. She sells stoves that she buys twice a month at the market. She conducts her sales by the roadside.

Djigbodi is seeking this loan to purchase charcoal stoves and crushing stones.

She will use her profits to to support her child's academic education and meet her family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 9 charcoal stoves and 10 crushing stones.

loans.name: Bader

texts.en:
Bader is a 28-years-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small house. The family has a Physiotherapy Center. It is a very good business and all the family cooperate together to the success of the business.

Bader has excellent experience in physical therapy and so he took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a new apparatus for massage. This investmen will help them to increase the customer and also the income. With the increase in income, Bader and his family hope to open another branch in the city . Bader appears in the photo

loans.use: order to buy a new apparatus for massage, in his family run physiotherapy center

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer has owned her business since January of this year. When she started her business, she was confident she could use what she has learned from years of working for other people to make her business succeed. She is the owner of Lumena Beauty Lounge, an aesthetic laser spa located in Cobble Hill and Park Slope in Brooklyn, New York. Through her business, Jennifer offers facials, laser hair removal, chemical exfoliation, and skin tightening.

Jennifer feels fortunate to be able to provide pro-bono services to underprivileged women who want to look their best as they re-enter the workforce. Her biggest obstacle so far has been struggling with creating an emergency fund for her business in the event that equipment repairs become necessary. Jennifer is currently seeking a loan to upgrade her website and to produce promotional materials. She would also like to upgrade her machinery, which will allow her to increase her menu of services by 30 percent.

Jennifer's vision for the future is to hire two new technicians in the upcoming year and possibly move into a larger location. She is also passionate about lobbying for her industry’s safety standards.

loans.use: to upgrade her website and purchase machinery that will increase services on the business menu by 30 percent.

loans.name: Nielfred

texts.en: Nielfred is a 32-year-old man from Clarin, Bohol. He is married with six young children. His oldest child is 15 years old while his youngest child is two years old. He earns a living through buying and selling coconuts. He has been doing this business for two years. He is asking a loan to buy more coconuts to sell. In the future, he wishes to improve his business to uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy coconuts

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
The loan amount that Jason applied previously and was approved by Center for Community Transformation (CCT) made a vast impact on his internet café business. He was able to purchase additional computer unit which in return improved the daily earnings of the business as they can now accompany more customers. He wants to thank God and all of the lenders who helped him with her previous loan. 

Jason is thankful for the past 10 years of operating this business that he’s able to gain loyal customers and earns to approximately Php 18,000 every month. He dreams to invest for his own house and lot someday so that he’ll not anymore rent for a space and a have bigger internet café to manage. He applies again for a new loan worth  Php 50,000. He will use the amount to buy another unit of computer and hopes that his request will be granted once more.

On a weekly basis, Jason regularly meets with his co-fellowship members to share his life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional computer unit for his internet cafe business.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to expand and open other branches within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Delu

texts.en:
Delu is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Delu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Delu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, she can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Delu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Delu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family, and she looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mai Anguwa

texts.en:
Mai Anguwa is a maize farmer from Sarki village. As a Babban Gona member, Mai Anguwa is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mai Anguwa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Mai Anguwa will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Mai Anguwa no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Mai Anguwa hopes to realize better yields, and he plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kakale

texts.en:
Kakale is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Kakale has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Kakale would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Kakale can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Kakale will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Kakale is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a better house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare, Yohanna now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members. He would like to use this additional income to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Idris has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Idris would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Idris can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Idris will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Idris is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sora

texts.en:
Sora is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 55 years old and has two children who are in school.

Sora has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell.

Sora has been in this business for three years. In the future, Sora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and has six children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins to raise her pigs.

Elizabeth has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 50 years old and single with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products and other groceries.

Fe has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a maize farmer from Maidawa village. As a member of Babban Gona, Hajara is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hajara would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hajara can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Hajara is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family, and in the end, hopes to use her increased earnings to ensure that all her children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ummaru

texts.en:
Ummaru is a maize farmer from Bargi village. As a Babban Gona member, Ummaru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ummaru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Ummaru will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ummaru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Ummaru hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is grateful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) helped him monetarily by approving his previous loan of Php 35,000 and for all of the lenders as well. The amount was used to buy peripherals and maintenance of all his computer units resulting in bigger profit each day. Aside from his internet café, Ramon is also involved in a food vending business. He’s selling fresh meat for 5 years now.

Ramon perseveres in running those businesses to have enough savings for future purposes and to be successful in life as well. For this reason, he’s determined to make their sources of income grow and decided to apply for another loan of Php 30,000 for him to buy necessities for his internet café and also to be used as revolving fund to buy fresh meats. 

Ramon has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where he hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made him to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his computer shop business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Food stall business requires patience. It’s not like office work that starts at 8:00am and ends at 5:00pm. Food stall operators go to market early to buy necessary ingredients, endure the heat while cooking, and defy their throbbing body pain after every day of work. 

Mercy, 46, embarked on small eatery as additional income generating venture. Her husband, Jun, is a laborer whose income doesn’t suffice for their family’s daily needs. Mercy cooks usual viands and snacks and sells it in front of her house, so she can earn extra money while taking care of her children. Her regular customers are her neighbors, the local community, students and working people. Profit derived from her business helps a lot in their daily expenditures but she still has to save better for her children’s education. 

Now she’s planning to cook more meal recipes to improve her income. She prays for PHP 15,000 additional capital that she will use this to buy raw ingredients like meat, fish, seafood, vegetables, seasonings and condiments for her eatery. May you be a channel of blessings to her as she aspires to enhance her business.

Mercy would be happy to see her children finish their schooling to get a better chance to land stable jobs someday. She gives importance to harmonious relationship among her family members. She is an inspiration to her co-fellowship* members at CCT who regularly meet every week to reflect of God’s Words and share stories about life and their businesses. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meat, fish, seafood, vegetables, seasonings and condiments for her eatery

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 39 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Genelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Genelyn has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Genelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: İlknur

texts.en:
İlknur is married and a mother of four. She is running a meerschaum products store together with her husband. She buys raw meerschaum, processes them and sells them in her store. İlknur has had a loan for four times, when she bought bulk raw meerschaum, processed and sold them and gained money. With the help of her new loan she is planning to buy bulk raw meerschaum, make her jewellery, process them, make money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
İlknur hanım evli dört çocuk annesi. Eşi ile beraber lületaşı dükkanı işletiyor. Dükkana ürünleri lületaşını işlenmemiş olarak alıyor ve işleyerek koyuyor. İlknur hanım dört kez mikro kredi kullandı lületaşını işlenmemiş olarak aldı işledi ve satarak para kazandı. Aldığı yeni mikro kredi ile lületaşını ham olarak alacak ve işleyerek işlerini geliştirmeyi düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy raw meerschaum to process in her workshop.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a Babban Gona farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Mathew would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan, Mathew can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Mathew has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare.

Mathew is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to increase his farmland and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:

With the help of this loan, Yusuf can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Yusuf will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Yusuf is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Markus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Esther has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Esther would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Esther can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Esther will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare.

Esther is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Las Canelitas De La I Group

texts.es: SOLEDAD de 27 años de edad es soltera y tiene 2 hijos dependientes. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “las CANELITAS DE LA I” la cual lo conforman 06 socias con deseos de  trabajar honradamente y progresar. Ella hace más de 3 años que trabaja como empaquetadora de canela y otros insumos más. Gracias a su constante dedicación logro sacar adelante a  su familia. Su mayor deseo es de poder terminar de construir su casita. Es por ello que Solicitó el crédito para la compra de cemento y ladrillos. La Alcancía “las canelitas de la i” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo y se comprometen a seguir trabajando honradamente. Soledad es la segunda del lado izquierdo se encuentra sentada y viste polo  color negro.
texts.en:
Soledad is 27 years old. She is single and has 2 dependent children. She is part of the communal bank "Las Canitas de la I", which is formed by 6 partners wishing to work honestly and to progress. She has been working for the last 3 years as a packer of cinnamon and other consumables. Thanks to her constant dedication she has been able to get her family ahead. Her biggest dream is to finish the construction of her little house. It's because of this that she requested the loan to buy cement and bricks. 

The communal bank "Las Canitas de la I" thanks the Kiva investors for their support and they are committed to keep working honestly. Soledad is the second from the left. She is seated and wears a black t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 39 years old. She is married with two children. She has had a school business for 10 years. She will be using the loan to expand classes and hopes this will help her build the school and become bigger to accommodate more students . Her hopes and dreams for the future are to run her school successfully.

loans.use: to expand her school to help her increase to other classes.

loans.name: Cecilia De Las Mercedes

texts.es: Cecilia de 36 años de edad, vive al lado de sus hijos de 16, 8 años y sus hijas de 11 y 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que con el fin de ofrecer todo lo necesario a sus hijos ha instalado un pequeño negocio de venta de productos básicos del hogar y también venta de sandalias. Cecilia en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: sopas, especias, salsas, golosinas, y más sandalias para aumentar los productos de su negocio y de esta manera aumentar las ventas. Ya que este es el medio con el cual ella saca adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 36 years old and lives close to her sons who are 16 and 8 years-old and her daughters who are 11 and 4 years-old. She is a working woman that, with the goal of offering all necessities to her children, has installed a small business selling basic home products as well as sandals. 

Cecilia is looking to improve her and her children's quality of life, and is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: soups, spices, salsas, candies and more sandals to increase her business' products and therefore increase sales. This is the way she gets her family ahead.

loans.use: to invest in: soups, spices, salsas, candies and more sandals to increase her business' products and therefore increase sales.

loans.name: Sapi

texts.en: Sapi is a 64 years old woman who is married with 10 children. She runs a business sewing and painting clothes in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business.Sapi has requested a loan to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, elei boards and design. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and support her family. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, elei boards and designs

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer from Madaki village. As a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Musa is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Musa will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% above the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Musa no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices.

With the opportunity to earn up to USD 2,000 per hectare, Musa hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yusuph

texts.en:
Yusuph, who is in his mid 30s is single with no children. He has been running a business of video productions and selling CDs for three years now. He works from 08am to 07pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on the video production products and increased on the CD stock. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to reinvest in business, to repay loan, to take care of himself and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to improve on his video production and to buy and sell CD. He dreams of owning a stationary business.

Yusufu will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to improve on his video production and to buy and sell CD's.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when her can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Maryamu now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to diversify her farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona Farmers Organization member.

Anticipating of a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it at a future date, for up to 37% above the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to USD 2,000 per hectare.

Ibrahim is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community, through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Elvis Arturo

texts.es:
Elvis con con 23 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Nueva Arica, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y venta de animales de corral.

Elvis se dedica a brindar los servicios agrícolas de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, como mochila de fumigar, palana, pico y oz; con más de 05 años de experiencia en el negocio. Solicita préstamo para arreglos de vivienda y para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; con dicho préstamo piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los habitantes de la zona.

Socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido dos créditos de 800,00 y 1000,00 los cuáles los ha cancelado de manera puntual desde que se convirtió en socio de nosotros, su negocio ha mejorado y su calidad de vida de igual forma.
texts.en:
Elvis is 23 years old and has a partner. He lives with his spouse and children in the district of Nueva Arica, which is located in Chiclayo province in the department of Lambayeque, Peru. The inhabitants of this area mostly make a living from agriculture, trade, and the sale of corral animals.

Elvis works as a day laborer in the farming sector. He has his own tools, such as a backpack sprayer, shovel, pickax, and scythe, and he has five years of experience in this work. He is requesting the loan in order to make repairs to his home and maintain his equipment and tools. This investment will help him to keep his equipment and tools in better condition, which will be very helpful for his work. With this loan, he hopes to increase his productivity and thereby be able to meet the different needs of the inhabitants of the area.

He is an existing borrower with Edpyme Alternativa. He has had two loans, in the amounts of 800 PEN and 1,000 PEN, which he has paid off on time. Since he became a member of Edpyme Alternativa, his business has improved and his quality of life has also improved.

loans.use: to make repairs to his home and maintain his equipment and tools

loans.name: Akaber

texts.en:
Akaber is a 21-year-old single lady who lives in a region in Jordan called Ramtha, which is really affected by the Syrian refugee crisis that they have. She is very talented and ambitious and seeks to graduate and work in her field as soon as possible.

Akaber is applying for an educational loan to pay for her university tuition fees to study to be a class teacher.
Akaber is in her third year and is looking forward to graduating within one year and half.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees for a degree in Teaching

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is maize farmer from Yanoko village. As a member of Babban Gona, he is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, he would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Garba can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. Garba is grateful to be a part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is a 24-years-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small house. The family has a store for selling and installation of marble and granite. It is a very good business and all the family cooperate together in the work. Ayman is learning how to sell and operate the business and so he took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a new goods of marble and granite for the family store. This investment in inventory will help them to increase the sales and also the income.  With the increase in income, Ayman and his family hope to expert there goods outside palestine.  Ayman appears in the photo

loans.use: in order to buy a new goods of marble and granite for the family store

loans.name: Hayrapet

texts.en:
Hayrapet has been providing auto repair works in rented garage in the center of Kapan town, southern part of Armenia. Hayrapet lives with his wife who is a teacher by profession. 
Hayrapet got opportunity to start his business three years ago, and thanks to his hard work, the service he provides is demanded among people in the community. 
Hayrapet asks this loan to purchase tire changer needed for his auto repair works to make the work efficient and gather more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for tire changer needed for his auto repair works to make the work efficient and gather more income for his family

loans.name: Kishwer

texts.en: Kishwer owns a small yet developing school that has been operational since the past 20 years. There are 250 students in her school today 57% out of whom are female. Recently she requested for Rs 130,000 with the aim to improve the school infrastructure via construction and renovation.' Quality education is expensive in our country', says Kishwer. 'My aim is to make it affordable'

loans.use: to improve the school infrastructure via construction and renovation.

loans.name: Sariah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Sariah, one of Ruma's agents. Sariah lives in Cilegon, located about a two-hour drive from Jakarta. Sariah lives there with her husband and her children (two sons and two daughters). She owns a stall where she sells mobile airtime credits, and small snacks and drinks for her community. She wanted to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business in another sector, as well as give more contributions to her community.

With support and encouragement from Ruma’s staff, now Sariah sees a lot of improvements in her business. As the business grows, she is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits for her community. Because of its importance, your loan will be very useful to help Sariah improve her business and, accordingly, her community members who need access to such services. Sariah is the one who is seen in the photo; she will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 45 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, dried fish, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Milagros has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, dried fish, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:

As a Babban Gona member, Yohanna is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sylvia is 49 years old and has three children who are in school.

Sylvia has a buy-and-sell personal care product business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like perfumes, accessories, etc.

Sylvia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Sylvia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like perfumes, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Metala

As a Babban Gona member, Metala is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan is a Babban Gona farmer. Usually he would have to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this 23,348 NGN loan Alhassan can store his maize once harvested and sell it at a later date at a price up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Kiva's field partner Babban Gona’s marketing support, he has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to 2000 USD per hectare.

Alhassan is grateful that Babban Gona will be giving him a lasting solution to ending his cycle of poverty and renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. He is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to feed his family and children, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get university educations.

loans.use: store his maize immediately after harvest, then sell it at a later date at a higher price.

loans.name: Jibrin

texts.en:
Jibrin is a Babban Gona farmer. Usually he would have to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this 18,679 NGN loan Jibrin can store his maize once harvested and sell it at a later date at a price up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Kiva's field partner Babban Gona’s marketing support, he has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to 2000 USD per hectare.

Jibrin is grateful that Babban Gona will be giving him a lasting solution to ending his cycle of poverty and renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. He is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to store his maize immediately after harvest, then sell it at a later date at a higher price.

loans.name: Eugenia Maria

texts.es: Eugenia,es madre soltera, tiene 48 años de edad, que vive con sus 2 hijos en una colonia del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara.
