Ella con sus hijos se dedican a la crianza de ganado vacuno desde hace ya 5 años donde ofrecen productos lácteos y también ganado el cual tiene  una buena venta en su comunidad, antes en el mismo terreno se dedicaban al cultivo de café, pero los lácteos y carnes tienen una mayor venta en el sector donde ella vive. El prestamo que ha solicitado a ODEF es el segundo ciclo y es por 18,000.00 Lempiras con el cual va adquirir ganado (3 novillos) ya que es una excelente forma de seguir creciendo y aumentar su cantidad de ganado para una mayor producción. Su meta es ser una gran ganadera, aumentar su negocio, mejorar la condición de su ganado y darles un mejor nivel de vida  a sus hijos.
texts.en: Eugenia is a single mother who is 48 years old.  She lives with her 2 children in a neighborhood of the municipality of Azacualpa, in the department of Santa Barbara.  With her children, she has been raising cattle for 5 years.  She sells dairy products and also cows, and she does well with her sales in the community.  Before, with the same land, she used to cultivate coffee.  However, dairy products and meat are in greater demand in the area where she lives.  She is requesting a loan to start her 2nd loan cycle with ODEF.  With the 18,000 Honduran lempiras she is requesting, she will buy 3 steers.  This is an excellent way for her to continue to grow her business and expand her holdings of cattle to increase her production.  Eugenia's goal is to become a great cattle rancher.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada y su esposo realiza cultivos de maíz y frijol, tienen dos hijos y ninguno vive con ellos, debido a que ya se independizaron y formaron sus propias familias, económicamente solo su esposo depende de ella. 

Reina, se dedica al destazo de pollos desde hace 10 años, una amiga fue quien le enseño y los habitantes la prefieren por su amabilidad y buen producto, su negocio lo realiza en la casa y comienza a destazar a las 4:00 a.m. y termina a las 7:00 a.m. posteriormente sale a comercializarlo a la ciudad. 

Reina, necesita el préstamo para comprar más pollos para su negocio y mejorar las instalaciones donde destaza, con ello espera mejorar sus ingresos y poder brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. 

Reina, sueña con tener mejores instalaciones de crianza, para poder criar los pollos ella misma, debido a que actualmente los compra grandes para destazarlos, también quiere poder ampliar más su casa, con la ayuda del crédito ella espera poder aumentar sus ventas y las ganancias invertirlas en el negocio y su familia.
texts.en:
Reina has a 9th grade education.  She is married, and her husband farms corn and beans.  They have 2 children, neither of whom live with them because they are independent and have formed their own families.  Financially, only her husband depends upon her.

Reina has had a business slaughtering chickens for 10 years.  A friend taught her the business, and the residents in her area prefer her business because of her friendliness and good products.  She carries out her business on her property.  She starts slaughtering chickens at 4am, and finishes at 7am.  Later, she goes out to sell chicken in the city.

Reina needs a loan to buy more chickens for her business, and to improve her business premises.  With this investment, she hopes to increase her income and provide her family with better living conditions.

Reina dreams of having a better corral to raise chickens in, because at this time she buys the chickens fully grown just to slaughter them.  She also wants to expand her house.  With the help of this loan, she hopes to increase her sales and invest the earnings in her business and her family.

loans.use: to invest in her chicken business

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona Farmers Organization member.

Anticipating a good harvest this season, Samaila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Samaila can store his maize and sell it at a future date, for up to 37% above the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to USD 2,000 per hectare.

Samaila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, he would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Garba anticipates a good harvest this season of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. With the help of this 8,766 NGN loan, he will store his maize, sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest and make himself a healthy profit. As a Babban Gona member, he will thus benefit from its marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2000 USD per hectare.

Garba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to store his maize immediately after harvest, then sell it at a future date at a higher price.

loans.name: Kabiru Tall Man

texts.en:
Kabiru Tall Man is a maize farmer and Babban Gona Farmers Organization member.

Anticipating a good harvest this season, Kabiru Tall Man has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru Tall Man would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Kabiru Tall Man can store his maize and sell it at a future date, for up to 37% above the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru Tall Man will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to USD 2,000 per hectare.

Kabiru Tall Man is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that each of his children gets a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aliyu	Alhaji

texts.en:
Aliyu Alhaji is a maize farmer and Babban Gona Farmers Organization member.

Anticipating a good harvest this season, Aliyu Alhaji has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Aliyu Alhaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Aliyu Alhaji can store his maize and sell it at a future date, for up to 37% above the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Aliyu Alhaji will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to USD 2,000 per hectare.

Aliyu Alhaji is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community, through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kady's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré le 13 décembre 2011, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre leurs petit commerce plus rentables. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe.
 
Madame Kady, âgée de 38 ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants et  s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sceaux de 15 kg de patte d’arachide à 12000f l’un, 02 sacs de sucre à 22500f l’un du thé d’un montant de 14000f de l’huile de palme d’un montant de 55000f et payer un transport de 9000f pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et participer a la gestion de la dépense quotidienne
texts.en:
This banc villageois has been created on December 13, 2011. It is composed of women from the same village who have joined the program in order to improve the profitability of their vending business. The group meetings always take place in a friendly atmosphere. 

Ms. Kady, 38 years old (the one on the far right raising her right hand in the photo) is the star borrower of the group. She is married, has three children, and works selling food products. With her loan, she plans to buy two 15-kg [33 lbs] pails of peanut paste at 12,000 West African francs each; two bags of sugar at 22,500 francs each;  tea for 14,000 francs; and palm oil for 55,000 francs. She will also cover  transportation costs of 9,000 francs in order to resell her wares at retail prices in her neighborhood. Thanks to her revenues, she plans to improve the life conditions of her family and help provide for everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy two 15-kg [33 lbs] pails of peanut paste; two bags of sugar;  tea; and palm oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman and staying together with her husband and one child. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Vaiola

texts.en:
Vaiola is a 31-year-old mother with 1 child. She runs and operates a small business of selling pancakes, buns, and pork cakes in her community to earn a living.

Vaiola requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, a bottle of vegetable oil and plastic bags, to assist her in running the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, a bottle of vegetable oil and plastic bags.

loans.name: Nella

texts.en: Nella is a 30 years old married woman with 3 children. She plans to start a small business, planting and selling vegetables in her community for a living. Nella needs a loan to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer and vegetable seeds. She will use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. Nella joined SPBD on September this year 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Sunna

texts.en:
Sunna landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bust.

PMPC came to Sunna's rescue, lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she requested another loan for the next crop season. The loan amount is for land and seedbed preparation. Sunna perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nabela

texts.en:
Nabela is a 55 year-old from Khan younis, mother for one daughter. She has a monthly salary from a pension fund but it doesn't cover all her family needs. A few months ago, Nabela started complaining of pain in her back. She went to the doctor and he told her she needs surgery as soon as possible.

Nabela took a USD loan from FATEN which enables her to have the surgery. Nabela wishes to regain her health and continue daily activities as normal.

loans.use: to have back surgery.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona farmer. Ibrahim is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan, Ibrahim can store his maize at harvest time and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest time.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Ibrahim has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per harvest. Ibrahim is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Wawan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet Wawan, one of Ruma agents. He lives in South Bogor with his wife and his only child. South Bogor is only about one hour and thirty minutes from Jakarta, the capital city on Indonesia. He feels happy because since he was joining Ruma, he learnt how to improve his business. He feels that he can give good contribution to his community through his small business as well.

He owns a stall where he sells mobile airtime credits to his community. As the business runs, Wawan needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community. As seen in the photo, Wawan is the one who is standing in front of his own small stall. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 48-year-old mother with 4 children. She runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living.

Telesia requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves, to help her run the business. She will use her profits to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Levaai

texts.en:
Levaai is a 28-year-old mother with 1 child. She runs a business of providing transportation services to people to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Levaai requested a loan to buy seat covers, paint, new windows, and new wheels, to help her maintain good service. She will use her profit to buy another taxi. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy seat covers, paint, new windows, and new wheels.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 24-year-old mother with 3 children. She runs a business of providing transportation (taxi) services to people to earn a living.

Pauline requested a loan to buy car wash chemicals, seat covers, paint, new windows, new wheels, and air freshener, to help her maintain good service. She will use her profit to buy another taxi. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy car wash chemicals,  seat covers, paint, new windows, new wheels, and air freshener.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en:
Aliitasi is a 48-year-old mother with 5 children. She runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years.

Aliitasi requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro roots  (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, awater tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Las Amigas Del 22 Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 5 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “LAS AMIGAS DEL 22” una de ellas es la Sra. Aquila de 65 años casada, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante Con su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su vivienda, apoyar a su familia y seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es mejorar su local donde pueda vender atender a más clientes. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más insumos (aceite, carne, etc.)y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez  la Ora. Aquila se encuentra sentada a la mano derecha y se le distingue con una casaca negral, se despide con un abrazo a Kiva y Edaprospo. Agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en: A group of five responsible people with distinct businesses. That describes the members of the communal bank "LAS AMIGAS DEL 22." One of the members is Señora Aquila. She is 65 years old and works selling kebabs every day with the goal to get ahead. With her effort, she has been able to improve her home, support her family, and continue improving her business. Her greatest wish is to improve her shop to where she can sell and attend to more customers. With the granted loan, she will invest in buying more supplies (oil, meat, etc) and in this way have more income. Señora Aquila is seated on the right hand side and is distinguished by a black dress coat. She gives a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo. She appreciates the provided loan since it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: Para comprar mas insumos (aceite, carne, etc.)

loans.name: Jose Ylden

texts.es:
José Ylden con 53 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, vive junto a su esposa e hijo, en el distrito de Oyotín, provincia Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican a la mayoría al cultivo de caña, comercio en general y ganadería.

José Ylden se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería-fumigación, contando con herramientas propias como mochila de fumigar, palana, pico y oz; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para la compra de equipos y herramientas nuevas. Jose Ylden piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.

Socio recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido 5 créditos de 1000,00; 1000,00; 1500,00; 1500,00 y 1500,00 los cuales los ha pagado de manera puntual. Desde que se convirtió en cliente de nosotros ha mejorado su negocio y su calidad de vida también. .
texts.en:
José Ylden is 53 years old, has a cohabiting marital status and has 1 son. He lives with his wife and son in the Oyotín district in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque department in Perú. The majority of inhabitants in this place work growing cane sugar, raising cattle and in general trade.

José Ylden works providing services as a day laborer in fumigation. He has his own tools, such as a fumigating backpack, shovel, pick and sickle. He has more than 10 years of experience in the business. The business is located in his own home. He requests the loan for home repairs and for maintaining his equipment and tools. Said investment will help him to keep his equipment and tools in better conditions and will have a great impact on the business. José Ylden wants to improve productivity in his services and thus be able to tend to the diverse needs of the customers in the area.

Recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has had 5 loans of 1,000, 1,000, 1,500, 1,500 and 1,500 which he has paid punctually. Since he became our client, his business has improved and his quality of life as well.

loans.use: para  la compra de equipos y herramientas nuevas.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan con 53 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia Jaén, departamento Cajamarca, país Perú.Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Juan se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una bodega ubicada en su propio domicilio, cuenta con más de dos años de experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, contando con cultivos de yuca y maíz, así mismo se desempeña como peón agrícola.El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio en la compra de mercadería como aceite, arroz, azúcar, leche. Invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Socio recurrente en nuestra institución, este es su segundo crédito con nuestra entidad.
texts.en:
Juan is 53 years old, is in a common-law relationship, and lives together with his partner and two children in the district of Pomahuaca, in the province of Jaén, in the department of Cajamarca, in the country of Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the local people in the area. The majority of the residents of this area work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

Juan works in commerce. He has a small store located in his home, and has more than two years of experience in this line of work. Additionally, he works in agriculture, with his own yuca and corn crops, as well as working as a farm worker.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in his business with the purchase of merchandise such as oil, sugar, rice, milk. This investment will help him obtain an income that allows him to improve his quality of life. Juan is a recurring client at our institution, and this is his second loan with us.

loans.use: para invertir en el negocio en la compra de mercadería como aceite, arroz, azúcar, leche.

loans.name: Grupo Flores Group

texts.es:
En el Estado de México hay una comunidad mazahua llena de colores gracias a los campos verdes y las flores típicas de la región, es especial, los hermosos girasoles. Cualquiera que visite este lugar puede constatar la riqueza de la tierra y su detallada forma de hacer crecer la vegetación. Los habitantes son personas muy amables y trabajadoras, totalmente dedicadas al campo; su cultivos son el maíz, haba, frijol, etc. Además crían animales como cerdos, pavos, pollos, vacas, caballos etc.
   Paula es integrante de un grupo llamado Las Flores y se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, entregada al bienestar de su familia integrada por su esposo Apolinar y sus seis hijos de los cuales tres dependen de la pareja. Para satisfacer sus necesidades desde hace muchos años se ha dedicado a la cría de ganado, sobre todo aves de corral. “Anteriormente ya habíamos tenido ovejas pero su resistencia es más ligera que las gallinas o los pavos” comentó atentamente.  No obstante, pondrá todos sus esfuerzos para que las nuevas ovejas puedan crecer adecuadamente. Parte importante para retomar las actividades que habían suspendido son los apoyos que reciben de VFMéxico y KIVA.
   Así, con su préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de comprar más ganado y gracias a la experiencia previa podrá tener un cuidado más detallado sobre cada ejemplar para garantizar su óptimo desarrollo. De igual modo, podrá sembrar avena en su patio para que sus animales coman libremente cuando lo necesiten. El sueño de Doña Pau, como le dicen de cariño, es hacer aumentar su producción  para que con las ganancias obtenidas puedan brindar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son: Juan quien invertirá en la compra de verduras; Maricela, Angelina, Braulio y Valentina harán lo propio con ovejas. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el centro del municipio, Paula es quien viste el suéter color verde.
texts.en:
In the state of Mexico there is a Mazahua community which is full of colour thanks to its green fields and flowers which are typical to the region, such as its beautiful sunflowers. It's a special place and anyone visiting it can see the richness of the land and the complexity of its plant life.

The people are very friendly and hard-working as well as being completely committed to the land. Their crops are maize, broad beans and beans but they also rear animals like pigs, turkeys, chickens, cows and horses.

Paula is a member of the group Las Flores and is know for being a hard-working woman, dedicated to the welfare of her family. Her family consists of her husband Apolinar and six children, three of which are dependents.

For many years, in order to get by, she has earned a living rearing livestock, especially poultry. "Previously, we had sheep but they have a lower resistance than chickens or turkeys" she said. However, she will put in all her effort to ensure that her new sheep develop healthily. An important part of re-starting the work that had been put on hold is the support they receive from VF Mexico and KIVA.

Therefore, with the loan she will have the opportunity to buy more livestock and, thanks to previous experience, will be able to give better care to each animal in order to ensure its optimum development. She will also be able to put oats in her yard in order to allow her animals to eat freely when they need to.

Pau, as they call her lovingly, has the dream to increase production so that the profits can provide a better future for her children.

The other group members are: John who will buy vegetables; Maricela, Angelina, Brad and Valentina who will also rear sheep.

* The photograph was taken in the centre of town and Paula is the one wearing the green sweater.

loans.use: para comprar más ganado

location.town: San Felipe del Progreso, Estado de México

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: Jose de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace 8 años a la albañilería y gracias a su trabajo es como ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, el esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar piochas, sierras, pulidora, una carreta, etc. y asi tener mas herramientas para continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 42 years old and lives in his own house with his family. He has been working in construction for eight years and, thanks to his work, has been able to move forward with his family. 

He is requesting a loan to be able to buy axes, saws, a polishing machine, a cart, etc. so that he will have more tools to carry on working with, as this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy axes, saws, a polishing machine, a cart, etc.

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
Amancio con 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú, en una zona rural. Amancio cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Amancio se dedica a la crianzas de animales negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para arreglos de vivienda y para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.

Amancio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido dos créditos de 1000,00 y 1500,00 los cuales los ha cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Amancio at 38 years of age is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, Peru. They live in a rural area. Amancio has very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the district.

Amancio works raising animals and his business is located at his home. He is requesting a loan to make some house repairs and maintain his equipment and tools. This investment will help him to have his equipment and tools in better condition and have a great influence on his business. he is thinking of improving the productivity of his services to be better able to serve the various needs of the clients in the area.

Amancio is a repeat customer of Edpyme Alternativa. He has had loans of 1,000 PEN and 1500 PEN which he has paid off punctually.

loans.use: to make some house repairs and maintain his equipment and tools.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en: Hauwa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Hauwa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Hauwa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Hauwa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Hauwa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Hauwa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Shereen

texts.en:
Shereen is a 21-year-old single lady who lives in Mafraq with her family. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in press and media at a university in the city. Lately his father is facing financial problems because they live in the ‎most affected area in Jordan from Syrian refugee crisis.
Shereen is requesting a loan because she needs finances to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year. With the loan, she will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. For her future dreams, Shereen hopes to have a good job with a good salary.

loans.use: to pay her university fees, for her BA in Press and Media

loans.name: Syihabudin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Syihabudin, one of Ruma agents. Syihabudin lives in Cilegon, a city in West Java, about two hours drive from Jakarta. Syihabudin owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and provides mobile airtime credits for his community. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try another business opportunity, as well gave more contribution to his community. Syihabudin is a really hardworker person and his community sees him as a trusted mobile provider.
 
As the business grows, Syihabudin is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Syihabudin improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Syihabudin’s goal towards Ruma in near future is to add more services for his community, if the income capital already good enough to make another business. As seen in the photo, Syihabudin  is the one who is standing in front of his own stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Marc Joel

texts.en: Wood is considered to be very important in the Haitian economy. Around 500 thousand artisans work regularly with wood. Twenty formal enterprises are concentrated in Port-au-Prince, but small informal businesses are also operating and generating cash. One of these small businesses is H7 Boiserie Construction & Manufacture, a little workshop that produces home furniture. Marc Joel is from Jeremie, one of the most artistic and intellectual places in Haiti. After school, Marc Joel used to do crafts for leisure. At the age of 24, Marc Joel decided, as many other young people do, to move to Port-au-Prince in search of better living conditions. There, he stayed with his brother at Butte Boyer, an area in Tabarre, and launched his workshop. Today he has gained more clients and is credit-worthy. He has already repaid a similar loan amount from  Zafen. With this loan, he hopes to acquire the necessary tools to stimulate productivity, create jobs, and increase revenues.

loans.use: to purchase one plane and a design-drawing device to make his furniture

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta is a 54 year old mother with 4 children, she runs a convenience store in her village to earn a living. Imeleta requested for a loan to buy a freezer, box of twistiest , box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, to assist her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of twistiest , box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk,

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 53 years old and married with five children. Emelia works very hard to provide for them.

Emelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products .

Emelia has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future Emelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emelia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Emelia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, spices, cooking oil, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food production business.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, spices, cooking oil, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Konba Pou Lavi Miyo

texts.en:
Miliette is the leader of a rural group in Carrefour, a poor neighborhood in Port-au-Prince. She is 38 years old. After repaying their first loan in Zafen, Miliette's group has saved up to 10%. When compared to the rural population that is about 80% lacking sufficient subsistence to satisfy their basic needs, Miliette is hopeful. For instance, her group now is connected to a financial institution and they are able to benefit from other relevant services to ease their situation.

Pictured with Dieudonne (middle) and Leonne(right), Miliette is looking for another loan to buy used clothes in bulk to sell. The benefits will help her to do two things: generate income to take care of her dependents and increase her savings while participating in the progress of her group.

loans.use: To buy sacks of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Teresita is borrowing PHP 25000 through purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Delina Group

texts.en:
Mushi is in his early 40s is married with three children, one of them is still small and the other two are in school. He has been running a poultry business for twenty years now. He works from 06am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy chicks and chicken feeds to raise and sell as broilers chicken. He has paid back his loan successfully. He used the to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy chicks and chicken feeds. He dreams of becoming an international business man.

Mushi will share this loan with his loan group Delina which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Susa

texts.en: Susa and her husband are engaged in fishing business to earn a living. They have been doing this for 15 years to raise their children. They have four children, ages 20, 19, 15 and 10 years old. Susa is asking for a bigger amount of loans to help them buy new engine for their fishing boat. They need a new engine for their boat to have good condition so they may be able to enhance their catch. In the future, Susa wants to improve their livelihood to have enough money to send their children to school.

loans.use: to buy new engine for their fishing boat

loans.name: Los Emprendedores I Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Celina es socia del Grupo "Emprendedores I", grupo formado por cinco integrantes. Ella se dedica desde hace mas de quince años a la venta de pescado en un mercado con mucha concurrencia en la zona donde vive.
Desde muy joven empezó con este negocio el cual le ha permitido independizarse económicamente y cubrir sus gastos diarios, poco a poco y gracias a su esfuerzo de levantarse temprano para poder comprar el mejor pescado, el cargar peso para poder trasladarlo al mercado donde trabaja le ha servido para que crezca el negocio.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en compra de pescado y mariscos para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Celina is a member of the Emprendedores I group, which is made up of five members. For more than 15 years, she has sold fish at a well-attended market in the area where she lives.

She started this business when she was young and it has allowed her to become financially independent and cover her daily costs. Thanks to her effort, including getting up early to be able to buy the best fish and carry the weight to transport it to the market where she works, she has been able to grow her business.

She will use this loan to purchase fish and seafood to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Martina is 30 years old and has one child in school.

Martina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Martina requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to additional capital to buy fish for her fish vending.


Martina has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Martina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a single woman, 45 years old with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Chona has a bakery shop business in the Philippines. Chona requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, milk, cheese, sugar and other materials for her food production business.

Chona has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, milk, cheese, sugar and other materials for her bakery business.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Connie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell accessories business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell schools supplies and general store.  Connie is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to  buy more products of accessories like hair clip, nick lase, ring, earrings and other accessories to sell.

Connie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products of accessories like hair clip, nick lase, ring, earrings and other accessories to sell to her stall

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. Letecia is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edna is 47 years old and has one child still in school.

Edna has a buy and sell personal collection business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products of personal care like toothpaste, body lotion, beauty soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Edna has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products of personal care like toothpaste, body lotion, beauty soap, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Ayuba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Ayuba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Ayuba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Maryam has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Maryam would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Maryam can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Maryam will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Maryam is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Robin Ricardo

texts.es:
Robin Ricardo con 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Robin Ricardo cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, pesca y ganadería.

Robin Ricardo se dedica a prestar servicio como jornalero agrícola por zona de residencia y alrededores, desde hace más de 15 años. Su cónyuge se dedica a prestar servicio con elaboración y venta de comida en colegio de la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería para negocio de su cónyuge (compra de bebidas y otros).El crédito a otorgarle le facilitará obtener un mayor ingreso a su unidad familiar.

Robin Ricardo si cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio nuevo en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Robin Ricardo is 42 years old and lives with his partner and children in the Lagunas district of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of Peru. Robin Ricardo has many good references, both personal and occupational, from the inhabitants of the area. The majority of the residents here work in agriculture, fishing, and animal husbandry. 

Robin Ricardo has worked as an agricultural laborer in his place of residence and the surrounding area for over 15 years. His partner works in the preparation and sale of food at a local high school. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise for his partner's business (the purchase of beverages and other goods). Receiving this loan will help them earn more income for their family.

Robin Ricardo has experience with loans and is a new member of the institution Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his partner's business (the purchase of beverages and other goods)

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is a sari-sari store owner. She lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has two children; six years old boy and a three years old girl. Her husband provides the needs of their family through his salary as a cashier. Charlotte wishes to be a good mother to her children and a good wife to her husband, in such a way of giving them good education to her children and support to his husband financially.

Thus, she is asking a loan to help her improve her sari-sari store (general store) business. She plans to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, powdered milk, coffee, chips, biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, bread, powdered juice and drink. She will also buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil and sugar. Definitely, Charlotte has other business opportunities that help her increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, powdered milk, coffee, chips, biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Faletaaga

texts.en: Faletaaga is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She has a small plantations that grows cabbages,tomatoes,cucumbers etc to sell in the market to earn a living.She needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake. In the future, Faletaaga hopes to expand her business and to save more for her children's education . She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 52 years old and married with seven children, two children are still in school, Asuncion works very hard to provide for them.

Asuncion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products .

Asuncion has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Asuncion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Laázaru

texts.en:
Laázaru is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Laázaru is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Laázaru would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Laázaru will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Laázaru now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes per Hectare of Maize, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Samaila will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Samaila no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Samaila hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Zhyparbu

texts.ru: Жыпарбу, 61 год, замужем. У Жыпарбу- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец, лошадь. На 0,40 Га земли она выращивает картофель. Ежемесячная прибыль - 13,000 сом (KGS). Жыпарбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма. Доходы от кредита Жыпарбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zhyparbu is 61 and married.  She has a secondary education and she has been working as a farmer (raising livestock and growing crops) since 2000.  This farming activity constitutes her family's main source of income.  Today, Zhyparbu has two cows, 10 sheep and one horse on her farm.  She also grows potatoes on 0.4 hectares of land.  Zhyparbu's monthly income comes up to 13,000 som (KGS).

Zhyparbu has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum bank, and requested a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep for fattening.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Cavidan

texts.en:
Cavidan is 62 years old and a mother of three. For long years she sold underwear and cosmetics in order to make a contribution to the family budget. She continued her business after her children got married. With the help of the loan from MAYA she increased her profit by buying products in bulk.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Cavidan Hanım, 62 yaşında ve 3 çocuk annesi. Uzun yıllar aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamak için çamaşır ve kozmetik ürünler satmış. Cavidan Hanım Çocuklarını evlendirdikten sonra bile satışlarına devam etmiş. MAYA’dan aldığı kredi ile toptan ürün alarak karını arttırıyor.

loans.use: to buy underwear and cosmetics products

loans.name: Olmedo

texts.es:
Olmedo con 26 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive junto a su padre, en el distrito de San Felipe, provincia de Cajamarca, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de Lima el de mayor producción.

Olmedo se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con terreno propio en el Caserío Ñuruñupe, donde cuenta con una finca de lima frutera, la cuál se encuentra en buen estado, cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, dichos terrenos los adquirió por herencia de su padre. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de pan llevar como son maíz,yuca, fréjol,etc. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el negocio, compra de abonos para su finca mencionada ,así poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Olmedo es socio recurrente,este es su segundo crédito con nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Olmeda is 26, single and lives with his father in San Felipe District, Cajamarca Province, Cajamarca Department, Peru. The majority of residents in this area make their living in agriculture with limes being the main crop. 

Olmeda makes his living in agriculture. He has his own land in the village of Ñuruñupe where he has a lime orchard. It is in good condition and he has more than 5 years of experience in this work having inherited the land from his father. He also grows other crops such as corn, yucca, beans, etc.  He will use this loan to invest in his business buying fertilizers for his farm and in turn earn a good income to improve his quality of life. 

Olmedo is a long term member and this is his second loan with our financial organization, Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in his business and buy fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Vaise

texts.en: Vaise is a single 48 years old married woman with 8 children. She bakes and sell coconut buns in her community to earn a living. She needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, oven and a pot. In the future, Vaise hopes to extend her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, oven and a pot

loans.name: Sevtap

texts.en:
Sevtap is married and a mother of two. She makes a contribution to the family budget by making epilating waxes to women at their homes. She started this business 6 years ago. First she started with her neighbours then she increased the number of her customers. With the increased number of her customers she started doing it at her own house. Now she gets her customers by appointments. With the help of her third loan from Maya she bought wax in bulk and made herself brochures. In the future she is planning to open her own beauty saloon.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sevtap Hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi. Evde ağda yaparak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. Sevtap Hanım ağda yapmaya 6 yıl önce başladı. Önce yakın çevresine ağda yaparak daha sonra günlere giderek müşteri çevresi oluşturmuş. Müşterileri sayısı artınca kendi evinde ağda yapmaya başlamış. Şu anda müşterilerini evinde randevuyla alıyor. MAYA’dan 3. kredisini kullanan Sevtap Hanım kredileri ile ağda malzemesi aldı ve broşür bastırdı. Gelecekte güzellik salonu açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy waxing supplies

loans.name: Amka Tujenge B Group

texts.fr: Kazambarama est un entrepreneur, propriétaire d’un magasin, vendeur des ordinanteurs Lap top dans une avenue mouventée de la ville, membre du groupe solidaire «Amka Tujenge B», client de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 30 ans et il est encore célibataire. Il va s’approvisionner en dix lap top pour renforcer ses activités. Il commença ses activités par le capital reçu de son salaire quand il travaillait dans une entreprise locale, il y a neuf ans. Au final, il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancable
texts.en:
Kazambarama is an entrepreneur and shop owner: his shop is located on a very busy street of his city and he sells laptop computers.  He is also a member of the "Amka Tujenge B" solidarity group and a client of the micro-finance institution Hekima.  He is 30 and still single.

Kazambarama is planning to buy 10 laptops in order to boost his activity.  He started this business nine years ago with some capital saved from a previous job in a local company.  He thanks Hekima for the support they provide to entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy ten laptop computers.

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a maize farmer from Makera village. As a Babban Gona member, Hannatu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs.

Hannatu will use this loan to store the maize she harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hannatu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Hannatu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Adamu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of Maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Adamu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Adamu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Adamu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Haruna is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Haruna now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Lalia

texts.fr: Madame Lalia est membre de banc villageois depuis juin 2010. Elle est mariée, âgée de quarante ans et mère de huit enfants dont cinq filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de l'huile de palme, de sandales et de légumes depuis plus de dix ans d'expérience. Elle va acheter en grande quantité de l'huile de palme, des sandales et des légumes. Elle est exemplaire dans le banc villageois et très dynamique. Les bénéfices vont servir à épargner et à aider à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en: Lalia has been a member of the Banc Villageois since 2010.  She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, five of whom are girls.  She sells palm oil, sandals and vegetables, and she has more than ten years of experience in her field of work.  She is planning to buy bulk quantities of palm oil, sandals and vegetables.  She is an exemplary member of the Banc Villageois and always full of energy.  She will use her profits to save some money and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, sandals and vegetables.

loans.name: Tulili

texts.en:
Tulili is a 45-year-old mother with six children. She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Tulili requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, and butter to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2003.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, and butter.

loans.name: Faatuimoana

texts.en:
Faatuimoana is a 31-year-old mother with four children. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living.

Faatuimoana requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a fry pan to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a fry pan.

loans.name: Altan-Od

texts.en: Mr. Altan-Od, 28 years old, lives with his wife in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a registration officer at the State Bureau for five years. His wife teaches at high school. He is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovations. By doing so his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Erlinda has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as feeds, shampoo, soap, quailed egg, junk foods, coffee, noodles, vegetables. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 33 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mary Jean has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Mary Jean requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle passenger.

Mary Jean has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle passenger.

loans.name: Foalugapele

texts.en: Foalugapele is a 32 year old mother with 6 children, she runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Foalugapele requested for a loan to buy chemicals, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, hand gloves, backpack sprayer, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, hand gloves, backpack sprayer,

loans.name: Tauloto

texts.en:
Tauloto is a 44-year-old mother with three children. She runs a business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living.

Tauloto requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Cherrie Mae

texts.en:
Cherrie Mae is 30 years old and married with two children, two children are presently in school, Cherrie Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Cherrie Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products .

Cherrie Mae has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Cherrie Mae would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Fatima Lourdes

texts.es:
Fátima, no estudio, debido a que sus padres eran de escasos recursos y no alcanzaban para mandarla a la escuela, actualmente ella tiene 3 hijos, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura junto con ella y son los únicos que dependen económicamente de ella.

Fátima, se dedica a la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeña, debido a que sus padres siempre la llevaban a trabajar en las milpas que ellos tenían, actualmente ella siembra sus propios cultivos junto con su esposo, aparte de cultivar también trabaja en un comedor y son las fuentes de ingresos que posee, para ir a sus parcelas tiene que caminar un total de 6 kilometros y trabaja arduamente de 6:00 a.m. a 12:00 m.d.

Fátima, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizante, herbicida y pesticidas, con el propósito de tener un cultivo sano que le genere las suficientes fuentes de ingresos para poder salir adelante con los servicios de educación, salud y alimentación de su familia.

Fátima, sueña con ver a sus hijas convertidas en profesionales, el préstamo le ayudara a tener una buena cosecha, todo esto lo lograra con las ganancias que generen sus cultivos y los utilizara para pagar los estudios que están cursando sus hijas.
texts.en:
Fatima did not go to school since her parents did not have sufficient means to pay for her education. She has three children, she and her partner work in agriculture, her children are her only dependents.



fatima has worked in agriculture since she was very small, since her parents always took her to work in the corn fields they had. Now she tends her own crops with her husband, and aside from farming she works in a cafeteria, those are her sources of income. To get to her plots of land, she has to walk a total of six kilometers, and works hard from six in the morning until noon.

Fatima needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides, with the aim of having a healthy harvest which will generate sufficient income to cover her family's education, healthcare, and nutritional needs.

Fatima dreams of seeing her daughters grow up to have professions. This loan will help her to have a good harvest, and the earnings her crops generate will be used to pay for her daughters' educations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, manure, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 58 years old and single.

Bebiana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products .

Bebiana has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Bebiana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Surajo

texts.en:
Surajo is a maize farmer from Doka village. As a Babban Gona member, Surajo is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Surajo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Surajo will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Surajo no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Surajo hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Hamza would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Hamza is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Areli Waleska

texts.es:
La joven  Arelys Waleska de 23  años de edad, es casada y  vive con su esposo y su hija  en su  casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 06  años al negocio de venta de ropa  nueva ella vende pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, bresieres, biquinis,  y otros  más,  vive en Pespire  al sur de Honduras, ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de Pantalones, camisas, faldas, bóxer, bikinis, y otros más,  con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo Honduras Septiembre  2015.
texts.en:
Arelys Waleska is a 23-year-old young woman, who is married and lives with her husband and daughter in a home they own.

For the past 6 years, she has made a living through her business selling new clothing. She sells pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, spandex, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, bras, bikinis, and more.

She is an enterprising young woman with a desire to succeed, and she fights every day to improve her quality of life.

She is requesting the loan to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, boxers, bikinis, and other items. With the support of the loan, she intends to improve her profits and her quality of life. She is a borrower who wants to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele, while at the same time improving her and her family's future.

San Lorenzo Honduras, September 2015

loans.use: to buy and sell pants, shirts, t-shirts, dresses, skirts

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.en:
Hilarion is 74 years old and widowed with one adult age child. He is an active member of Paglaum MPC and has availed numerous loan products.

Recently, he asks from the coop a loan to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 36 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family.

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Merlina wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 56, married in Pagadian City, she runs a store that primarily supports their family. Every day she never gets tired of tending her store.

Juliet is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Flotelia

texts.en:
Flotelia is 45 years old and has five children. Flotelia is married and has one child in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Flotelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Flotelia has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flotelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and widowed with two children. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Gloria has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, junk food, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Barbara Jane

texts.en:
Barbara Jane is 32 years old and married with two children, two children are currently in school, Barbara Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Barbara Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products .

Barbara Jane has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Barbara Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora lives in Pagadian City and supports her children by building houses from the ground up.

She has successfully repaid her whole loan, which she used to buy building material and paints, and to pay her workers.

She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material and paints and to pay her workers.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing and caring to harvesting and earning income as well.

Generosa has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Generosa has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds to have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Generosa hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
In the year 2007, Sergio learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Pagadian City, he tried his luck and took a loan to jump start his corn production.

After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Sergio feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used to start his business.
