Recently, he availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Sergio wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply corn to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Bitrus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Bitrus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Bitrus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Bitrus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Tacko's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place depuis Août 2009 ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables.

Madame Tacko, âgée de 37 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle vend des produits alimentaires qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour les revendre dans son village en détails.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sacs de riz à 13500f l’un, 02 bouteilles de 20 litres d’huile raffinée à 20000f l’un, 01 sac de sucre à 22500f et d’autres condiments d’un montant de 25500f pour le revendre en détails chez elle.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de développer son commerce et d’aider son mari pour les dépenses journalières.
texts.en:
Set up in August 2009, this 'banc villageois' is composed of women from the village association. They joined the program to make their small-scale businesses more profitable.

Ms. Tacko, aged 37, is the one sitting at the far right with a hand raised. She the featured borrower of the group. A married mother of four, she sells grocery items, which she purchases at the weekly markets to resell in her village at the retail level.

With her new loan, she intends to purchase two sacks of rice at 13,500 francs each; two 20-liter bottles of refined oil at 20,000 francs each; a bag of sugar at 22,500 francs each; and some more condiments valued at 25,500 francs, to resell at her home.

Her profits will enable her to develop her business and help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of rice, two 20-liter bottles of refined oil, and a bag of sugar

loans.name: Jacoba Rubidia

texts.es:
Jacoba, de 58 años de edad, está soltera y que nunca se casó, pero tuvo 6 hijos de los cuales todos son mayores de edad.

Jacoba, se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y niños, ella se ha dedicado a este negocio durante 10 años, ella dice que gracias a ello ha podido salir adelante con todos sus hijos y ha podido darles el estudio y lo que han necesitado.
 
Jacoba, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para salir a las demás comunidades a vender y poder obtener ganancias para sustentar los gastos de la casa.
 
Los planes de Jacoba, son continuar trajando y asi poder darles a sus hijos lo que se merecen y tambien poder descansar lo más tranquila que sea posible.
texts.en:
Jacoba is 58 years old, is single, and was never married, but she had six children who are all adults. Jacoba makes a living by selling clothing for women and children. She has had this business for ten years. She says that thanks to her business she has been able to get ahead with all of her children and given them the opportunity to study and what they have needed.
 
Jacoba needs the loan to buy more merchandise to go out to other communities to sell and to earn money to cover her household expenses. Jacoba's plans are to continue working and thus be able to give her children what they deserve and also rest as calmly as possible.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, butter, sugar, eggs, etc. to increase production of sweetbread and french bread

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael de 45 años de edad viven casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su taxi desde hace 22 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construirla pero como no posee suficiente capital esta solicitando nuevamente un credito pero en esta ocasion para la compra de los materiles de construccion y asi poder tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Rafael is 45 years old. He lives in his own home with his life partner and child. He has been driving a taxi for the last 22 years, and has many customers who seek him out because he is a responsible driver. Because of this, he has enough work to cover his household expenses.

He hopes to make improvements on his home and finish building it, but since he doesn't have enough money, he is requesting a loan once again. This time he wants to buy construction materials so that he can have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Kenia Carolina

texts.es: Kenia, es madre soltera, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el municipio de San Marcos, Lempira con su madre y su hijo. Desde hace 5 años cuenta con una tienda de ropa de segunda variada, que incluye jeans, pantalones para damas, camisas, blusas, ropa de niño. Este negocio lo tiene en un local que alquila. En vista de sus necesidades ella ha emprendido su propio negocio y necesita 15,000.00 Lempiras para poder comprar fardos de ropa de segunda para surtir su negocio con más productos y tener mejores ventas. Su meta es poder aumentar su negocio, crecer como microempresaria y aportar con los gastos del hogar y ayudar a su madre.
texts.en:
Kenia is a single mother who is 29 years old and lives in the city of San Marcos, Lempira with her mother and her son. For the last five years she has had a second-hand clothing store with a variety of items including jeans, pants for women, shirts, blouses, and children's clothing. She has this business in a location she rents.

She started her own business based on what she needs, and she requires 15,000.00 Honduran lempiras to be able to buy bales of second-hand clothing to stock her business with more products and have better sales. Her goal is to be able to expand her business, to grow as a small business, to contribute to her household expenses, and to help her mother.

loans.use: to stock her business with the purchase of new bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Yacine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois .il est composé de femmes issues du même quartier et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Yacine est la responsable elle est âgée de 68 mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 4 garçons et 6 filles tous scolarisés.
Elle s'active dans la transformation des poissons frais au niveau de la mer de sa localité.
Avec son nouveau financement de 470000 francs CFA elle va se payer des dizaines de paniers de  poissons frais destinées a la transformations fumée et séchée. Elle dispose d'une expérience avérée dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis longtemps . Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires et scolaires de ses enfants et de renforcer son capital.
texts.en:
This group was created since the first cycle of the 'banc villageois’. It is composed of women from the same neighborhood united by good social and professional ties.

Ms. Yacine is the group’s official. She is 68 years old and the mother of ten children (four boys and six girls) all provided with education.

She is active in the processing of fresh ocean fish in her town.

With her new financing of 470,000 francs CFA, she is going to purchase dozens of baskets of fresh fish to be smoked and dried. She makes use of proven experience in this domain for having worked at it for a long time. The profits earned will enable her to meet the food and educational needs of her children and to bolster her capital.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to process and sell

loans.name: Antonio Alfredo

texts.es:
Antonio, de 60 años de edad, está soltero y no tiene familia propia, él vive en la casa que era de sus padres, él es muy trabajador y responsable con el cuidado de la casa y de sus cultivos. 

Antonio, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol, él se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para ir a su trabajo que está a un kilometro de su casa, el prepara su propia comida para llevar ya que vive solo pero eso no es problema para el. 

Antonio, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agricolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas, para aplicarlo a sus cultivos.

Los sueños de Antonio, son poder obtener una buena cosecha para obtener ganancias y así también poder darles una mejor vivienda a sus padres y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Antonio, who is 60-years old, is single and has no children. He lives in the house that belonged to his parents. Antonio is very hard-working and responsible with regard to his home and his crops.

Antonio makes his living growing staple grains, such as corn and beans. He gets up at 4:00a.m. to go to work, which is about a kilometer from his house. Antonio prepares his own food to take to work, as he lives alone, but it's not a problem for him.

Antonio needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies, such as compost, pesticides and herbicides, to apply to his crops.

Antonio's hopes are to obtain a good harvest so he can earn a profit which will allow him to give his parents a better home and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as compost, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Amardelger

texts.en:
Amardelger, 40 years old, lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a taxi service for local people since 2011.

Using a previous loan, she purchased spare parts for her car and repaired it. Now she is requesting a loan of 500 USD to buy insulation materials such as fiberglass and foam to insulate her home.

As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollution into the air.

loans.use: to insulate her home

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois ,il est composé de femmes issues du me quartier et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Fatou  est la responsable ,elle est âgée de 53 ans mariée et mère de six enfants dont une fille et cinq garçons.
Elle s'active dans la transformation des produits halieutiques. Avec son nouveau crédit de 500 000 francs CFA elle va se payer des paniers de poissons frais qu'elle va transformer et puis revendre au détails au niveau du marché de poisson de sa localité.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps. 
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaire et de renforcer son capital.
texts.en:
This group was created since the first cycle of the 'banc villageois’. It is composed of women from the same neighborhood who are united by good social and professional ties.

Ms. Fatou is the group’s official. She is 53 years old and the married mother of six children (a girl and five boys).

She is active in the processing of seafoods. With her new loan of 500,000 francs CFA, she is going to purchase baskets of fresh fish, which she is going to process and then resell at the fish market in her town. She has good experience in this domain for having worked at it for a long time. The profits earned will enable her to meet food needs and to bolster her capital.

loans.use: to purchase baskets of fresh fish to process and sell

loans.name: Henrry Leonardo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Señoras Exitosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Medardo Mora en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive el señor Henrry, tiene 24 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, este es su tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le agrada porque gracias a los créditos él puede sacar adelante su negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida. 
Don Henrry es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta a base de esfuerzo y trabajo salir adelante, el se  dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale casi todos los días a recorrer la ciudad y al mismo tiempo que vende va cobrando ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, esto le ha permitido ir de a poco aumentando su clientela, ya son mas de 8 años que tiene este negocio con el cual se gana la vida honradamente.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y otras prendas. Sus sueños es tener un carro para salir a vender.
texts.en:
The Señoras Exitosas Credit Group gets together every 15 days in the Medardo Mora neighborhood, in the city of Manta. This is a city that is known for its lovely beaches which can be enjoyed year-round, its delicious food, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where Henrry lives. He is 24 years-old, single, and living in his parents' home. This is his third loan cycle with the Credit Group, and he is grateful because thanks to the loans he is able to get ahead in this business that allows him to earn a living.

Henrry is a very hard-working young man who likes to get ahead with effort and hard work. He is a business man, selling clothing of all kinds door to door. He goes out into the city almost every day, and while he sells he is also collecting. He sells on credit and collects every 8 days. This has allowed him to increase his customer base gradually. Now it has been over 8 years that he has had this business with which he earns an honorable living.

This loan is to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and other clothing. His dream is to have a car to use when he goes on his rounds.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and other clothing.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 27 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, personal care products, and other groceries.

Jenelyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, fabric, conditioner, eggs, coffee, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 57 years old and has seven children. Lucia is married and two of her children are in school.

Lucia is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucia requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lucia has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Luis Aristides

texts.es: Luis de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus abuelos, el se dedica desde hace 16 años a la pesca artesanal y comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su casa, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con su familia, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de redes, trasmallos y darle mantenimiento al motor de la lancha que es el que muestra en la fotografía para poder seguir con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis is 32-years old and lives in his own home with his grandparents. For the last sixteen years, he has made his living as a traditional fisherman. He sells his catch in the various markets close to his home. Through the sales he makes, Luis is able to get his family ahead.
Luis is requesting a loan so he can purchase nets and driftnets and so he can provide maintenance on the motor for his boat, which you can see in the above photograph. Then he will be able to keep going with his work and earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase nets and driftnets and to provide maintenance for his boat's motor.

loans.name: Gema Rocio

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Señoras Exitosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Medardo Mora en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Gema, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, este es su cuarto ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta el grupo porque es unido y los créditos de mucha ayuda. 
Doña Gema es una joven  que le gusta ganarse la vida con su esfuerzo, ella y su mamá  venden ropa, zapatos carteras y  productos de Luedine,  Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su mamá sale a recorrer por la ciudad mientras ella se encarga de vender en su casa ya que hasta allí llegan muchos clientes, ella también ciertos días sale junto a su mamá a vender y a cobrar ya que dejan a crédito y cobra  cada semana. De esta forma ella se logra ganar algo y colaborar con  los gastos de su familia, lleva más de cinco años con esta actividad y su mamá más de 20 años.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas que ellas venden. Sus sueños son tener un local para vender.
texts.en:
The "Señoras Exitosas" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Medardo Mora neighborhood of the city of Manta, It is a city known for it's beautiful beaches which receive many visitors throughout the year, for it's fine food and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Gema lives in this place. She is 22 years old, single and lives in her parent's house. This is her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it as the group is united and the loans are of great help.

Gema is a youth who likes to make her own living with her efforts. She and her mother sell clothing, shoes, purses and Luedine and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and woman's accessories). Her mother goes out to sell in the city while she takes charge of selling from her house as many clients come there. Some days she goes out with her mother to sell and collect as they leave the goods on credit and collect every week. In this way she manages to make some money and help with the family expenses. She has been in the business for more than 5 years, her mother has more than 20 years experience.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, purses, perfume, creams and cosmetics amongst other things they sell. Their dream is to have a shop to sell from.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, purses, perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Señoras Exitosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Medardo Mora en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Flor, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres  hijos de 9  y 7 años y un bebé 7 meses, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es diseñador grafico.
Doña Flor es una mujer que le encanta trabajar para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, carteras, perfumes, sobrecamas, entre otros productos, ella viaja a Guayaquil  a comprar la mercadería, ella deja  a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito, con los créditos ella compro varios artículos a mejor precio ya que compro al contado y esto le sirvió para obtener buenos descuentos con los cuales le quedo más ganancias para invertirlos en los gastos de su hogar. Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, sobrecamas, entre otras cosas. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
The group credit Señoras Exitosas (Successful Ladies) meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Medardo Mora in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are well-visited all year, for its gastronomy and for being a city of beauty like no other with many tourist attractions.

Flor lives here and is 27 years old. She is married and has three children at the ages of 9 and 7, and a 7 month old baby. The two older children study in school. Her husband is a graphic designer.

Flor loves to work to help her husband with the household expenses. She sells all kinds of clothing, handbags, perfumes, bedspreads etc. She traveled to Guayaquil to buy the merchandise. She leaves credit and charges every 8 days. She has been working in this for over 5 years.

She is repeating the loan. With the loans, she bought several items at a better price since she bought them on the spot. This helped her get good discounts which led to more profits to invest in household expenses. She requests a loan to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, bedspreads among other things. This is her 4th loan in the group credit and she likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dream is that their children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, bedspreads etc.

loans.name: Santos Rene

texts.es: Julio de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace 41 años de edad gracias a su experiencia es como logra obtener una buena cosecha y cuando ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego comercializarla y con las ganancias que obtiene puede salir adelante, el esta solicitando un credito para la  compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi seguir teniendo una buena cosecha y buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Julio is 64-years old. He lives in his own home with his wife. He has made his living growing corn and beans for 41 years. His experience, thankfully, allows him to get good harvests. When his harvest is ready, Julio stores it in the silo, which is shown in the above photograph. He later sells his harvest, and with the earnings, he is able to get ahead.
Julio is requesting a loan so he can purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides etc. so he can continue to have good harvests and good profits.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides etc.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 48 años de edad reside en casa propia junto a su esposa, el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de variedad de pan dulce y francés desde hace varios años e inicio con capital propio, gracias a sus ventas es como ha podido salir adelente con su esposa, el esta solicitando un credito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de harina de pan, azúcar, huevos, colorantes, etc. Para contar con mayor capacidad y así cubrir una mayor demanda para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 48-years old and lives in his own home with his wife. Jorge has made his living for a number of years making and selling a variety of sweet breads and french bread. He started his business with his own capital, and thanks to his sales, he and his wife have been able to get ahead.
Jorge is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of bread flour, sugar, eggs, food coloring etc. With these purchases he will increase his capacity, meet a greater demand and earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase bread flour, sugar, eggs, food coloring etc.

loans.name: Buen Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres sonrientes (ESTHER STEPHANY, MARIA LIZEHT y MARTHA CEFERINA) pertenecen a la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace aproximadamente 3 años, para acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hogares, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

MARIA LIZEHT: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora alegre de 37 años de edad, está casada, tiene 1 hijo de 4 años de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 5 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar chiverías, gaseosas, granos básicos, entre otros productos. Sueña con diversificar sus productos y vender bisuterías y accesorios de acero y oro laminado.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three smiling women (ESTHER STEPHANY, MARIA LIZEHT and MARTHA CEFERINA). They belong to the Miskito of the city of Bilwi, Municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They got together about three years ago to access the loan to increase inventory of their small businesses, to improve their income and to cover the basic household needs, to ensure the education of their children, and to improve their homes.

MARIA LIZEHT is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is cheerful and is 37 years old. She is married and has one 4 year-old child. In order to obtain her own source of income and to support household expenses, she established a small grocery store in the corridor of her home made of barrel and wood 5 years ago.

Maria requests a loan to buy dairy products, soda, basic grains etc. She dreams of diversifying her products and sell miscellaneous goods and accessories in steel and gold plated.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, soda, basic grains etc.

loans.name: Plata Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres alegres (ANA MARIA, LESBIA BENITA y RAQUEL) pertenecen a la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio Puerto Cabezas, se unieron recientemente, para gestionar  financiamiento mediante créditos con garantía solidaria, para comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios, de esa manera vender más y mejorar sus ingresos. Anhelan mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

LESBIA BENITA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario PLATA; madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, menores de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, vende de manera ambulante productos de bellezas, cosméticos por catálogos y accesorios de acero y oro laminado. El préstamo que está solicitando es para  comprar más mercadería: aretes, cadenas, pulseras, brazaletes, dijes entre otros productos,  para poder ofertar más productos.  Ella sueña con tener unas vitrinas donde pueda exhibir sus productos y otras mercaderías para poder mejorar sus ingresos y así poder también contribuir en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y brindarles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up of three cheerful women (ANA MARIA, LESBIA BENITA and RAQUEL) who belong to the Miskita ethnicity in the city of Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas municipality. They got together recently to arrange financing through loans with a group guarantee to buy more merchandise for their small businesses. In this way they can sell more and improve their incomes. They wish to improve their living conditions to be able to pay for their basic needs, assure the education of their children and improve their homes.

Lesbia Benita is the coordinator of the "PLATA" communal bank. She is a single mother of two children both minors in age. With the goal of raising her children she sells beauty products, cosmetics by catalog, and steel and gold plated accessories itinerantly. The loan that she is requesting is to buy more merchandise: earrings, chains, watches, bracelets and pendants amongst other products so she can offer more products. She dreams of having some display cases where she could exhibit her products and other merchandise to improve her income. She would also like be able to contribute to improving her children's quality of living and provide them with a better future.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise: earrings, chains, watches, bracelets and pendants amongst other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in: brick, cement and sand for construction of a washstand with water storage in her home.

loans.name: Juan Ricardo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Señoras Exitosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Medardo Mora en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Juan, tiene 65 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposa es comerciante.
El señor Juan es un hombre que le gusta trabajar, el junto a su esposa tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí venden todo tipo de productos como granos, detergentes, carnes, legumbres, además de productos de bazar, papelería y ciertas medicinas,  trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00.  Desde  que recibe la ayuda de los créditos ha podido ir mejorando su local y la variedad de artículos que vendía lo cual le ha generado más clientela y sus ganancias cada vez mas son mejores por lo cual el está muy agradecido con la fundación.
El está repitiendo el crédito porque con sus ganancias el puede sacar adelante a su familia y las ganancias extra las invierte en seguir mejorando su negocio. Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar más variedad de  víveres para así mejorar su negocio.  Es socio fundador del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para el. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The group credit Señoras Exitosas (Successful Ladies) meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Medardo Mora in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are well-visited all year, for its gastronomy and for being a city of beauty like no other with many tourist attractions.

Juan lives here and is 65 years old. He is married and has five adult children. One of them still lives at home. His wife is a merchant.

Juan likes to work. He have a grocery store at home with his wife. They sell products such as grains, detergents, meats, vegetables, bazaar products, stationery and certain drugs. They work every day from 6am to 7pm. Since receiving the loans, they’ve improved the store and variety of items being sold. This has generated more customers and profits. He is grateful of the foundation.

He is repeating the loan because he can get ahead for his family and the extra profits can be invested in further improving his business. This loan will be invested in buying more variety of food to improve their business. He is a founding member of the group credit and likes it because the loans are important to him. His dreams are to get ahead and be healthy in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer from the village of Gidan Samaila. As a member of Babban Gona, Ayuba is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Ayuba will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until later in the season, when he can sell his maize for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ayuba no longer feels pressured to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/hectare, Ayuba hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 54 years old. She is a widow with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Juvy has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Juvy requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Juvy has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Juvy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evangeline is 53 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Evangeline has a jeep transportation business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline and pay for maintenance for her business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline and pay for maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 53 years old and married with two children. Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products .

Grace has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Isiyaku has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Isiyaku can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Isiyaku is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Febrero Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario FEBRERO, está conformado por 3 mujeres alegres (AURELIA, IVANIA y MARICELA) todas son indígenas  miskitas de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que  con sus ingresos aportan para las necesidades básicas de sus hogares. Se organizaron hace 6 meses para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

MARICELA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven sonriente de 26 años de edad, con deseos de superación, casada. Tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad que estudia su tercer grado de primaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como conductor de pangas (lanchas de madera). Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudio de su hijo. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar ropa usada en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña  en construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Febrero [February] is made up of three cheerful women (Aurelia, Ivania, and Maricela); all are indigenous Miskitas from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who contribute with their income to the basic needs of their households. They organized six months ago in order to access Pana Pana group-secured joint loans.

Maricela is a member of the solidarity group; she is a smiling young woman 26 years of age, married, and with a desire to excel. She has an 8-year-old son who is in the third grade. Her husband works on an informal basis as a panga (wooden boat) driver. For the purpose of having her own source of income and to contribute to household expenses and her son’s schooling, Maricela is applying for financing to buy used clothing in Managua to sell at affordable rates to her customers in Bilwi. She dreams of building her house of concrete.

loans.use: buy used clothing in Managua.

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé en Juin 2002. Les membres sont d’une détermination assez solide et très courageuse. Elles sont solidaires entre elles et vivent en parfaite harmonie. L’activité principale est le petit commerce.

 Madame Coumba (assise à  droite avec la main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans, divorcée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est vendeuse de condiments qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour les revendre dans son village. 

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter  03 sceau de 20 kg de patte d’arachide à 12000f, 02 bidon de 20 litre d’huile de palme à 17500f et 05 paquets de bouillon à 1300 l’un et d’autres condiments d’un montant de 36500f pour le revendre en détail dans son village.

 Les bénéfices lui serviront de mieux prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille, de renforcer son activité et prendre en charges les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
This group was set up in June 2002. The members have a rather strong determination and are very courageous. They depend on one another and live in perfect harmony. Their main activity is local trading.

Coumba (seated on the right with her right hand raised in the photo) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 48 years old, divorced and the mother of four children. She is a seller of condiments which she buys at weekly markets to resell in her village.

With this loan, she plans to buy three 20kg containers of peanut paste for 12,000f, two 20litre cans of palm oil for 17,500f, five packets of stock cubes at 1300 each, and other condiments for 36,500f - to sell retail in her village.

The profits will help her more easily cover the family's needs, strengthen her business and to cover the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy three 20kg containers of peanut paste for 12,000f, two 20litre cans of palm oil for 17,500f, five packets of stock cubes at 1300 each, and other condiments for 36,500f - to sell retail in her village.

loans.name: Madjiguene's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois et il est composé de femmes issues du même village et unies par de bonnes relations de voisinages.
Madame Bouramanding est la responsable ,elle est âgée de 46 ans mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 4 garçons et a 4 filles tous scolarisés.
Elle s'active dans la transformation de produits halieutiques et la vente au détails de ces produits.
Avec son nouveau crédit de cinq cent mille franc CFA elle va se payer des paniers de poissons frais qu'elle va transformer et revendre au détail au niveau du marché de poisson de sa localité. 
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce  domaine .Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en  charge les besoins alimentaires sanitaires et scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was started at the very beginning of the 'banc villageois' local group system, and is made up of women from the same village connected through strong neighbourhood links.

Bouramanding is the group leader; she is 46 years old, married and the mother of eight children - four boys and four girls - all in school.
Her business is the processing of fish products and the subsequent retail selling of them. With this new loan for five thousand francs CFA, she will buy baskets of fresh fish to be processed and resold retail in the local fish market. She has good experience in this area.

The profit made will enable her to cover the food, health and schooling costs for her children.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fresh fish which she will process and resell.

loans.name: Pene

texts.en: Pene is 69 years old with six children. She owns and operates a small business of selling ice cakes in her village to earn a living. Pene requested a loan to buy a freezer, cooler, bags of ice, sacks of sugar, plastic bags and containers to assist her to run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, bags of ice, sacks of sugar, plastic bags and containers.

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en:
Lagi is a 28-year-old mother with two children. She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Lagi requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro root (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake and shovel to help her run the business. 

She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake and shovel.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old and married with five children.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years and also earns additional income from a butcher shop.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and single with one child. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and personal care products.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and has four children.  Josephine is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins.

Josephine has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 30 years old and married with two children. Kristine works very hard to provide for them.

Kristine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Kristine has been in this business for five years.

In the future Kristine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Kerlene

texts.en:
Kerlene is 34-years-old and married with four children. Three children are still in school. Kerlene works very hard to provide for them.

Kerlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She sells items such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Kerlene has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Kerlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Blue Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres muy alegres (CELEDONIA, NOEMI y NORA) pertenecen a la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace aproximadamente 3 años, para acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hogares, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

NOEMI: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven de 24 años de edad con deseos de superación y cualidades de líder, casada con 2 hijos: El mayor de 12 años estudia su primer año de secundaria y un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Debido a la falta de un empleo formal y con el deseo de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de su hijo, vende de manera ambulante pescados y mariscos. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos en la comunidad indígena de Lamlaya, que significa agua mansa, se localiza a 15 kilómetros del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, para vender sus productos a precios accesibles a su clientela de la Ciudad de Bilwi. Ella sueña con establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three very cheerful women (Celedonia, Noemi and Nora), who belong to the Miskito ethnic group of the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They got together approximately three years ago, to access financing via loans to increase the inventory of their small businesses, improve their income, and to be able to cover their basic household necessities, ensure the education of their children, and improve their homes.

Noemi is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a young woman of 24 with the desire to excel and leadership qualities; she is married with 2 sons. The oldest son, age 12, is in his first year of high school and her other son is a little one of 4 years old. Due to the lack of formal employment and with the desire to contribute to household expenses and education of her child, Noemi sells fish and seafood on the street. She is applying for financing to buy more products in the indigenous community of Lamlaya, which means calm water, located 15 kilometers from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas, to sell her products at prices accessible to her customers from the City of Bilwi. She dreams of setting up a small grocery store.

loans.use: buy fish and seafood.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liezel is 38-years-old and her three children are currently in school.

Liezel has a buy-and-sell animal feed business in the Philippines. Liezel requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of animal feed to sell.

Liezel has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of animal feed to sell

loans.name: Tania

texts.en: Tania is a 27-year-old mother with five children. She runs a business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than one year. Tania requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals,  and a backpack sprayer to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Idi

texts.en:
Idi is a maize farmer from Dogon Juri village. As a Babban Gona member, Idi is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Idi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Idi will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Idi no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Idi hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ma. Eden

texts.en:
Ma. Eden is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma.Eden dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional goods to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Estelita dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 59 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like bread, chips, biscuits, etc.

Letecia has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like bread, chips, biscuits, etc

loans.name: Baballiya

texts.en:
Baballiya is a maize farmer from Dogon Juri village. As a Babban Gona member, Baballiya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Baballiya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Baballiya will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Baballiya no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Baballiya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: El Rincón De Mayorazgo Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México, las celebraciones de origen mazahua se han intrincado con dos religiones cristianas que se destacan en el lugar: la católica y la evangélica. 
Fue aquí donde se conformó el grupo “El Rincón de Mayorazgo”, don Francisco es uno de los integrantes. A sus 57 años, continúa dedicándose a la venta de “carnitas” (platillo tradicional preparado con carne de puerco). En algunas ocasiones, él mismo cría a los animales para asegurarse de vender carne de mejor calidad, además de incrementar un poco sus ganancias. 
Ya son 35 años desde que don Francisco comenzó la actividad ya que le era complicado hallar un trabajo con un buen ingreso y tenía que cuidar de su esposa y sus diez hijos que hoy en día ya son autosuficientes. Antes de tener su propio negocio, él trabajó para otra persona con la misma actividad, después de aprender y tener suficiente experiencia decidió seguir su propio camino y ser independiente. Hoy en día, los gastos familiares han disminuido y Francisco ya sólo necesita preparar y vender “carnitas” dos veces por semana recorriendo las calles de las comunidades.
Don Francisco se muestra agradecido con VFMéxico ya que cada préstamo le ayudó a construir corrales para conservar a sus cerdos principalmente, pero poco a poco también compró otro tipo de animales como borregos, pavos y pollos, hizo mejoras a su vivienda y lo más importante, logró proveer a su familia. El nuevo préstamo lo utilizará para comprar más cerdos y alimento.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Sandra quien invierte en borregos; Felipa, en plásticos; Isabel, en ropa y Fidel, en cerdos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el preferido de los integrantes cerca del centro del municipio, don Francisco es quien viste la chamarra roja.
texts.en:
In one of the communities in the state of Mexico the celebrations of Mazahua origin have been blended with two Christian religions that stand out here: Catholic and Evangelical.

This is where the community bank group "El Rincón de Mayorazgo" was established. Francisco, 57, is one of the members and he continues to sell "carnitas" (a traditional pork dish). Sometimes he raises animals to insure the quality of the products he sells and to earn extra income.

Francisco started his business 35 years ago as it was difficult to find work with a good income. He had to care for his wife and ten children who are now self-sufficient. Before having his own business he worked for other people in the same trade. Once he had acquired enough experience he decided to go his own way and become independent. Nowadays his family expenses have decreased so Francisco only needs to make and sell the "carnitas" two times a week which he does in the community streets.

Francisco is very grateful to VFMexico since the loan has helped him build pig pens. Little by little he also has bought animals such as sheep, turkeys and chickens. The most important thing is the home improvement he has done, and covering family needs. The new loan will be used to buy pigs and feed.

The other members of the group are Sandra who will invest in sheep; Felipa, in plastics; Isabel, in clothing and Fidel, in pigs.

*The photograph was taken at the favorite spot of the members, near the town center. Francisco is the one wearing a red sweater.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ximena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ximena tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos niñas Ashly y Britany de dies años, son gemelas y gracias al trabajo y buena dedicacion  de su madre pueden estudiar.
Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes, una actividad que necesita de esfuerzo y constancia,los alimenta y cuida de ellos, asi crecen y puede venderlos.
Ximena necesita del credito para la compra de mas crias, de esta manera podra aumentar su negocio y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ximena, 33, is a single mother with two daughters, Ashly and Britany, who are ten-year-old twins. Thanks to the fact that their mother works hard and is very dedicated, the girls can get an education.

Her business is raising and selling guinea pigs which requires constant effort to feed and care for them so they can grow and be put up for sale.

Ximena requires a loan to buy more baby animals to increase her business and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy and sell guinea pigs.

loans.name: Rosmiry

texts.en:
Rosmiry is 34 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of school supplies business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more school supplies to sell.

Rosmiry has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for eight years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Rosmiry aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 35 years old and has five children. Roselyn is single and all of her children are presently in school.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Roselyn has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Mujeres De Miel Group

texts.en:
Chiantla is one of the 338 municipalities of Guatemala, a small mountainside city above the industrial center of Huehuetenango in the Northwest corner of the country. The nine women who make up the trust bank ¨Mujeres de Miel¨, or women of honey, live in temperate farmland outside of Chiantla, in an agricultural community. The majority of these ladies studied no more than some level of primary school, and now have between three and eight children in school. Selling clothing, chicken, vegetables and beans, these businesswomen formed their group with dreams of growing their businesses, after hearing about Friendship Bridge from another client.

Albertina, the president of the group, is 48 years old, and did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is married, and with her husband, cares for her family of eight children, who are studying in school, or already graduated. To earn her income, Albertina has a business in animal husbandry, raising sheep, and also sells dry beans and rice in the market. With this new loan from Friendship Bridge and Kiva, this intelligent woman will invest in four more sheep, to expand her business.

Albertina is happy to be receiving monthly training in topics like business management, family, health, and issues related to women. So the growing of these ladies will be integral. Thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy four more sheep to expand her animal husbandry business

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria is 39 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ria has an E-loading (mobile prepaid load) business in the Philippines. Ria requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional prepaid load to resell.

Ria has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional prepaid load to resell.

loans.name: Alvaro Javier

texts.es: Álvaro es un hombre con 26 años de edad y vive en el municipio de Planeta Rica. Desde hace tres meses quedó sin empleo, ha logrado sobrevivir con lo poco que sus padres le pueden colaborar, viendo su situación económica este hombre decide emprender su propio negocio que será la cría y venta de ganado porcino, pero es sincero y no cuenta con el capital para iniciar la empresa, es por ello que solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de cerdos, materiales para construir una porqueriza y alimento de engorde, pide tu apoyo porque se cansó de buscar empleo, porque quiere ayudar a sus padres, porque desea salir adelante y poder pagar la educación de sus dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad.
texts.en:
Alvaro, 26, lives in the municipality of Planeta Rica. He has been unemployed for three months and survives with the little help his parents can give.

Because of his economic situation this man has decided to start his own business raising and selling pigs. But he is sincere and does not have the capital to start the company, so he is requesting economic support to buy pigs and the materials to build a pigpen, as well as feed.

He is requesting your support because he has grown tired of looking for a job. He wants to help his parents and get ahead in order to educate his two children, ages 8 and 2.

loans.use: to start a pig business in order to feed his children.

loans.name: Rubyflora

texts.en:
Rubyflora is 51 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, etc.

Rubyflora has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Rubyflora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, and canned goods

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and married with seven children.

She is in an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Teresita has been in this business for two years and earns additional income from farming rice and direct selling.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Rosa Ismaelina

texts.es: Rosa tiene 59 años de edad, vive en el sector rural con su esposo y su nieto Cristian de 11 años, una de sus hijas trabaja en otra ciudad y no puede cuidar de su hijo. Rosa se dedica a la compra y venta de chanchos hace 30 años, manifiesta que este negocio le ha permitido criar a sus hios y ahora a su nieto de quien cuida a pesar de su avanzada edad y su duro trabajo. Ella solicita el credito para comprar mas chanchos y asi incrementar sus ganancias y asi seguira cubriendo las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 59, lives in a rural area with her husband and 11-year-old grandson, Cristian. One of her daughters works in the city and cannot care for her son.

For 30 years Rosa has been buying and selling pigs. She says the business has allowed her to raise her children and now her grandson who she cares for despite her age and hard work.

She is requesting a loan to buy more pigs to increase her earnings and continue covering household needs.

loans.use: to buy and raise pigs.

loans.name: Jamiyanjav

texts.en: Mr. Jamiyanjav, 48 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an engineer at a railway station for 28 years. His wife is an electrician and works at a railway station. The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years and it needs urgent repair. So he is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un empresario de 29 años de edad, un constructor de sueños y esperanzas, un hombre que es propietario de un negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, inicio con un capital muy bajo y poco a poco ha ido formando el negocio que tiene hoy en día y en el cual cuenta con un empleado.
Jorge se ha tenido que enfrentar a diferentes problemáticas todas en torno a la inseguridad de la zona, pero a pesar de esto ha crecido y espera seguir por este buena senda y alcanzar su sueños de comprar vivienda y tener un mini-mercado.
Jorge quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para invertir capital a su negocio, necesita realizar algunas mejoras locativas, estanterías, piso, techo, entre otras, también necesita comprar surtido variado de abarrotes y carnes frías. 
Quedas invitado a participar en el sueño de esta trabajadora persona quien dedica 12 horas diarias a su negocio, a generar el sustento y oportunidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge, 29, is an entrepreneur who builds dreams and hopes. He runs a business selling essential groceries and started out with very little capital. Gradually he has built the business and now has an employee.

Jorge has had to deal with different problems related to security in the area, but despite everything he has grown and hopes to continue in the same vein in order to reach his goals and buy a house and a mini-market.

The loan he is requesting is to invest in his business. He needs to make improvements in the store, shelving, floor, roof, etc., and also buy a variety of groceries and cold meats.

You are invited to join in this hard worker's dream. He works 12 hours a day at the business in order to support his family and give them opportunities.

loans.use: to renovate the store, shelving, floor, roof, etc., and to buy a variety of groceries and cold meats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine.

loans.name: Vaimaila

texts.en: Vaimaila is a 37 year old mother with 6 children. She runs a business of sewing clothes and sell them in her community to earn a living. Vaimaila requested for a loan to buy a rolling materials, needles, sewing machine, tape measurement, elei design, paint color, paint brush, to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a rolling materials, needles, sewing machine, tape measurement, elei design, paint color, paint brush,

loans.name: Las Guerreras Group

texts.es:
Cierto municipio veracruzano tiene una vasta herencia gastronómica gracias a la variedad étnica de sus habitantes en especial los cuenqueños, aunque con el paso del tiempo se ha enriquecido por la influencia de los pobladores chinantecos y mazatecos que se han asentado en él. Dentro de los platillos que se elaboran en la región destacan el tamal de elote dulce o en salsa roja, las chancletas, el budín, las cocadas, el dulce de cacao, el manjar de arroz, los buñuelos y plátanos rellenos, el agua de horchata, de arroz y de coco, atole de coyol, sólo por mencionar algunos.
   Las Guerreras lleva por nombre un grupo integrado por trece mujeres trabajadoras y comprometidas con su familia. Dicho nombre lo eligieron pues se consideran a sí mismas como unas guerreras. Ellas son: Juan M. quien se dedica a vender abarrotes; Daria, animales y sus derivados; Margarita, comida, ropa y zapatos; María V., refresco; Teodora, cría de cerdos; Yaseth, zapatos y ropa interior; Ma. Luisa, carne y comida típica; Leticia, cosméticos; María A., cerdos, zapatos y comida; Danyria, ropa y zapatos; Juana R., carne y cosméticos; Alejandra, comida y ropa mientras que Judith vende zapatos, cosméticos y da servicio de carpintería. 
   Doña Daria es una mujer muy trabajadora a quien todos conocen como Dari. Junto a su esposo Bernardo decidió iniciar una actividad para apoyarse el uno al otro; fue así como iniciaron con la venta de leche que obtienen de las ocho vacas que tienen actualmente en su granja. De igual forma, debido a la demanda de los clientes decidieron implementar la elaboración y venta de queso envuelto en hojas de maíz conocido como “queso de rancho”.  En promedio por día venden de diez a doce piezas lo que ha representado un beneficio constante. 
   Gracias a su primera actividad decidió comenzar con la cría de cerdos, “me gusta vivir al aire libre, ser fuente de mis propios ingresos y trabajar en equipo con mi esposo” comentó muy contenta y espera tener una pequeña granja donde críe patos, gallinas, ovejas, etc.
   El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de suero, sal, cuajo, alimento de crecimiento, de engorda y leche pues sus ventas afortunadamente han incrementado.
*Ellas son Las Guerreras, la fotografía fue tomada en “la novia del sol”, doña Daria viste blusa verde agua y pantalón floreado.
texts.en:
A certain Veracruz municipality has a vast culinary heritage, thanks to the ethnic variety of its inhabitants, especially the Cuenqueños, although with the passage of time it has been enriched by the influence of the Chinantecos and Mazatecos who have settled there. Among the dishes that are made in the region some that stand out are the sweet corn tamale or tamale in red sauce, chancletas [tamales wrapped in banana leaves], pudding, coconut candies, chocolate fudge, rice pudding, fritters and stuffed bananas, horchata, rice and coconut water, atole de coyol [a thin corn porridge seasoned with cocoa], just to name a few.

Las Guerreras [The Warriors] is the name of a group made up of thirteen hard-working women committed to their families. They chose this name because they consider themselves to be warriors. They are: Juan M., who sells groceries; Daria, animals and their derivatives; Margarita, food, clothing and shoes; María V., sodas; Teodora, breeding pigs; Yaseth, shoes and underwear; Ma. Luisa, meat and traditional food.; Leticia, cosmetics; María A., pigs, shoes, and food; Danyria, clothing and shoes; Juana R., meat and cosmetics; Alejandra, food and clothing while Judith sells shoes, cosmetics and does carpentry.

Doña Daria is a very hardworking woman whom everyone knows as Dari. Together with her husband, Bernardo, she decided to start an occupation in order to support each other; and it was thus that they started by selling milk that they get from the eight cows that they currently have on their farm. Likewise, due to customer demand they decided to implement the development and sale of cheese wrapped in corn husks known as “queso de rancho” [ranch cheese]. They sell on average from ten to twelve pieces per day, which has represented a steady profit.

Thanks to her first activity she decided to start raising pigs. “I like to live outdoors, be the source of my own income and work as a team with my husband,” she said very happily, and she hopes to have a small farm at which to breed ducks, chickens, sheep, etc.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of whey, salt, rennet, growth feed, fattening agents, and milk, since fortunately her sales have increased.

* They are Las Guerreras, the photograph was taken in "the bride of the sun"; Doña Daria is wearing an aqua green blouse and flowered trousers.

loans.use: buy whey, salt, rennet, growth feed, fattening agents, and milk.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 44 years old, married with five children. Three of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maribel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Maribel has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Maribel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

Ismael has been in this business for 5 years. Ismael earns more income from direct selling avon products.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Isah is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally,he would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha,Isah now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Marie Nicol

texts.en:
Marie Nicol is 26 years old, married with two children. One of whom is in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Marie Nicol has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marie Nicol requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Marie Nicol has been in this business for five years. In the future, Marie Nicol would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a Babban Gona farmer. Victoria is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing her dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Victoria would have had to sell her maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs.

With this loan Victoria can store her maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Victoria has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Victoria is thankful that she no longer has to worry about having no money to increase her farmland and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 58 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, junk foods, homecare products and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, candies, junk foods, soy sauce and other groceries.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, junk foods, homecare products and other groceries.

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Hannatu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Hannatu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Hannatu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Hannatu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 34 years old and married, and she has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Divina has been pig fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 66 years old and married, and she works very hard to provide for their needs.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.
