loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 26/12/2011 et il regroupe des femmes unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Khady est la responsable elles est  âgée de 58 ans veuve et mère de huit enfants dont quatre garçons et quatre filles . Elle s'active dans l'agriculture et la vente de légumes.
Son nouveau crédit de 250 000 francs CFA elle va acheter des semences de l’engrais pour mener une agriculture saisonnière. 
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps .
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires sanitaire et scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created since the 26/12/2011 and brings together women who are united by good social and professional links.

Mrs Khady is the leader, she is 58 years old, widowed and the mother of eight children of which four are boys and four are girls. She works in agriculture and the sale of vegetables. Her new loan of 250 000 FCFA will help her to buy seeds and fertiliser for seasonal cultivation. She has a good experience in this field as she has been practicing it for a long time.

The profits generated by her activity will allow her to take care of the food, health and school needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser for seasonal cultivation.

loans.name: Nogoye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée de puis décembre 2011 et il est composé de femmes issues du même village et unies par de  bonnes relations de voisinage.
Madame Nogoye est la responsable elle est mariée et sans enfants.Elle s'active dans l'agriculture saisonnière.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 450 000 francs C FA elle va se payer des semences de l'engrais pour mener une agriculture saisonnière.
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis longtemps.
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité d'agriculture et de commerce de ses produits lui permettent de renforcer son capital et de satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
This group was created since December 2011 and is made up of women from the same village who are united by good neighbourhood links.

Mrs Nogoye is the leader, she is married with no children. She works in seasonal cultivation. With her new 450 000 FCFA loan, she will buy seeds and fertiliser to carry out seasonal cultivation. She has a good experience in this field as she has been practicing it for a long time.

The profits generated from her agricultural activity and trade of her products allow her to build her capital and satisfy her personal needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser for cultivation.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Ella es Yaneth, es una luchadora, toda una guerrera, una mujer que persevero para alcanzar su sueño de montar un salón de belleza y no se detuvo ante las dificultades económicas que se le presentaron, ella busco los fondos para capacitarse y comprar el equipo necesario para iniciar a operar.
Ahora Yaneth tiene un nuevo objetivo para cumplir, comprar una vivienda, algo que anhelada con todas sus fuerzas, se sueña todos los días compartir un hogar propio con su esposo y su pequeño de 6 años de edad y sabe que la única manera de lograrlo es trabajando constantemente.
Para mejorar sus ingresos tiene una gran idea, la cual es vender los productos que usa en sus clientes, por ello quiere solicitar un pequeño impulso económico para la compra de una vitrina, surtido de productos de uso personal y compra de químicos para su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
This is Yaneth. She is a fighter, all warrior, a woman who persevered to achieve her dream of launching a beauty salon and she did not stop when faced with economic difficulties. She looked for funds to train herself and to buy the equipment necessary to start and to operate.

Now, Yaneth has a new objective to achieve: to buy a house. Something longed for with all her strength. Everyday, she dreams of sharing her own home with her husband and their 6 year old son and knows that the only way to achieve this is through working constantly.

To improve her income, she has a big idea which is to sell the products that her customers use. So she wants to request a small economic boost to buy a glass display case stocked with personal use products and to buy chemicals for her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy a glass display case stocked with personal products and to buy chemicals for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es:
Jesús es un hombre enérgico, una persona humilde, campesina, trabajadora cuyo principal valor es la protección para su familia. A sus 53 años de edad, es una persona casada y tiene dos pequeños el mayor de 14 y la menor de 9, los cuales lleva al campo para que aprendan y disfruten de lo maravilloso que es las actividades agrícolas, pues quiere que amen y continúen con esta profesión que le ha dado de comer a su familia por tantos años. 
Los principales sueños de Jesús son tener siempre trabajo, que a su familia nunca lleguen a pasar necesidades, pagar la educación de sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Para continuar con su buena producción agrícola, Jesús necesita insumos, por ello solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de fertilizantes, insecticidas y fungicidas para el mantenimiento de sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Jesús is an energetic man, a humble, hard working person from the countryside whose main value is the protection of his family. At 53 years of age, he is married and has two children, the eldest of which is 14 and the younger is 9. He takes them into the fields so they learn and enjoy the marvelous agricultural work since he wants them to love and continue with this profession that has fed his family for so many years.

Jesús' main dreams are to always have work, that his family never wants for anything, to pay for his children's education, and to improve his housing conditions.

To continue with his good agricultural production, Jesús needs inputs so he is requesting economic support to buy fertilizers, insecticides and fungicides to maintain his land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and fungicides to maintain his land.

loans.name: Nubia Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Nubia, es una mujer trabajadora, ama de casa por naturaleza, protectora y emprendedora, es casada y tiene dos hijas con las cuales pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo, pero esto no le impide trabajar y generar ingresos pues se dedica a vender ropa como independiente con lo que genera los recursos necesarios para ayudar a su esposo en el mantenimiento del hogar y pago de los estudios de su hija mayor.
Su trabajo ha traído progreso a su hogar, gozan de una mejor calidad de vida, por ello quiere continuar y hacer todo lo posible para crecer, pero su principal dificultad es la parte económica, por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido variado de ropa juvenil, aprovechando que se aproxima la época de diciembre y el Halloween.
texts.en:
This is Nubia. She is a hard working woman, a natural housewife, protector and entrepreneur. She is married and has two daughters with whom she spends the greater part of her time. But this does not prevent her from working and earning income since she is dedicated to selling clothing independently through which she earns the necessary resources to help her husband in supporting the household and paying for her eldest daughter's education.

Her work has brought progress to her home. They enjoy a better quality of life so she wants to continue and to do everything possible to grow. But her main difficulty is the economic part. For this, she wants to request a loan to buy stock of varied children's clothing, thus taking advantage of the nearing season of December and Halloween.

loans.use: to buy stock of varied children's clothing, thus taking advantage of the approaching seasons of December and Halloween.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.es:
Ella es Jenifer una joven responsable y madura la cual vive en relación libre con su pareja, pero lo más increíble es que con tan solo 20 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos.
Jenifer es una joven muy consciente con su pareja, sabe que son padres a muy temprana edad, por ello busco la forma de apoyarlo económicamente y juntos trabajar para sacar adelante su bonita familia.
Encontró en la venta de productos de la canasta familiar la forma más efectiva de generar ingresos sin descuidar sus pequeños los cuales tienen 1, 6 y 4 años de edad.
Para seguir creciendo y buscar un mejor futuro para su familia, Jenifer quiere solicitar un crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de la canasta familiar, lo que busca es aumentar su inventario para atraer más clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This is Jenifer, a responsible and mature young woman who lives in a common-law marriage with her partner, but the most incredible thing is that at only 20 years old, she is the mother of 3 children.

Jenifer is a young woman who, with her partner, is conscientious and knows that they are parents at a very young age. So, she seeks a means of economic support and together they work to get their lovely family ahead.

She found, in the sale of basic pantry items, the most effective way to generate income without neglecting her little ones who are 1, 6, and 4 years old.

To continue growing and looking for a better future for her family, Jenifer wants to ask for a loan to invest in the purchase of family pantry items, what she seeks is to expand her inventory to attract more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of basic pantry items.

loans.name: Honeida Rosa

texts.es:
Honeida es una mujer soltera de 29 años de edad, una mujer muy humilde, con pocos recursos que se gana la vida criando y vendiendo cerdos, una actividad que inicio por necesidad económica.
Ella vive en las zonas rurales de sucre, con su negocio ha sabido sobrevivir y salir adelante, siempre con perseverancia y optimismo, ella quiere trabajar para comprar una vivienda propia, quiere lograr grandes metas, tener un negocio estable y cambiar su realidad.
Algo que motiva mucho a la empresaria es que esta próxima la época navideña, la cual es una fecha donde los cerdos se venden muy bien, por ello quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de cerdos y alimento de engorde, con los que espera mejorar y aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Honeida is a single woman, 29 years old, a humble woman, with few resources that she earns raising and selling pigs, work that she began due to economic necessity.

She lives in the rural zone of Sucre, with her business she has been able to survive and get ahead with constant perseverance and optimism. She wants to work to purchase her own house, she wants to achieve big goals, to have a stable business and change her reality.

Something that motivates this businesswoman a lot is that the Christmas season is approaching, which is a date when the pigs sell very well, so she wants to ask for a loan to purchase pigs and fattening feed, with that she expects to improve and increase her production.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and fattening feed, with that she expects to improve and increase her production.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa works hard to support her family. Maria Theresa is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, rice, etc. Maria Theresa has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Maria Theresa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Irinis Candelaria

texts.es:
Ella es Irinis una perseverante mujer de 35 años de edad, que se esforzó al máximo para montar un negocio de salón de belleza, un sueño que siempre había querido realizar ya que ella gusta del trabajo independiente. 
Es muy trabajadora, trabaja de lunes a domingo con una intensidad diaria de 12 horas, alternando su profesión de estilista con la de vendedora de mercancía, todo esto lo hace porque quiere brindarles un excelente futuro a sus hijos, tiene 3 en total.
El principal sueño de Irinis es asegurar la educación de sus muchachos y conforme le reste capital invertir en reparaciones a su hogar, pero primero sus hijos.
Ella siempre busca oportunidades de progreso, por ello quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para abastecer su salón de belleza, con productos capilares y productos de belleza, el resto de capital será para surtido de ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
This is Irinis, a persevering woman, 35, who worked to the maximum to start a beauty salon business, a dream she had always wanted to achieve since she likes independent work.

She is very hard working. She works from Monday to Sunday with a daily intensity of 12 hours, alternating her profession of stylist with that of seller of merchandise. She does all of this because she wants to provide an excellent future to her three children.

Irinis' main dream is to assure the education of her children and to invest the rest of the capital in repairs to her home, but first her children.

She always looks for opportunities to progress so she wants to request economic support to stock her beauty salon with hair products and beauty products. The rest of the capital will be for clothing and shoe stock.

loans.use: to stock her beauty salon with hair products and beauty products, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 51 years old and married. She has seven children, three of whom are still in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 43-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Leonora has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business, such as sugar, fruits, etc.

Leonora has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as sugar, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Medy

texts.en:
Medy is 47 years old and married. She has eight children, three of whom are presently in school.

Medy is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Medy has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Medy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 28 years old and married She has four children, all of whom are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marilyn has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elenita is 43 years old.

Elenita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Elenita requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as oil and sugar.

Elenita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Elenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as oil and sugar.

loans.name: Jemelyn

texts.en:
Jemelyn is 44 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are still in school.

Jemelyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jemelyn requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jemelyn has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Ma. Rina

texts.en:
Ma. Rina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Ma. Rina has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marissa is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marissa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 63 years old and has four children. Josefina is a married woman.

Josefina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josefina has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 28 years old and has two children. Jeana is married and has one child still in school.

Jeana is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jeana requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and others supplies to raise her pig.

Jeana has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and others supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer soltera de 27 años de edad, una persona luchadora que a pesar de la falta de oportunidades no se rindió en su afán de sacar a su familia adelante y por el contrario busco recursos e inicio una venta de informal de alimentos (suero), el cual realiza en su hogar.
La falta de capital ha sido el principal impedimento para que esta mujer crezca, pero todo puede cambiar, un apoyo económico para su negocio sería ideal, ya que invertiría el dinero en la compra de leche para preparar productos lácteos y principalmente suero.
texts.en:
Ana is a single woman who is 27 years old. She is a hard working person who, despite a lack of opportunities, did not give up on her goal of getting her family ahead and, on the contrary, looked for resources and started informally selling food (whey) which she did from her home.

The lack of capital has been the main impediment for this woman to grow. But all of this can change. Economic support for her business would be ideal since she would invest the money in the purchase of milk to prepare dairy products and mainly whey.

loans.use: to buy milk to prepare dairy products and mainly whey.

loans.name: Dana Kerti Group

texts.en:
With the previous loan, Desak Gede purchased three superior piglets for fattening. When it came to payment time, she sold all of her pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. She was really happy about that, because during the period, her pigs grew well, away from diseases, and she sold them for a high price.

The profit can fulfill the daily life and mostly is support for capital for her business. She’s very grateful to MUK, Kiva and lenders for supporting her business. She said she will always needs assistance from the loan officer of MUK to give advice and solutions for the business.

Desak Gede lives in the village where most inhabitants work as farmers and breeders. Desak Gede is helping her husband's income by running a pig business in her home.

In order to expand her business, Desak Gede raised capital by way of joining the Dana Kerti Group, where she was also chosen by other members as the head of the group; they work together with MUK to get business loans for pig farmers.

With the loan of 2,000,000 IDR, Desak Gede planning to buy three piglets for the price of 500,000 IDR each; the rest will be used for feed. Although the price of feed is currently very expensive, Desak Gede expects the sale of three pigs later would gain a satisfactory profit. This will allow her to increase the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy three piglets for the price of 500,000 IDR each; the rest will be used for feed.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 58 years old, widowed and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines.

Rosario requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rosario has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Ernadale

texts.en:
Ernadale lives in Badian, Cebu with her husband and teenage son. When her husband is away, she is busy attending in her sari-sari store business to earn an income. This has been her business for many years now.

She is asking a loan to supply her store with enough merchandise to fill her shelves. She will use it to buy vinegar, soy sauce, corn starch, sugar, milk, milo sachet, powdered detergent, coffee, matches, canned corned beef, beef loaf, sardines, creamer and shampoo.

Any profit generated will be for the family’s healthy diet and school fees of her 15-year-old son.

loans.use: to buy  vinegar, soy sauce, corn starch, sugar, milk, milo sachet, powdered detergent, coffee, matches,  canned corned beef, beef loaf, sardines, creamer and shampoo

loans.name: Sevilla

texts.en:
Sevilla is 47 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Sevilla runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, sugar, shampoo, etc.

Sevilla has been in this business for two years.

In the future she would like to save money to provide and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, sugar, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish nets and materials like paint, wood, bamboo, etc for the repair of her fishing boat.

Maricar has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets and materials like paint, wood, bamboo, etc for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Surayda

texts.en:
Surayda is 46 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children that are presently in school.

Surayda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Surayda has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 56 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Tita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, sugar, shampoo, etc.

Tita has been in this business for two years.

In the future, she would like to save money to provide and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, sugar, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like coconut milk, sugar, ice cubes, salt, etc.

Melinda has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coconut milk, sugar, ice cubes, salt, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is single and has a buy-and-sell personal collection business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products like lotion, underwear, toothpaste, lipstick, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Teresita has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products like lotion, underwear, toothpaste, lipstick, beauty soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Sari Makmur Group

texts.en:
The Sari Makmur Group has received their new loan. As one of the groups that has received the most loans from MUK, the purpose of the group is help them become capable of providing their own venture capital.

This has been evidenced by the exit of one member, because she had been able to manage her business well and continue with her own capital. Other members still need new loans for their businesses; they have strong wills to become successful pig breeders.

The loan will use to improve their business by purchases superior piglets or a sow.

Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy three superior piglets. She has a plan to maintain them for fattening. Her husband helps her business by finding traditional feed, such as banana leaves, from his garden everyday. With this business, she hopes she can save and renovate her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn works hard to support her family. Jenalyn is single with one child and has a buy-and-sell tape and dvd movies business in the Philippines.

Jenalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more tapes and dvd movies to sell.

Jenalyn has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more tapes and dvd movies to sell

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Clarita is 60 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Clarita has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Clarita has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a widowed woman, 41 years old, with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florentina has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines.

Florentina requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy some materials like nail polish, cotton, a nail cutter and other materials for her business.

Florentina has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy some materials like nail polish, cotton, a nail cutter and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Trecy Jean

texts.en:
Trecy Jean is 25 years old and single with two children who are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Trecy Jean runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, juice and other personal care products.

Trecy Jean has been in this business for three years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, juice and other personal care products

loans.name: Myrlina

texts.en:
Myrlina is 64 years old and widowed with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like soap, milk, chips, bread, etc.

Myrlina has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Myrlina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like soap, milk, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma has received a number of loans in the past that have greatly sustained her tailoring business, which helps cover their daily household and personal needs. She feels a sense of fulfillment that she is able to provide for her family. She is now also blessed with grandchildren.

This time again she trusts she can request a 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of fabric, thread and other materials needed to sew curtains, pillow cases, blouses and dresses. She values and puts forth her best effort to give the best service to her loyal and increasing customers. She thanks God for Kiva and CCT for using them as instruments to assist small business owners like her.

Norma dreams of expanding her tailoring shop so she can help her grandchildren in their schooling. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and other materials needed for her sewing business.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie is a married woman, 55 years old with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Charlie has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, cooking oil, pork and utensils for her food production business.

Charlie has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, cooking oil, pork and utensils for her food production business.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Nelda has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Nelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a 47-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Mila has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of used clothes to sell to her customers.

Mila has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of used clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 64 years old and widowed with three children. Adelfa works very hard to provide for them.

Adelfa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, juice and other personal care products.

Adelfa has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Adelfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, juice and other personal care products

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
Morita is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Morita is 57 years old and has one child who is in school.

Morita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Morita requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, cheese, sugar, milk and other utensils for her food production business.

Morita has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, cheese, sugar, milk and other utensils for her food production business

loans.name: Aime

texts.en:
Aime is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Aime is 25 years old and has one child still in school.

Aime has a food vending business in the Philippines. Aime requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, cooking oil, pork and other utensils for her food production business.

Aime has been in this business for one year. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, cooking oil, pork and other utensils for her food production business.

loans.name: Luntha Group

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old. She is married to an accountant and has two children.

Grace owns a tailoring business. She is going to buy cloth and service her sewing machine using this loan. She started her business to support her husband in buying daily necessities for her home. She receives help with the day-to-day activities of her business from one of her family members.

With the profits from the business, Grace intends to build her own house and also buy two sewing machines and open another shop in future.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and service her sewing machine.

loans.name: Leadina Mae

texts.en:
Leadina Mae, aged 24, is from Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Kim, a pizza store service crew. The couple is newly married and is doing their best to make a living and prepare for their future children.

Leadina Mae helps earn income from her mini store and small remittance business. To sustain her business she is requesting funds in the amount of Php 20,000 to fill her store with food and household items such as canned goods, instant noodles, oil, eggs, beverages and toiletries. She will use part of the loan to finance her "Smart Padala" business which is a small remittance service, sending money locally.

She aspires to expand her store and money remittance to save up for their future kids. She meets up faithfully with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and electronic load to sell at her store.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is a kind woman. She is married and has a child. Her husband is a builder.

Firuza has been busy with wooden products. She has worked in this field during some years. Little by little, with the passing of time, she has developed her business. Firuza works for the well-being of her child. Firuza’s husband is a kind man and always helps to Firuza.

Now Firuza needs to financial support because her mother is ill. She is asking for a loan to buy medicines for treatment of her mother. Firuza and her mother await your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her mother.

loans.name: Reynelin

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Reynelin works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional cans of milk, beans, fruits, etc for her food-vending business.

Reynelin has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cans of milk, beans, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Jevilyn

texts.en:
Jevilyn is 32 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are still in school. Jevilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jevilyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Jevilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, juice and personal care products.

In the future, Jevilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, juice and personal care products.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORICHASKAS, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Evangelina  alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose al  negocio de venta de ropa como chompas, casacas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas, pantalones entre otros.
texts.en:
This member, Evangelina, belongs to the Qorichaskas communal bank, which is located in the province of Cusco. She alternates her daily activities with her business of clothing sales. 

She sells sweaters and coats among other items. She has been doing this work for a long time and it is going well, thanks to the efforts that she makes  every day. She is a responsible person.

Evangelina is requesting the loan to buy sweaters, pants, and more items. She is grateful for the loan and committed to make her payments on time. She wants to keep working  and thus supporting her family.

loans.use: to sell sweaters, pants, and more.

loans.name: Parvizjon

texts.en:
Parvizjon was born in 1995. He is a smart man. Parvizjon studied well in a school. He applied to the university after graduating school. Now, he is a student of the third course, and he is one of the best students. Parvizjon often goes to the library and reads books. He has read a lot of books.

Parvizjon must pay for the university tuition, but he has no money. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 54 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Wilma has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Wilma requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Baby Rose

texts.en:
Baby Rose is 30 years old and single. She works hard to support her parents.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store.

Baby Rose is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Baby Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business.

loans.name: Marqueza Cecilia

texts.es:
Ella es Marqueza es una joven de 20 años de edad, con un gran sueño el cual es salir de la pobreza, estudiar y sacar a su familia adelante. Ella nació en un casa humilde, pero nunca le falto el alimento, tiene unos padres que la aman y le inculcan excelentes valores.
Marqueza intento por todos los medios emplearse pero no lo logro, por ello hace un tiempo viene trabajando constantemente, con una intensidad de 12 horas diarias para consolidar un negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar que ella misma monto.
Actualmente Marqueza se encuentra buscando un apoyo económico para comprar surtido de abarrotes y vivires pues quiere crecer en inventario y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: This is Marqueza, a 20-year-old young woman with a great dream, which is to get out of poverty, to study and to get her family ahead. She was born in a small house, but she was never lacking for food. She has parents who love her and gave her excellent values. Marqueza tried to get a job every way she could, but she wasn't able to do so. For this reason she was been working constantly, twelve hours a day, to start her own business selling groceries. Marqueza is currently seeking financial support to buy an assortment of groceries and supplies, as she wants to grow her inventory and offer her customers more variety.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of groceries and supplies, as she wants to grow her inventory and offer her customers more variety

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks for her store like Milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner, canned food, biscuits, sausage, as well as helmets and shoes to rent.

loans.name: Dilnoz

texts.en:
Dilnoz is a kind woman. She lives with her family in the north part of Tajikistan. She was born in 1970. Dilnoz is married and has two children. Her husband is a lower.

Dilnoz started her business six years ago by buying and selling food items. She has worked hard since she began the business. Now she has her own food shop.

Dilnoz always tries to offer fresh products to her customers. Dilnoz now is going to increase her stock to attract more customers. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy sausage, flour products, candies, pasta, etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 50 years old and married. She has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. Estela has been in this business for 11 years.

Estela requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more household goods to sell.

In the future Estela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is thanking God, Kiva and its lenders for a number of loans she received and faithfully repaid in the past, which has greatly sustained her tailoring business. Aside from her tailoring, she also sells various cleaning products such as laundry detergent, as seen in her photo.

This time again she trusts she can still request an 18,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of fabric, thread and other materials needed in her sewing business. She will use part of the loan to buy several packs of laundry detergent for additional income.

Her sewing and direct selling means a lot to her for it has helped cover her family's needs for the last seven years. She is once again hoping for your positive response.

Juanita hopes to buy a new sewing machine to serve and accept more customers. She also prays for more business opportunities so she could save up money for old age. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of fabric and needles to use in her sewing work as well as several packs of laundry detergent to sell.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 41 years old and married with four children. With all four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Lea runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Lea would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elvia Maribel

texts.es:
Elvia, se encuentra acompañada, en su hogar tiene tres hijos, por la necesidad de salir adelante ella se dedica elaborar pan, atoles y empanadas para vender, el negocio lo realiza casa por casa, su madre le enseño el oficio.
Solicita un crédito como alternativa para mejorar su negocio, comprará latas para elaborar pan, harina, plátanos, azúcar, levadura, entre otros materiales para seguir trabajando, asimismo mejorara el horno, al fortalecer el negocio tendrá mayores posibilidades de aumentar la producción y calidad de sus productos.
Sus sueños son tener estabilidad económica y darles a sus hijos apoyo para que se superen académicamente.
texts.en:
Elvia has a partner and three children in her home. To get ahead financially, she makes bread, atoles and empanadas that she sells door to door, as her mother taught her.

She is requesting this loan to improve her business. She will buy bread baking pans, flour, plantains, sugar, and leavening, among other supplies to continue working. She will also improve the oven. By strengthening the business, she will have better opportunities to increase production and the quality of the products.

Her dreams are to reach economic stability and to offer her children the support for them to succeed in their studies.

loans.use: to buy bread baking pans, flour, plantains, sugar, leavening, and more supplies to keep working. She will also improve the oven.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, condensed milk, sugar, yeast and plastic cellophane

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 48 years old and has five children. Araceli is married, and three of her children are still in school.

Araceli is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Araceli requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Araceli has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Araceli would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anelene

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Anelene works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Anelene is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Anelene has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is a married woman. She is 51 years old with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Warlita has a buying and selling of used clothing business in the Philippines. Warlita requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of clothes to sell to her customers.

Warlita has been in this business for 16 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosemay

texts.en:
Rosemay is 37 years old and married with one child. Rosemay works very hard to provide for the family.

Rosemay runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, juice and other personal care products.

Rosemay has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Rosemay would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, juice and other personal care products.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 38 years old and married with two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nancy has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Nancy has been in this business for two years. In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Shurentsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Shurentsetseg, 36 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Shurentsetseg has been running a grocery store since 2008, while her husband is a sentry at a private firm.

Using her previous loan, she has renovated her house, creating a comfortable living environment for her family. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to build a cattle house in order to grow her dairy business. In the last year, she has added 15 cattle to her stock.

loans.use: to build a cattle house.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 54 years old and has six children. Angelita is married, and one of her children is in school.

Angelita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Angelita has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 52 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Elsie has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Auwal

texts.en:
Auwal is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season,he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Auwal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Auwal is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Catherine Rose

texts.en:
Catherine Rose is 32 years old and married with one child in school. Catherine Rose works very hard to provide for them.

Catherine Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

Catherine Rose has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Catherine Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Eneng

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Eneng, one of Ruma agents. Eneng lives in South Serang, a semi urban area located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She is a young woman who owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business in technology. She already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system from her friend, who already joined Ruma before her.

As the business grows, Eneng needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Eneng is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hassan will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Hassan now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en: Mr. Enkhtaivan, 27 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been making and selling construction blocks to local people since 2010. His wife stays at home, looking after their children. He is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. By doing so his family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-years-old single young man from Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small house. The family has a tailoring store. It is a very good business and all the family cooperate together to the success of the business.

Mohammad has an excellent reputation in this field and so he took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a new sewing machine. This investment will help them to increase the customer and also the income. With the increase in income, Mohammad and his family hope to open another branch in the city. Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to help his family sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned foods, noodles, spices, condiments, seasoning, coffee, sugar,  bath soap, shampoo and detergent.

loans.name: Janera

texts.en:
Janera works hard to support her family. Janera is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, canned goods, candies, groceries, etc.

Janera has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Janera would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, caned goods, candies, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Evelyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 56 years old and married with eight children.

Dolores works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, sugar, shampoo, etc.

Dolores has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Dolores aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, sugar, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel is 32 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Lucel has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Lucel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Excelda

texts.en:
Excelda is 51 years old and married with eight children, three children are presently in school, Excelda works very hard to provide for them.

Excelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned good, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, sugar, shampoo etc.

Excelda has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Excelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned good, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, sugar, shampoo etc.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 34 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

Christy is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Christy requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Christy has been in this business for six years now, and she has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Christy would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a single woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribel is 35 years old and has one child still in school.

Maribel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional peanut, fertilized duck eggs, bottled water to sell to her customers .

Maribel has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional checharon, peanut, fertilize duck eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Pacifica

texts.en:
Pacifica is 43 years old and has six children. Pacifica is widowed and has two children who are in school.

Pacifica is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Pacifica requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Pacifica has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Pacifica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sunusi

texts.en:
Sunusi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Sunusi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Sunusi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Sunusi can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Sunusi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Sunusi is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha, de 43 años de edad, está casada y se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su casa, su esposo trabaja vendiendo comida rápida y ellos viven con sus tres hijos y ellos les ayudan y estudian.

Martha, decidio colocar un pequeña tienda, después que su esposo tuvo un accidente donde se fracturo la pierna y quedo incapacitado unos meses, por eso ella coloco su negocio para ayudar a su esposo y velar por sus hijos.

Martha, necesita el préstamo para poder invertir en su tienda y comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, café, etc. su esposo ya trabaja, pero ella quiere seguir con su trabajo ya que es un ingreso extra y les ha sido de mucha ayuda.
 
Los sueños de Martha, son continuar con su trabajo y asi poder darle una excelente educación a sus hijos y tambien tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 43 years old, is married, and makes a living by selling staple products in her home. Her husband works selling fast food and they live with their three children, who help them and are studying. Martha decided to open a small store after her husband had an accident in which he fractured his leg and was incapacitated for a few months. Due to this she started her business to help her husband and look after her children.

Martha needs the loan to be able to invest in her store and to buy products like rice, sugar, coffee, etc. Her husband is working again, but she wants to keep her work, as it is an extra source of income and has been a great help to them. Martha's dreams are to continue with her work and thus be able to give her children an excellent education and also to have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to be able to invest in her store and buy products like rice, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer from Maidawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Yahaya will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yahaya no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Yahaya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Maria Ascencion

texts.es:
María, es soltera, vive con dos hijos y dos nietos, su familia le ayuda con los gatos de su hogar, tiene una venta de tortillas desde hace 30 años, en la zona no tiene mucha competencia por lo que no representa dificultades para seguir trabajando, atiende a sus clientes de seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, el negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia.
Para mantener su medio de subsistencia, solicita un crédito con el que planea comprar una plancha industrial así tendrá un mejor equipo de trabajo y aumentará la producción de tortillas.
Los objetivos de María son mejorar su negocio, tener mejores circunstancias económicas y apoyar a sus nietos para que continúen estudiando.
texts.en:
María is single, she lives with her two sons and two grandchildren and her family helps her with the household expenses. She has been selling tortillas for over 30 years in an area with very little competition, for this reason she has no difficulty continuing work. María serves her customers from 6am until 5pm and she started the business on her own initiative.

María is requesting a loan which she plans to use to buy an industrial-size grill so that she will have better equipment for her business and so that her tortilla production will increase. María’s goals are to improve her business, to achieve better economic conditions and to support her grandchildren to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy an industrial-size grill

loans.name: Ramzieh

texts.en: Ramzieh is a 46 year old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and her five children, two of them are still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source to help her family to meet the needs of life and to be able to enhance their way of living. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the first installment of her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 50-year-old married woman with nine children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Vilma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional peanuts and fertilized duck eggs to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 5 years.

Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional chicharon, peanuts and fertilized duck eggs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 48 years old and has four children. Anecita is married and two of her children are still in school.

Anecita is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Anecita requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Anecita has been in this business for two years now, and she has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anecita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 33 years old and has four children. Edelyn is married and three of her children are in school.

Edelyn is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Edelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Edelyn has been in this business for three years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, agradece el apoyo que la institución le ha dado con el crédito anterior que utilizo para seguir cultivando granos básicos, las cosechas han sido favorables, sus ingresos han mejorado y su familia se mantiene saludable.
Nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar herbicidas, insecticidas  y abono, con estos materiales sembrara granos básicos y los protegerá de las plagas, espera tener resultados positivos como anteriormente.
texts.en:
Victor is grateful for the support that the group has given him with his previous loan which he used to keep cultivating basic grains. His harvests have been good, his income has improved and his family is still healthy and well.

Victor is requesting a loan to buy herbicides, pesticides and fertiliser again. With these resources he will plant basic grains and protect them from pests. He hopes to have similarly positive results this time.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, pesticides and fertiliser.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles, sugar, spices and other groceries. 

In the future Adelaida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a married woman with four children. She is 48 years old and has one child still in school. Andrea is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Andrea has a buy-and-sell recycled materials business in the Philippines. Andrea requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of recycled materials to maintain her business.

Andrea has been in this business for one year. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of recycled materials to maintain her business.

loans.name: Kelvin Enmanuel

texts.es:
Kelvin, de 20 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador, vive en su casa de sus padres, pero ya formalizó su relación y tiene un bebé.

kelvin, se dedica a trabajar como empleado en una productora de queso en su comunidad, tiene alrededor de 5 años trabajando en ese lugar y gracias a eso ha podido salir adelante con su familia.
 
Kelvin, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos lácteos y poder colocar su propia venta de queso y otros derivados de la leche. 

Los sueños de Kelvin, son poder poner su propio negocio y asi poder salir adelante y cumplir sus metas y sus sueños para él y su familia.
texts.en: Kelvin is 20 years old and is a very hardworking young man. He lives in his parents' house, but he is in a relationship and has a baby. Kelvin makes a living by working as an employee at a cheese producer in his community. He has already worked there for 5 years and thanks to this he has been able to get ahead with his family. Kelvin needs the loan to be able to buy dairy products and to be able to start his own business selling cheese and other milk derivatives. Kelvin's dreams are to be able to start his own business and thus be able to get ahead and achieve his goals and his dreams for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy dairy products and to be able to start his own business selling cheese and other milk derivatives

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma agents, Linda. Linda lives in South Serang, a semi urban area located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her son.  Linda owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their children education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma.  She already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system from her friend, who already joined Ruma before her. 

As the business grows, Linda needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Linda’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Linda is the one who is sitting in front her own stall, with her son in the back. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.en:
Ismaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Ismaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Ismaila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Ishaka

texts.en:
Ishaka is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Ishaka has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, he would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Ishaka will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Ishaka is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Murtala would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Murtala is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Kabiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shaqra

texts.en:
