Shaqra is a mother of 4 children who attend schools and she lives without her husband, because they are separated. She is a tailor and she has many customers for whom she makes all types of garments, and her customers have remained loyal over time because she is hard working as she provides excellent service.

Shaqra needs a loan to improve her business. It will help to purchase a sewing machine and a second- hand sewing materials such as buttons, fabric, thread and lace, etc. So, she can have better tools with which to do her work and she will have the inventory to meet the demands of her customers.

She will have more satisfied customers, and earning an income with which she is fulfilling her various commitments and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and a second-hand materials such as buttons, fabric, thread, etc. She can get more income to fulfill her various commitments to her children.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie has been married to his wife of two years. His wife is a stay at home mom as they have an 8-month old baby girl called Jemia. Jackie has two brothers and a sister. Jackie is requesting to be funded by Kiva lenders so that he can start running his own business to enable him to provide basic needs for his young family.

Jackie has been working as a teller for one of the Zoona agents who started trading in October. He is very excited for this opportunity to run his own business as an Agent, he says “This world is improving. When I was a teller, I was excited because people were sending and receiving money simply, now I will be able to do this on my own as a businessman.” When Jackie gets the funds, he will be able to set up his business and provide financial services to people in his community. He will purchase a trading trolley and a web-enabled phone and have the funds needed to serve customers.

Jackie says this loan will change his life for good. As his business begins to scale, he hopes to bring in his wife so that they can run it together and grow faster. He is hopeful that his standard of living will improve.

loans.use: start running his own business offering mobile money transfer services to people in his community

loans.name: Arafat

texts.en:
Arafat is a 23-years-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small house. The family has a Document Imaging and  Printing  Office. It is a very good business and all the family cooperate together to the success of the business. Arafat has excellent in this field and so he took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a new
multi-function printing machine. This investment will help them to increase the customer and also the income.  With the increase in income, Arafat and his family hope to open another branch in the city .  Arafat appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new multi-function printing machine

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
During six months of maintaining pigs, Ni Luh has had no difficulties and problems. She sold her piglets, and she earns 200,000 IDR profit per month. This profit is increasing from the previous period because the price for pork is also increasing this month.

Because of having a good result, her husband gives full support for her business. This effort has proven to fulfill her children's school needs. She has two school-age children. They are in junior high school and elementary school.

The needs of today's life are very expensive. It forces everyone to work hard to make ends meet. Ni Luh cannot just rely on the income from her husband, a farmer; she also had to work. Raising pigs is one solution, but to make sure she earns more income, she also has a small kiosk business.

She got a loan to buy two piglets at a price of 400,000 IDR per piglet, and will use the rest for her kiosk. Her husband and her children help her to raise the piglets. They feed and clean the cage every day. Having regard for the cage and food hygiene, Ni Luh hopes her pigs will be healthy and thrive.

Two members couldn't attend the meeting because of illness and a religious ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: to buy two piglets at a price of 400,000 IDR per piglet, and use the rest for her kiosk.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 52 years old, from the province of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Happily married to Elmer, her business partner and they have two children. It is a big challenge and a struggle living in a Third World country but the couple help each other to make a living. Her husband helps her out at her general store.

She has a small variety store that sells charcoal. Since they live in a rural area, many are using charcoal to cook their food to save money on gas and it is also being used in growing ornamental plants like orchids. People also buy at a variety store for their daily kitchen and household needs by the piece. She trusts out of your good heart you could lend her funds in the amount of Php 40000 to pay for several sacks of charcoal and fill her small store with essential food items such as bread, biscuits, canned good, instant noodles, eggs, oil and toiletries. Her income helps cover family's daily needs and for her house repair.

She prays for abundance from her labor and to always live a victorious life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for several sacks of charcoal and some groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, hard wood and pay for house repair

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 46 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, all of them are still studying.  Her husband owns a barber shop and as for her she works as a secretary in a small company in her town. Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. She states that with her Kiva loan, she will be able to help her children to pursue their education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Loumarie

texts.en:
Loumarie is 27 years old and single with one child. Loumarie works very hard to provide for them.

Loumarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, juice and other personal care products.

Loumarie has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Loumarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, bread, juice and other personal care products

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 36 years old and single.

Fatima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned good, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, sugar, shampoo etc.

Fatima has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Fatima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned good, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, sugar, shampoo etc.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Usman is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Usman would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usman will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Usman now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Alh. Tukur

texts.en:
Alh. Tukur is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Tukur would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member,he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Alh. Tukur is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lawan

texts.en:
Lawan is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Lawan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Lawan is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Twenty-year-old Angella is an emerging entrepreneur. She is requesting her first loan to start running her own business. Her business will provide financial services to people in Ntchisi. Angella describes her business as a way to send and receive money from one place to another in Malawi. She says her community will benefit from her mobile money transfer business because they will be able to access financial services at their convenience store, as that is where she will set up her trading trolley. People in her community can send and receive money as they do their shopping.

Angella is requesting a loan in order to get the working capital she needs to get her Zoona business off the ground and start serving her community. The loan will be used to purchase a Zoona-branded trolley and a mobile phone, which she will use to serve her customers. This loan will also provide Angella with the float needed to serve her customers. Angella is excited to start running her own business. It will give her an income and she will be able to provide for her basic needs

loans.use: to start running her own business providing financial services to people in Ntchisi, Malawi

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en: Aliya is a 57-year-old married woman living with her Husband and mother of eight children. Her husband represents the main source of income for the family. As for her, she is dedicated for her house and children. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay her children educational fees. She is very eager to make use of the loan their professional career. This is her first loan, but she said that she will be a permanent client and eager to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children educational fees

loans.name: Faasuamalie

texts.en: Faasuamalie is a 66 year old mother with 7 children, she is still fit and strong to run her business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living with the help of her children. Faasuamalie requested for a loan to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2004.

loans.use: to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vinegar, soy sauce, corn starch, sugar, milk, Milo, detergent powder, coffee, matches,  canned corned beef, beef loaf, sardines, coffee creamer, shampoo and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, nails, hardwood and rice.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 25 years old and single with two children, one child still in school, Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

Michelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products .

Michelle has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Michelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 50 years old and has two children.  Nieves is married and has children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Nieves requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nieves has been pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nieves would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mansur

texts.en:
Mansur is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Mansur would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Mansur will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Mansur is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Nicolas Ines

texts.es:
Nicolas, de 68 años de edad, está casado, vive con su esposa y sus hijos le ayudan con los trabajos de la panadería, él vive solo con su esposa, porque todos sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y viven cada uno con su respectiva familia.
 
Nicolas, tiene una panadería y su producto es muy reconocido en la comunidad, porque junto a sus hijos elaboran pan de la más alta calidad en toda esa zona; tiene alrededor de 25 años de dedicarse a ese trabajo. 

Nicolas, necesita el préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, levadura, sal y otros utensilios para la elaboración de su producto.
 
Los sueños de Nicolas, son poder crecer en su negocio y así poder seguirle dando trabajo a sus hijos y que cuando el muera ese sea su legado para ellos.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 68 years old and married. He lives with his wife, and their children help them with the work in the bakery. He lives with his wife only, because all of his children are adults and they each live with their respective families. Nicolas has a bakery, and his product is very well-known in the community because he and his children make the best-quality bread in the whole region. He has had this business for about 25 years.

Nicolas needs the loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, salt and other utensils to make his product. Nicolas's dreams are to be able to grow in his business and thus keep giving his children work. When he dies, he wants his business to be his legacy to them.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, salt and other utensils to make his product.

loans.name: Alinafe

texts.en:
Alinafe is 27 years old and lives with her parents, she is from a family of 4. She went through good schools from primary to college. Alinafe is a farmer, she grows maize and ground nuts and keeps livestock. She sells the maize, pigs and goats. Alinafe is happy to add mobile money transfer to her micro agri-business. The prospect of expanding her business is exciting to Alinafe.

Alinafe’s biggest challenge is that she does not have the capital base to grow her business. It is for this reason that she has requested for her first kiva loan. This loan will enable Alinafe to expand her business ventures by adding mobile money transfers. She says the community will benefit greatly as her business will help them in money transfer. Mostly because they are farmers and it is difficult to move money. They often have to board buses to move money around. She understands their frustrations and her business will be a solution.
With this loans Alinafe will be able to purchase a trading trolley and a web-enabled phone as well as provide the funds needed for her to serve customers who need to access financial services

loans.use: to expand her business venture by adding mobile money transfers so that she can offer mobile money transfers to her community

loans.name: Mellane

texts.en:
Mellane is a 34-year-old woman from Clarin, Bohol. She is married and has four sons; her youngest child is 15 years old. Mellane and her husband earn a living by raising roosters for cockfighting. They have been doing this business for two years. Aside from this, Mellane also sells food (barbecue) to the community.

Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more roosters to raise and sell in order to increase their earnings. She will also buy meat for barbecue, which she sells in the early evening.

Mellane wishes to improve their business to uplift their livelihood and have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy roosters to sell and meat for barbecue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salt, seasoning, canned food, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, milk

loans.name: Elier

texts.es: Don Elier trabaja en su puesto de venta de comida. Solicita un préstamo de trescientos cincuenta mil colones (350 000), para la compra de equipos de cocina necesarios para la elaboración de dichas comidas. Por medio de estos equipos lograrán preparar los alimentos de una forma más eficiente.
texts.en: Elier works in his food sales stand.  He is asking for a loan of 350,000 colones to buy kitchen equipment needed to make his meals.  With this equipment he will be able to prepare food in a more efficient way.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his food sales stand

loans.name: Aurita

texts.en:
Aurita is a merchant from the town Of Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living by rendering catering services like weddings, parties and birthdays. She is a 59-year-old single woman. She lives in the rural town of Talibon, Bohol. For the past 30 years, she caters mostly to local town dwellers.

Aurita has decided to avail the loan buy supplies for food like crab, drinks and utensils. In this way she would be able to cope with demands. She can use the profit amount as savings to fulfill the future needs as well. She could now able to settle her obligation and able to handle her finances wisely.

In the future, she is looking forward to become sustainable to have a stable source of income.

Aurita is very thankful to Kiva and CEVI.

loans.use: to buy supplies for food like crab, drinks and  utensils

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Emmanuel now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is 58 years old, married with six children. 

Haydee is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Haydee requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Haydee has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Haydee would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elgun

texts.en:
Elgun is 26 years old. Elgun is single and lives with his parents. His mother is a housewife and father is a farmer. His family is an IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city and now lives in Mahmudlu village of Fuzuli region.

Elgun has been in an animal-breeding business three years. Elgun has more calves and he makes dairy products such as chesse, yogurt etc, from the milk, then he sells those products at a local bazar for earning money. He needs his first loan in the amount of 1900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy two head of cattle. He is thankful to Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es:
Benilda requiere de un nuevo crédito para mantener su negocio, lo utilizará para comprar insecticidas, abono y semilla de maíz, además pagará la preparación del terreno, realizará sus actividades agrícolas en el tiempo justo para sacar el mejor provecho de la inversión.
Los créditos le han beneficiado mucho para mantenerse trabajando en la tortillería y en el cultivo de granos básicos, ha logrado cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia e ir cancelando las cuotas de la deuda.
texts.en:
Benilda requires a new loan in order to sustain her business. She will use it to buy insecticides, fertiliser and corn seed, in addition to paying for land preparation. She will carry out her agricultural activities at the right time to make the most of the investment.

The loans have helped Benilda a lot and allowed her to keep working in her tortilla business and in the cultivation of basic grains. She has managed to cover the basic needs of her family and begun to pay off her debts.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertiliser and corn seed, she will also pay for land preparation

loans.name: Azra Parveen

texts.en:
Azra is the age of 32 and a mother of three children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She has a small child in her care. Her husband is power loom worker by profession. He has been working 2 years ago to meet the family’s expenses. The basic purpose of any loom is to hold the wrap threads under tension to facilitate the interweaving of the weft threads.

Now a day Azra’s husband wants to buy winding machine for proper income but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to buy a winding machine. Therefore Azra has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Azra husband can buy a winding machine to earn an income.

Azra and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lender s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy a winding machine for her husband, to go with his power loom.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio is a native from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man with four children. His oldest child is 22 while the youngest is 14. He earns a living by operating a tricycle (rickshaw) transportation service. To be able to support his family, he also engages in fishing. He mostly caters to locals and town settlers in his community.

Claudio is a hard worker who is desperately trying to develop his business, but he is also a sacrificing father who deprives himself for the sake of his children.

Claudio has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) to pay for tricycle (rickshaw) maintenance and fishing paraphernalia, like fishing net and an engine for the motorboat.

This loan should boost his fishing livelihood. He should be able to gain higher earnings and continue to provide the basic needs of his family.

Claudio is hoping to further expand his business in the future through setting aside some of the profits for emergency use and to start expansion.

loans.use: to pay for tricycle (rickshaw) maintenance and fishing paraphernalia, like fishing net and an engine for the motorboat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is married and has five children. She works hard to support her family. She operates a furniture making business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending.

Catalina requested her fifteenth loan from NWFT for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase materials such as nails, woods, paint, etc. for her furniture making business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as nails, woods, paint, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Teresita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more rice to resell.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to resell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 49 years old and has six children, two of whom are in school. Catalina is married.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Catalina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Catalina has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Sandra Maribel

texts.es:
Sandra, es una persona que vende tortillas, refrescos naturales, gaseosas, jugos y agua, fundo su propio negocio hace 2 años, tiene un horario de trabajo de 7:00 am. a 4:00 pm., tiene como ventaja la poca competencia que existe en la zona, aprendió el oficio por motivación propia; Sandra es una madre soltera que tiene que trabajar para cubrir las necesidades de sus tres hijos, ellos tienen las edades de 16, 15 y 10 años, no tiene ayuda de familiares.
Invertirá en maíz y leña, tendrá materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas diariamente, ahorra en la compra del producto al mayoreo lo que le da oportunidad de generar mejores ingresos.
Aspira ampliar su negocio, tener recursos económicos para darles mejor alimentación, salud y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a person who sells tortillas, natural refreshments, soda, juice and water.

She founded her own business two years ago. Her workday is 7:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. She has the advantage of having little competition in her area. She learned her trade through her own motivation.

Sandra is a single mother who has to work to provide for her three children, who are 16, 15 and 10 years old; she has no other family support.

She will invest in corn and firewood, so that she will have the materials to make and sell tortillas daily. She will save by buying in bulk, which will give her the opportunity to generate more income.

She aspires to grow her business, and to have economic resources to provide better nutrition, health and education to her children.

loans.use: to invest in corn and firewood so she will have the materials to make and sell tortillas daily.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 34 years old and married, with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Juvelyn has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Juvelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old and married, with seven children All seven children are presently in school. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell, like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, eggs, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, shampoo, and other groceries.

Evelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, eggs, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, shampoo, and other groceries.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 72 years old, widowed, and has 12 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Norma operates a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 18 years.

Norma requested a loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit, 37 years old, is a constructor, by profession. He learned the skills of construction from his father.

Davit, as the only breadwinner in the family, works hard to manage the family's basic expenses. He lives with his parents, brother, wife, and three children in Vanadzor town.

Davit is requesting this loan to be able to purchase materials needed for construction work, to complete current orders and gather income for his family.

He hopes to obtain a constant source of income which will permit him to provide his family with better living conditions and better education for his children.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed for construction work, to complete current orders and gather income for his family.

loans.name: Na'el

texts.en:
Na'el, 27, lives in Gaza with his wife. She is unemployed, and he supports all seven member of his family. Their house was damaged by the last war at Gaza.

The goal of this loan is to buy construction tools, since these are important for him to mend the damages and to be able pay for the workers. He wants to rebuild the damaged walls, install electricity, doors and the windows.

He hopes to be able to return to his normal life again. Na'el is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and pay for the needed workers to repair his home.

loans.name: Florcepida

texts.en:
As a married, 62-year-old woman and a parent of five children, Florcepida works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish-vending. Florcepida is borrowing PHP 5,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fish net, bamboo, and other materials for her fishing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, and other materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessica is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Jessica has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like bananas, sugar, cooking oil, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food production business.

Jessica has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, sugar, cooking oil, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is lives in the community of Dimiao, Bohol, a province with just one city. Most people rely on agricuture to earn a living.

Rebecca has been raising hogs for the last six years to support her five children, ages 10 to 18. She is asking for a loan to continue her business. She will use it to buy feed, piglets and supplements that will help her to produce healthy and fattened pigs. She and her husband work hard so they can continue sending their children to school and so that they can have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and supplements

loans.name: Chuvie

texts.en:
Chuvie is 46 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Chuvie has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Gupteswari

texts.en:
Gupteswari is a resident of Ramnaguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 39 years old. She has a small family with her husband and three children. She and her husband are engaged in the the occupation of a fresh fruit and dried fruit shop.

No doubt she has everything required by the basic necessities of life: different activities with permanent income, a two wheeler, a good shop, and other allied items to manage her family. Still her family members are not so happy, due to not having the availability of a good RCC (reinforced cement concrete) house of their own.

This doesn’t means that they are living in a thatched house; rather, they are living in a rented house with a high rate of rent. The rented house is made from mud and roofed with asbestos which creates a very critical situation during rainy season. The most important thing is that the insecure house is not completely safe.

In this situation, she decided to construct a small but standard house with all possible facilities. She has already started to construct the house, but she does not having sufficient funds to complete it. So she decided to take a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At this moment Gupteswari came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan to her for house construction. From the loan, Gupteswari will complete the doors, windows, plastering, flooring, and painting for the house. She will also complete the wiring with electrical connections.

She is very happy to know that her house will be completed within few months. It not only reduces the financial burden but also helps Gupteswari to feel proud to have an owned house in the society.

loans.use: to purchase sand, bricks, cement, metal, iron rods, and distemper (paint used to concrete surfaces of house)

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 39 years old. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ellen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Ellen has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Ellen would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 60 years old. She is married and has three children.

Lucita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, spices, bread, shampoo, noodles, etc.

She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lucita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, spices, bread, shampoo, noodles, etc

loans.name: María

texts.es: La señora María es casada y tiene una hija que también ya es casada y tiene un niño de 5 años de edad. La señora María junto con su marido  y una cuñada se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, así mismo la señora María tienen una pequeña pulpería en su casa. En la comunidad donde viven no hay luz eléctrica y ellos se tienen que estar alumbrando con foco para atender a los clientes y para realizar sus oficios del hogar, es por eso que ella quisiera un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar que vendría a ser de gran utilidad ya que se acercan los meses de corte de café y los días en la venta se ponen muy buenos y quisiera este panel para tener luz y atender de una mejor manera a los clientes. La cuñada de la señora María tiene dos hijas y la mayor está estudiando junto con la hija de la señora María y con la compra de este sistema les serviría de mucha ayuda para hacer las tareas por las noches. Comenta la señora María que estaría muy agradecida si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra del panel solar.
texts.en:
María is married and has a daughter who is also married and has a 5 year old daughter. María along with her husband and a sister-in-law work in agriculture and raise livestock. María also has a small grocery store at her house.

There is no electrical lighting in the community they live in and they have to use a lantern to serve their clients and do the housework. So she wants a loan to buy a solar energy system which would be of great use as the months for the coffee harvest are coming when sales are very good.

So she wants the panel to have light and serve her clients better. María's sister-in-law has two daughters and the oldest is studying along with María's daughter. With the purchase of this system it would help them a lot to do their homework at night. María comments that she would be very grateful is she was provided with the opportunity of this loan to buy the solar energy system.

loans.use: to install a three luminary solar energy system.

loans.name: Tutigul

texts.en:
Tutigul was born in 1973. She is a very kind woman. Tutigul is a married parent of three children. She is a very industrious woman and always tries to provide good living conditions for her family.

Tutigul has higher education. She is a teacher in a local school. As her salary is small, she has her own animal husbandry business. She buys cattle, feeds them for a few months, and sells them in a local market.

Tutigul has been busy with this business for a few years. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy cattle for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. This place is a fourth income class municipality in the province of Bohol.

Her husband is a carpenter. She helps him by selling personal care and cleaning products. She sells detergent powder and toilet cleaner to support her four dependents, ages 12 to 18.

Imelda is asking for a loan to buy detergent and more toilet cleaner to offer for sale. With this loan, she will earn more by buying merchandise in bulk. Imelda is willing to persevere so that her children will be able to finish their studies and have good lives.

loans.use: to buy detergent and toilet cleaner.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married mother of five children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells livestock. Lucy has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more livestock. She hopes that in the future, she will open a butchery. This is Lucy's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 52 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and an additional cow to raise.

Helen has been raising livestock for four years and earns additional income from tailoring.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and an additional cow to raise.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Myrna dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 61 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Salvacion has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Marina una mujer de 59 años de edad, que principalmente se dedica a cuidar de su familia, es soltera y encuentra en la venta de mercancía la manera de sostenerse económicamente.
Para Luz Marina su profesión no solo significa generar ingresos, es la manera de interactuar y divertirse, de compartir algo que es muy saludable para una mujer de su edad.
Luz Marina, busca un apoyo económico para mejorar su venta de ropa, quiere mejorar sus ingresos para dejar de depender tanto de sus hijos, quiere consolidar su negocio y asegurar un futuro.
texts.en:
This is Luz Marina a 59 year old woman who mainly works taking care of her family. She is single and in selling merchandise has encountered the way to sustain herself economically.

For Luz Marina her profession is not only a method to generate income but also a way to interact, enjoy herself and share something which is very healthy for a woman of her age.

Luz Marina is looking for financial support to improve her clothing sales. She wants to increase her income to become less dependent on her children. She wants to consolidate her business and assure a good future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Gjeline

texts.en:
Gjelina is a widower. She used her previous loan to do some repairs to her family home. However, she did not complete the repairs and and the house still remains in bad shape.

Gjelina requested another loan, which she will use to add more touches to the home to prevent the cold and rain from coming inside.

loans.use: to make repairs to her family home.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 29 years old and lives with his family in Gaza. He has finished his education at the university. Eight years ago he started his own coffee shop business for hot, cold drinks, and video games in his town. It was an impressive step forward, and that's why he is working hard to improve it.

Ahmad still needs to improve his business, so he applied for this youth loan to buy chairs, tables and a blender for fruits. This will help to increase his customers which will lead to an increase his income.

Ahmad hopes that someday his shop will be the most well-known shop in his town.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and a blender for fruits.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia is a hard-working woman who earns a living selling deep-fried peanuts. She prepares and sells peanuts to neighbors in town.

She is a 67-year old-married mother of nine grown children. She does not depend on her children when it comes to her daily needs. That is why she still pursues her livelihood but she lacks capital to finance her business.

Anatalia has requested a loan to buy ingredients like peanuts, salt and cooking oil. She hopes to improve her income, set aside some savings and start to pay her obligation.

With her previous loan, Anatalia managed to invest in deep-fried peanuts to sell, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like peanuts, salt and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es: Mónica es una joven que vende diversos artículos en su bazar. Solicita un préstamo de trescientos cincuenta mil colones (350 000), para la compra de mercadería, esto con el propósito de ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos en su tienda. De esta manera logrará incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mónica is a young woman who sells a variety of goods in her bazaar. She is requesting a loan of three hundred fifty thousand colones (350,000 CRC) to buy merchandise. She is doing this with the aim of offering a greater variety of products in her store. In this way she can manage to increase her income and improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her bazaar products.

loans.name: Jarin

texts.en:
Jarin is 30 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by her oyster culture in the Philippines.

Jarin requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business. She has been culturing oysters for ten years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jarin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 49-year-old married mother of five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Rosalinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy bamboo, a fishing net, gasoline for her boat and to pay for maintenance for her business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, a fishing net, gasoline for her boat and to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years. She earns additional income from farming sugar cane.

Marilyn requested a loan from NWTF for 23,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional sacks of feeds. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to additional additional sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle is a hardworking woman entrepreneur. She operates a general store in the Philippines. She earns additional income through other business ventures such as selling charcoal.

Rachelle requested a loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que quieren salir adelante por medio de su trabajo y lucha diaria. Ellas son mujeres muy unidas que quieren salir y es por ello que se están esforzando por mejorar cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claudelina quien se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados en una galería, ella se sacrifica por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Claudelina poco a poco y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos para darles una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas variadas y calzados para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is part of the poverty elimination program. They are hardworking women who strive, wanting to get ahead through their work and effort every day. They are supportive, they want progress and they are working for it.

Claudelina is one of the members. She sells clothing and footwear in a shopping area. Little by little and through her sales, she is getting the income to help her family and loved ones. She is making sacrifices to improve their living conditions, she wants to offer them a decent life without deprivation.

She is requesting this loan to buy a selection of clothing and footwear so that she may continue with her sales, and she is grateful for this opportunity to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a selection of clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamzungu

texts.en:
Mwanamzungu is married and has five children, two of whom attend school. For the past four years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation.

Mwanamzungu requested a loan from Yehu for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mwanamzungu owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly is for domestic use. She dreams of expanding business to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 53 años de edad, residente del municipio de Córdoba, una zona con mucha pobreza, problemas de orden público, pero que tiene una luz de esperanza, sus habitantes personas humildes pero honestas y trabajadores están dispuestas a dar su máximo esfuerzo para cambiar su realidad.
Luis se dedica a la cría de aves y ganado porcino, son las actividades con las que genera el sustento para su hogar, se separó de su esposa pero no renuncia a su sueño de tener una mejor calidad de vida, de vivir otra realidad.
A pesar de ser una persona baja en recursos, este hombre quiere trabajar, salir adelante, hoy requiere de tu ayuda para crecer, para sostener su negocio, por ello solicita un aliento crediticio para la compra de alimento de engorde para cerdos y pollos.
texts.en:
Luis is a 53-year-old man who lives in the municipality of Córdoba, an area with a lot of poverty and law enforcement problems, but that has the light of hope. Its residents are poor but honest and hardworking and they are willing to put their best effort into changing their reality.

Luis raises birds and pigs; these are the businesses that generate his household income. He is separated from his wife, but he has not given up on his dream of having a better quality of life, of living a different reality.

Despite being a person with limited resources, this man wants to work, to get ahead. He needs your help now to grow and maintain his business, which is why he requesting the help of a loan to buy fattening feed for pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy fattening feed for pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es:
El Sr. Teófilo  es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, él es productor de cocos, hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este trabajo y comenta que aunque hay tiempos difíciles lo sobrelleva por medio de su sacrificio.
Es un señor muy responsable y comprometido con su trabajo, y lucha para poder seguir creciendo y saliendo adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de cocos en cantidad, para poder expandir su negocio y cumplir con sus clientes, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Teófilo is from the city of Carapeguá. He is a coconut producer. He has been doing this work for over thirty years, and he comments that even though there may be tough times, he can overcome through his sacrifice.

He is a very responsible man, committed to his work, and he strives to improve and get ahead. He is requesting this loan to buy coconuts in bulk, so that he may continue with his work and meet his clients' demands.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell and expand his business.

loans.name: John Jaider

texts.es:
John es un hombre alegre, entusiasta, una persona que disfruta y agradece el hecho de tener vida, de tener una familia, un hijo, un trabajo, un alimento diario en su mesa, por eso honra cada día con trabajo duro, entrega todo de sí en su negocio de cría de cerdos.
Está actividad ha significado un gran progreso para John, genera el sustento diario de su familia y el progreso, quiere salir adelante y superar sus adversidades económicas y en un futuro tener el capital suficiente para pagar una buena universidad para su muchacho que hoy en día tiene 6 años de edad.
John en el momento solicita un apoyo financiero para la compra de materiales para adecuar y construir chiqueras.
El préstamo será invertido en adobe, cemento, rejas, y la respectiva mano de obra.
texts.en:
John is a cheerful and enthusiastic person who enjoys and appreciates his life and having a family, child, job and food on the table. He works hard each day and puts all his effort in to his pig breeding business.

His work has meant great progress for John as he can provide for his family's daily needs and make progress. He wants to continue progressing, overcome economic adversity and have enough capital in the future to pay for a good university for his boy who is 6 years old.

John has applied for a loan to buy materials to adapt and build pig pens.

The loan will be invested in adobe, cement, fencing and the necessary labour.

loans.use: to buy materials to adapt and build pig pens.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 35 years old and has two children. She is married, and her two children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising goats in the Philippines. Mercy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goats to raise.

Mercy has been raising goats for three years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mercy would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional goats to raise.

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
Shpresa is a seamstress and a lovely mother who is dedicated to her three children. She works very hard to give them everything that they need.

She has been working from home for more than ten years now so that she can care of the house and the children and still contribute to their budget. She has to work late into the night in order to get everything done that she needs to, but she loves her children and wants to be able to improve their living conditions and give them a better education. Her husband brings home a small salary, selling newspapers daily.

Shpresa is requesting a loan to purchase a new sewing machine. She hopes that this loan will help her to be able to improve her business and generate an even higher income. She promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Pal is in his early 50s, married, and has four children who attend public university in the capital, which is extremely difficult financially for the parents because the children live in the dormitories and do not work any part time jobs.

For the past 10 years, Paul and his wife have focused on their rural activities, including raising one dairy cow, two sheep, and some chickens. He also rents farmland from others to plant corn and rye. On a monthly basis, Pal sells 10 kilograms of homemade cheese and, on occasion, piglets. Paul earns additional income working in a bakery.

Pal requested a loan, which she will use to purchase another dairy cow, since the one he currently has is no longer fertile.

Pal and his wife, Prenge, are dressed for the photo occasion, as it remains tradition for rural people to dress in their best outfits when they are photographed.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel tiene 34 años de edad, vive en pareja hace 1 año, es una pareja joven que trabaja de manera unida, y sueña algún día poder tener hijos.
Miguel es de profesión comerciante e inicio desde el año 2.002, habilitando una despensa en la cual tiene todo tipo de productos, comenta que su negocio está en un lugar estratégico, es por ello que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran de él, y por lo cual le está yendo muy buen. Miguel está contento por la oportunidad que le da la fundación de poder mejorar e invertir en su negocio. Él además de su despensa tambien tiene ventas de artículos de electrónicos, venta de discos y otros.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, comestibles variados, carnes y otros.
texts.en:
El señor Miguel is 34 years old.  He has lived with his partner for one year.  They are a young couple who work together and dream one day of being able to have children.

Miguel is in the profession of selling.  He began in the year 2002 starting a small grocery store in which he has all types of products.  He mentions that his business is in a strategic location; and, therefore, he has a lot of customers who always buy from him.  It is because of them that he is doing very well.  Miguel is happy for the opportunity that the foundation has given to him to be able to improve and invest in his business. Besides the grocery store, he sells electronic aticles, discs and others.

He is requesting the loan to be able to buy input for his grocery store such as vegetables, fruits, various groceries, meats, and other foods.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruits, various groceries, meats, and other foods.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is a 53-year-old woman from the town of Garcia Hernandez in Bohol. She is engaged in multiple businesses such as selling cooked dishes, selling prepaid top-up load for mobile subscribers, dresses, towels, and curtains.

She is asking for a loan to buy fish, pork, chicken, vegetables, clothes, and more prepaid top-up. This in turn will help her generate more revenue. Her income will be utilized for daily food consumption and household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fish, pork, chicken, vegetables, clothes, and more prepaid top-up.

loans.name: El Pozito Group

texts.es:
El Pozito es un grupo de tradición en VFMéxico, se conformó en 2006 y aún permanecen dos de sus primeras integrantes, una de ellas es Juana, a quien de cariño le llaman Juanita.
Juanita es comerciante, se ha dedicado a vender distintos productos, sin embargo ha encontrado mejores resultados en la venta de bolsas de plástico, ajos y cerillos que ofrece caminando por los tianguis de las comunidades. Recuerda que desde pequeña acompañaba a su abuela mientras vendía artículos para el hogar y de allí nació su inquietud por tener su propio dinero. Más adelante sus vecinas le recomendaron vender ajos y cerillos; entre sonrisas comenta que por su inexperiencia con los productos no obtenía muchas ganancias pero poco a poco sus vecinas le enseñaron a preparar mejor las bolsas que contenían los ajos y cerillos. 
Durante algún tiempo, Juanita también trabajó haciendo mandados y ayudando a limpiar casas, pero definitivamente prefiere ser dueña de su tiempo y su propia jefa. Gracias al préstamo, Juanita puede invertir más dinero en su mercancía y sus ganancias le han permitido mejorar el techo de su casa y pagar con mayor facilidad los uniformes de su hija. 
A pesar de que la época de lluvias es una mala temporada de ventas, ella utilizará su préstamo para invertir en ayates (redes para cargar los cultivos) aprovechando que en noviembre además de que continúa la lluvia, también comienza la época de cosecha de maíz y las personas usan esta herramienta para facilitar la labor. También comprará más bolsas de plástico.
Todos los días Juanita trabaja pensando en hacer crecer su negocio, le gustaría vender más adelante productos de limpieza para el hogar como cubetas y fibras para platos. Sin embargo, su mayor motivación es ver a su hija terminar una carrera profesional y seguirá esforzándose para lograrlo.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Celia quien invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes; Maricruz, en productos de limpieza; Hilaria y Gabino, en productos de plástico para el hogar; Audifrén, en accesorios y cacerolas y Ma de Lourdes, en comeles y productos de plástico para el hogar.

*La imagen se capturó fuera de la casa de Lourdes, Juanita es quien viste el pantalón blanco y un mandil, cuarta de izquierda a derecha.
texts.en:
El Pozito is a traditional group in Mexico which was formed in 2006 and still has two of its original members. One of them is Juana, whom they affectionately call Juanita.

Juanita is a business woman who has earned a living selling different products. However, she has had better results selling plastic bags, garlic and matches which she offers while walking around community street markets. She remembers that during her childhood she accompanied her grandmother while she sold household items. That was where her concern about having her own money came from. Later her neighbours advised her to sell garlic and matches and smiling she says her inexperience with the products meant she didn't make much profit. However, gradually her neighbours taught her how to better make the bags containing the garlic and matches.

For some time Juanita also worked running errands and helping to clean houses but she definitely prefers being in charge of her schedule and being her own boss . Thanks to the loan, Juanita can invest more money in merchandise. Her profits have allowed her to improve the roof on her house and made it easier to pay for uniforms for her daughter.

Despite the rainy season being a bad time for sales, she will take advantage of this period and use the loan to buy ayates (bags for collecting crops). The corn harvesting season also begins at this time and people use this tool to carry out the work. She will also buy plastic bags.

Juanita works every day and thinks about how to grow her business. In the future she would like to sell cleaning products for the home such as buckets and scourers. However, her biggest motivation is to see her daughter have a profession and she will continue to strive to achieve this.

The other group members are Celia who will invest in her grocery store; Maricruz, cleaning products; Hilaria and Gabino, plastic products for the home; Audifrén, accessories and pans and Ma de Lourdes, in griddles and plastic products for the home.

* The picture was taken outside the house of Lourdes and Juanita is wearing white pants and an apron, fourth from the left.

loans.use: comprará ayates, y más bolsas de plástico

loans.name: San Francisco Del Río Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy pintoresca del Estado de México se integró un grupo de personas alegres y trabajadoras motivadas por sus familias. Desean que sus actividades se enriquezcan para que puedan ayudar a más habitantes de su comunidad. 
   Don Román es un hombre que destaca por su actitud de trabajo, para él la edad no es impedimento para salir a buscar el sustento de su familia. Está casado con la señora Teresa desde hace 40 años y juntos han formado una admirable familia con nueve hijos quienes actualmente han formado su propia familia; la pareja, además cuenta con 17 nietos a quienes quieren por igual.
   Desde muy joven, el espíritu emprendedor de don Román lo llevó a  iniciar con la venta de limones en la Cuidad de México. En su momento fue un negocio muy bueno pero con el tiempo sus ganancias eran cada vez menos, sin embargo la pasión que sentía por las ventas era muy grande así que comenzó a vender ropa deportiva, sombreros y artesanías. 
   Ahora él y los demás integrantes necesitan un crédito para comprar más mercancía pero, sobre todo, materia prima como hilos, estambres, agujas, etc. para bordar las artesanías que deben tener listas para los meses de noviembre y diciembre cuando tienen sus mejores ventas. De esta manera, toda la familia trabaja con mucho empeño durante el mes de octubre y noviembre pues ya tienen pedidos seguros para final de año. "Es un patrimonio de nuestros abuelitos, ellos fueron los que nos enseñaron a bordar” comentó con entusiasmo don Román quien además de los pedidos también sale a vender a la capital del país. Uno de sus sueños es retirarse del comercio ambulante y establecer su negocio en un local fijo.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Teresa quien invertirá en bocinas y lámparas; Esperanza, en artesanías y Erika, en bocinas. 

*La fotografía fue tomada debajo del quiosco municipal.
texts.en:
In a very picturesque community in the State of Mexico, a group was founded made up of happy and hardworking people motivated by their families. They wish that their activities are enriched so that they can help more people in their community.

Mr. Román is a man noted for his work attitude. For him, age is not an impediment to go out and look for work to support his family. He is married to Mrs. Teresa for over 40 years and together they have formed an admirable family with nine children who currently have their own families. The couple also has 17 grandchildren who they love the same.

From a very young age, the entrepreneurial spirit of Román led him to begin selling limes in Mexico City. At this time, it was a very good business but with time, his profits began to decrease. Nevertheless, the passion he had for business was very big so he began selling sports clothing, hats, and handicrafts.

Now, he, and the other members of the group, need a loan to buy more merchandise but more importantly, raw material such as thread, yarn, needles, etc. to embroider the handicrafts that they should have ready by November and December which is when they have the most sales. Through this, all the family works with lots of determination during the months of October and November since they already have work orders secured until the end of they year. "It is a heritage of our grandfathers. They are the ones who taught us how to embroider", said Mr. Román with enthusiasm. In addition to these requests, he also goes to sell in the capital of the country. One of his dreams is to retire from street selling and establish his business in a fixed place.

The other members of the group are Teresa who sells in speakers and lamps. Esperanza is an artisan and Erika sells speakers.

*The photograph was taken under the municipal kiosk.

loans.use: to buy threads, yarn, needles, etc.

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita is 49 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

Sanita has been in this business for ten years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a widowed woman with one school-going child. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Saumu has operated a kanga-selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. Kanga is women's wrap cloth. (African traditional cloth: a piece of printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides, printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames.)

Saumu faces a major challenge of lack of seasonality. She also operates a coconut-selling business that provides her with another source of income.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of kangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of kangas for resale.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, no tienen apoyo económico del extranjero, el grupo familiar subsiste con los ingresos que él genera al cultivar maíz y practicar la crianza de ganado, por su parte la esposa se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, el negocio está funcionando desde hace 13 años.
Con el capital comprara insumos agrícolas para desarrollar los trabajos de siembra de maíz en esta nueva temporada, le ayudara a estar preparado para continuar trabajando en el campo y generando más ingresos
Sus proyectos son darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children. They do not have financial support from abroad. The family group survives with the income that José generates by sowing corn and raising cattle. For her part, his wife works raising pigs. The business has been running for 13 years.

With the capital, he will buy agricultural supplies to carry out the labor of sowing of corn in this new season. It will help him to be prepared to continue working in the fields and generate more income.

His plan is to give his family better living conditions and to pay off his debt.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to carry out the labor of sowing of corn in this new season.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Zarine

texts.en:
Zarine is from Lukashin village of Armavir region, where she lives with her husband and family. Currently, Zarine is taking her master's degree in Pedagogical University of Armenia, in her first course.

Zarine asks for this loan to pay for her tuition fee for the first semester and be able to continue her studies in the university.

Zarine hopes to receive lenders' support and invest in her education, so she will be able to have a higher education degree and find a job in her profession.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for the first semester.

loans.name: Jorge Neftali

texts.es: Jorge, vive en una de las aldeas del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara junto a su hijo. El tiene 52 Años de edad y se dedica desde hace 15 años al cultivo de café, en el cual tiene muy buena experiencia en su finca, siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos y actualmente al cultivo de café debido a que se produce mejor en su localidad y se vende también a un buen precio. El prestamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo con ODEF y es por 5,000.00 Lempiras, el cual invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, insumos y pago de limpieza para brindarle mejor asistencia a su finca de café. Con esta inversión espera incrementar su producción y mejorar cada vez más la calidad de sus productos. Además piensa ampliar su finca y dejarle como patrimonio a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge, 52, lives in one of the villages of the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara with his son. He has been growing coffee for 15 years, so he has much experience working on his plantation. Having always worked in agriculture, mainly growing basic grains, now he grows coffee since it is the best crop for this location and attains a good price.

The loan he is requesting, in the amount of 15,000.00 HNL, is his third through the ODEF. He will use it to buy fertilizers and supplies and hire workers to clean his coffee plantation. Through this investment he hopes to increase production and improve the quality of his products. He also wants to expand the plantation to increase his family's patrimony.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies, and pay workers to clean his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana de 42 años de edad, vive al lado de su madre quien es su compañía y su motivación para seguir esforzándose en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas en el mercado, el cual se encuentra cerca de su vivienda, también vende comidas típicas como yuca, pastelitos, papas y enchiladas, lo que le permite poder mantener la economía del hogar y de esta manera ofrecerle todo lo necesario a su madre, gracias a que tiene tres años de administrar el negocio. Ana en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: especias, salsas, yuca, carnes, y demás ingredientes necesarios para su negocio. De esta manera aumentar las ventas y así también las ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old. She lives with her mother who is her companion and her motivation to keep working hard in her business. She has a food stand in the local market close to her home. She also sells traditional food such as cassava, pastries, potatoes and enchiladas. Her business allows her to support her home and to cover her mother's needs. She has three years of experience in this business.
Ana wants to improve her quality of life. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in spices, sauces, cassava, meat, and other ingredients needed for her business. This way she plans to increase sales as well as profit.

loans.use: invest in spices, sauces, cassava, meat and other ingredients needed for her food sales business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: Omar es un microempresario domiciliado en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla en donde funciona su taller de Ebanistería, actividad en la que toda su familia de generación en generación han heredado; sus tíos, primos y hermanos, y que decidió tomarla como su medio de trabajo por la calidad de productos que realiza, además de ser un arte que le encanta. El realiza todo el proceso productivo; cortar, pegar, pulir y armar, además de realizar sus propios diseños y los que le soliciten sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son comerciantes a quienes les promociona cada quince días nuevas referencias de muebles, alcobas, comedores, multimuebles y demás. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para la compra de materia prima como madera, triples, pintura, colbón, clavos y demás insumos necesarios para la producción. Esta inversión pretende mejorar los tiempos de entrega y acercarlo a la meta de ampliar y organizar su infraestructura.  Omar está separado de su cónyuge y es padre de tres hijos a quienes les ofrece bienestar con el fruto de su trabajo, su meta personal es volver a tener un hogar.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a small business owner who lives in a neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla, where he has his cabinet making workshop. His entire family has passed this business down from generation to generation, to his uncles, cousins and brothers, and he decided to take it up as his means of work due to the quality of the products he makes. It is also an art he loves. He does the entire production process: cutting, gluing, polishing, and assembling, in addition to creating his own designs and those requested by his customers, who are mostly merchants. Every two weeks he offers his customers new references for furniture for bedrooms and dining rooms, wall units, and other items. 

He is currently applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy raw material like wood, plywood, paint, glue, nails and other supplies necessary for production. This investment is intended to improve his delivery times and to help in achieving his goal of expanding and organizing his infrastructure.  

Eduardo is separated from his partner and is the father of three children whose well-being he provides for with the results of his work. His personal goal is to have a home once again.

loans.use: to buy raw material like wood, plywood, paint, glue, nails and other supplies

loans.name: Roma Group

texts.es:
A orillas de una carretera federal en el estado de Veracruz se encuentra una comunidad muy agradable donde cada fin de semana se llevan a cabo partidos de futbol y béisbol fomentando así el deporte entre los jóvenes. De igual forma se fomenta la convivencia entre todos los habitantes ya que terminando los eventos se reúnen a comer o charlar.
   En dicha comunidad se integró un grupo llamdo Roma, las integrantes atribuyen dicho nombre ya que, al igual que la ciudad antigua, sus actividades no se constituyeron en un día. Sus actividades han sido con base en el esfuerzo, el trabajo y la dedicación. Los miembros son: Julia quien vende zapatos y volovanes; Maricela y Teresa, zapatos; Matilde, comida; Evarista, cerdos; Norberta, ropa; Arnulfo, refresco; Margarita, tamales y artículos de plata; Ana, repostería y Elvira, cosméticos.
   Doña Julia es una mujer de una fuerza destacable ya que a pesar de haber enviudado hace dos años decidió continuar con una actividad laboral. Tiene 16 años dedicados a la venta de volovanes “la necesidad de ofrecer lo mejor a nuestros hijos fue lo que nos motivó” comenta emocionada. Dicha actividad la comenzó con su esposo y de cierta manera el seguir con ella le crea satisfacción y buenos recuerdos.
   En promedio por día llega a vender de 50 a 60 volovanes diarios y de 1 a 2 pizzas, sobre todo, cuando sus hijos venden durante las actividades deportivas de la comunidad. Con ayuda de uno de sus hijos realiza el proceso que dará como resultado uno de los productos más solicitados por la clientela. Primero mezcla la harina que se convierte en masa, luego la deja reposar y la extiende sobre una gran mesa de madera donde moldean cada producto para, por último, introducirlos en el horno.
   El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de harina, mantequilla, levadura, piña, queso, jamón, atún para reforzar la actividad que inició al lado de su esposo. “Gracias a cada una de las personas que han hecho posible este préstamo, es de mucha ayuda” refiere. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de doña Evarista, doña Julia es quien sostiene un par de sandalias.
texts.en:
