Beside a federal highway in the state of Veracruz there is a very pleasant community where every weekend soccer and baseball games take place, promoting sports among the youth. A sense of community is also promoted among the residents, since when the games are over, they get together to eat or chat.

In this community, a group called Roma was formed. The members attribute the name to the fact that, just like the ancient city, their work was not completed in a day. Their businesses are based on effort, work, and dedication.

The members are: Julia, who sells shoes and volovanes, a local pastry; Maricela and Teresa, shoes; Matilde, food; Evarista, pigs; Norberta, clothing; Arnulfo, drinks; Margarita, tamales and silver items; Ana, pastries; and Elvira, cosmetics.

Doña Julia is a woman of special strength, since although she became a widow two years ago, she decided to continue working. She has been selling volovanes for sixteen years. “The need to offer our children the best was what motivated us,” she says with emotion. She began that business with her husband, and in a way, continuing it brings her satisfaction and good memories.

Each day, she sells an average of 50 to 60 volovanes and one or two pizzas, especially when her children sell them at community sports events. With help from one of her children, she completes the process of making one of the products most requested by her customers. First, she mixes the flour into dough. After letting it rest, she stretches it over a large wooden table where they shape each product. Finally, the items are placed in the oven.

She will invest this loan in buying flour, butter, yeast, pineapple, cheese, ham, and tuna in order to develop the business she began alongside her husband. “I want to thank every single person who has made this loan possible. It is very helpful," she says.

*The photograph was taken in Evarista's yard. Julia is the one holding a pair of sandals.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, yeast, pineapple, cheese, ham, and tuna.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is in her mid 50's and married with four children, one of whom is in school and three of them are grown up. She has been running a poultry business for seven years now. She works from 8am to 5pm daily and is able to make a good monthly income.

This will be Catherine's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her chicken feed and to buy medicine for her chickens. She has managed to repay all her loans successfully.

She is doing great with the loans. She used the profits to pay school fees, to repay the loans, to take care of her family, and to reinvest in her business and cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy chicks, medicines for the chicken, and for chicken feed. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Catherine will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to buy  chicks, medicine for the chicken and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Karla   de 27 años de edad es casada  tiene 1 hijo que dependen de ella,  vive en casa propia ubicada en san Lorenzo al   sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de la venta de ropa  a través de este medio saca a su hijo adelante y llevar una vida mejor.
 Con el apoyo de este préstamo que solicita que es de 8,000.00 lempiras  pretende  comprar una mayor parte de mercadería para aprovechar la temporada y esperar buenos resultados de la ventas obtenidas  y tiene muchos deseos de trabajar con Prisma .
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y salir adelante con su hijo y tener una vida mejor.
San Lorenzo  honduras -  Septiembre de 2015.
texts.en:
Señora Karla is 27 years old, married, and has one child who depends on her. She lives in her own home located in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. For three years, she has made a living selling clothing, which is how she supports her child and strives for a better life.

With the support of the loan she is requesting of 8,000.00 lempiras, she wants to buy more merchandise to make the most of the season. She hopes for a good profit from the sales she makes and is looking forward to working with Prisma.

Her dream is to improve her business and move forward with her child to achieve a better life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  September 2015.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothing.

loans.name: Christian Francisco

texts.es:
Christian con 21 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge e hija, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Su cónyuge se dedica a la venta de gas en su propio domicilio. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Christian se dedica a prestar servicio como ayudante en construcción, desde hace más de 02 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio de su cónyuge.El crédito a otorgarle le facilitará obtener ingresos adicionales para su unidad familiar.

Christian no cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio nuevo en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Christian, age 21, is in a live-in relationship.  He lives with his partner and daughter in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department in the country of Peru.  The people in this area mainly work in agriculture, trade, and ranching.  His partner works selling propane from their home.  

Christian has worked as a construction helper for more than two years.  He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for his partner’s business.  Once granted, the loan will allow her to earn additional income for their family.

Christian doesn’t have experience taking out loans.  He is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his live-in partner's business.

loans.name: Vina

texts.es: La señora Vina nacio en la provincia Capinota del departamento de Cochabamba, la señora Vina es Madre de 4 niños, esta concubinada con señor Leonardo, ella junto a su esposo trabajan humildemente y se esfuerzan día a día por darle mejores condiciones de vida, alimentación, salud y educación a sus hijos. trabajando en diferentes actividades que le generen ingresos económicos, esto para tener ingresos estables y sostenibles en bien de su bienestar familiar, desde hace 3 años viene trabajando como comerciante de comida, y desde un año como comerciante de ropa, esta actividad le brinda ingresos económicos favorables para la sostenibilidad de su familia, la señora a adquirido habilidades en la actividad administrativa de sus ingresos económicos, y en vista de tiene una actividad de trabajo permanente, decide solicitar un préstamo para adquirir una caseta para la venta de ropas, para darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Vina was born in the Capinota province of the department of Cochabamba. Señora Vina is the mother of 4 children, and is in a common-law relationship with Señor Leonardo. She and her husband work humbly and push themselves day to day in order to provide better living conditions, nourishment, health, and education for their children. She works different jobs that generate an income. This is to have a stable and sustainable income for the good of the family's well-being.

For three years she has worked as a food merchant, and for a year as a clothing merchant. This work provides favorable financial income for the support of her family. The Señora has acquired confidence in the administrative activity of her income, and is in sight of having permanent work. She has decided to request a loan in order to acquire a booth for the sale of clothing so that she can give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a booth (a point of sale for clothing) in order to increase and improve her sales, thus generate greater income for her family.

loans.name: Miguel Alberto

texts.es: Miguel de 29 años es un emprendedor altamente motivado que con esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado sacar adelante su idea de negocio; desde hace tres años y con el fin de generar ingresos adicionales se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, calzado, cosméticos y demás productos solicitados por su clientela, la cual se encuentra conformada por vecinos, familiares, amigos y compañeros de trabajo. Miguel exhibe sus productos en una vitrina que tiene ubicada en la sala de su casa y tiene una cartera adicional en San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de Bolívar, donde a través de familiares vende sus productos. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual planea invertir en un mayor volumen de ropa y calzado, para aprovechar la demanda adicional que se genera a fin de año. Su visión es organizar un local comercial en su casa y seguir fortaleciendo su negocio de tal manera que sus ingresos le permitan brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miguel, 29, is a highly motivated entrepreneur who's been able to get his business idea ahead through effort and dedication.

For the last three years, and with the goal of generating more income, he has been selling clothing, footwear, cosmetics, and other products in demand by his clients who are neighbors, family, friends and work colleagues.

Miguel displays his products in a case located in the living room of his home, and he also keeps a portfolio in the municipality of San Jacinto, department of Bolívar, where he sells his products through family members.

He is now applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Santo Domingo, he will invest in a greater volume of clothing and footwear  in order to take advantage of the additional demand experienced at year end.

Miguel's goal is to organize a commercial store in his home, and to keep strengthening his business so that the income will allow him to offer his children a good education.

loans.use: to invest in a greater volume of clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Societe Cooperative Pour Le Changement (So-Coo-C)

texts.en:
Societe Cooperative pour le Changement (SO-COO-C) has successfully repaid its first loan on Kiva. In terms of impact, they have bought food products and agricultural inputs in bulk for the community, which used to travel 15 kilometers daily to search for them. Moreover, they created one job that allowed a young man to afford his school expenses.

On a general level, all the association members show satisfaction in managing the loan. The committee board has not been changed. Otherwise, it was reinforced.

Now, SO-COO-C would like to obtain a second loan to prepare the next year's harvest. SO-COO-C's leader is still determined to bring economic change in his community. Your loan will help him do so better.In the picture, the committee members are Merzela (far left)as sales agent.Luxone (second from left) is the deleguate. Sylvia who wears the black and blue dress is a advisor.Paul is next to Sylvia. He is also a sales agent for the association. Then, Osny, the coordinator, stands next to Paul.Jertrude, a second advisor, wears a blue and yellow bonnet. Fijolas, the vice-coordinator, is the man with the straw hat behind. Romeluse (far right) wears the jeans. He is the deputy secretary.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Майрам, 49 лет, замужем, она мать 5 детей. У Майрам средне-специальное образование, она на протяжении 25 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством. В хозяйстве Майрам есть 5 коров, 8 овец. На участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает арбузы, кукурузу. Ежемесячная прибыль Майрам составляет около 21,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) с целью развития ее бизнеса, а именно, на запрошенную сумму Майрам планирует приобрести 2 телят. Доходы от кредита она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Mairam is 49 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Mairam has a secondary vocational education. She has been rearing livestock and growing crops for 25 years. Mairam has five cows and eight sheep. She grows watermelons and corn on a 1.0 hectare plot of land. Mairam's monthly profit is about 21,000 som (KGS). She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) with the aim of developing her business. Specifically, Mairam plans to buy two calves with the requested sum. She is going to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business and her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase two calves to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, aged 40, has managed his first loan very well. With the Zafen loan, he bought a router, a circular saw, and a belt sander to increase the quality of his furniture. Futhermore, Paul has created two jobs, while the workshop has gained four more contracts.

The second loan will help Paul have a continued positive impact in the poor neighborhood where he works. Paul aims to grow by purchasing three specific tools for carpentry and some raw materials. He hopes to impart the trade to his children and other youth in the community.

loans.use: to buy three carpentry tools and raw materials in bulk.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel de 45 años de edad soltera que habita junto a su pequeño hijo de 11 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se ha ganado la vida vendiendo sorbetes (helados de fruta) pero siendo una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de superación y de tener un ingreso  económicos fijo junto a una estabilidad laboral, ha empezado a brindar sus servicios  domésticos además de cuidar a una niña en casa particular, de esa manera genera sus ingresos económicos con los que lleva todos los insumos básicos para el hogar además de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Isabel realizo mejoras con su crédito anterior en cementando el piso de su vivienda, ahora desea realizar otras mejoras a su vivienda tales como levantar unas paredes debido a que están hechas de lámina  y no brindan mucha seguridad para su familia, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, cemento, hierro, arena, mano de obra, para realizar la construcción de las paredes de la casa.
texts.en:
Isabel is an unmarried 45-year-old woman who lives with her young son 11 years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman who has made a living selling sorbets (fruit ice cream) but being a hard worker and with desires to improve and have a fixed income with economic stability. She has begun to provide domestic services and taking care of a child in a particular house, so in that way she generates income with which she pays all the basic inputs for home besides offering a better quality of life to her son.

Isabel made improvements to her previous credit by cementing the floor of her home, but now she want to make improvements on her home such as raising walls because they are made of plate and do not provide much security for her family, that's why she is applying for a FUSAI credit to invest in: bricks, cement, iron, sand, labor for building the walls of the house.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, iron, and sand and to pay for workers to build the walls of her house.

loans.name: Torees Group

texts.en:
Sara is single and has three children, all of whom are still in school. For seven years now, she has been selling fruits, vegetables, and chips. She works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sara's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to pay school fees, take care of her family, make loan repayments, reinvest in her business, build her house, and buy TV and radio sets. She has managed to successfully pay back all her loans.

Sara is happy about these changes and appreciates Kiva for the support of her group. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the genge and to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking chips. She dreams of expanding her business.

Sara will share this loan with her loan group, Torees Group, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the genge and to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking chips.

loans.name: Estrella De La Mañana Group

texts.es: Grupo ¨Estrella de la mañana¨, lo coordina María Auxiliadora de 40 años, casada y con dos hijos de edades de 17 y 8 años respectivamente. Teniendo como meta sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles las mejores condiciones económicas requiere del préstamo seguir aumentando la producción de ropa, dedicada a la costura y donde elabora uniformes, vestidos y trajes de baile. Con el crédito comprara material prima como telas sincatex, telas estampadas, zypers, botones y más. Así cubrirá la demanda y ofreceré variedad de estilos. Las otras integrantes que conforman esta fianza solidaria; Karen, de 32 años tiene una pulperia en su hogar y de manera ambulante vende cosméticos. Fátima de 39 de años dedicada a venta de ropa nueva y sandalias de manera ambulante en la comunidad.
texts.en:
The "Estrella de la Mañana" group is coordinated by María Auxiliadora. She is 40 years old, married with two children, one 17 year old who is in secondary school and a 8 year old son who is in Primary school. Her goal is to raise her children and provide them with the best economic conditions. She needs a loan to continue to increase her production of clothing. She works sewing, making uniforms, dresses and dance outfits. She will buy raw materials with the loan such as Sincatex fabric, embossed fabric, zippers, buttons and others. In this way she can cover her demand and offer a variety of styles.

The other members that make up this group loan; Karen who is 32 years old has a grocery store in her house and sells cosmetics itinerantly. Fátima is 39 years old and she works selling new clothing and sandals itinerantly in her community.

loans.use: to buy raw material like Sincatex fabric, embossed fabric, zippers, buttons and others.

loans.name: Sol Radiante Group

texts.es:
Un grupo conformado por 8 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo “Sol Radiante” una de ellas es la Sra. Victoria  de 54 años conviviente con dos hijos que aun estudian. Hace dos años  por decisión propia ella decide vender juanes, papa rellena y refrescos de manera ambulatoria, ubicada en un lugar céntrico. La Sra. Victoria vende sus comidas todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante y así poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Una de sus metas de Victoria es ahorrar un pequeño capital parar poder comprar una moto taxi para uso personal. Solicito el crédito para comprar mesa sillas y baldes para dar una buena atención a sus clientes. La Sra. Victoria es la tercera persona que esta parada del lado izquierdo de la foto, viste polo color celeste.
Está muy contenta de haber recibido el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva.
texts.en:
A group made up of eight individuals with various commercial activities; these are the members of the group “Sol Radiante”. One of them is Victoria, 54, married with two children who are still in school. Two years ago by choice, she decided to sell juanes [seasoned rice and chicken wrapped in a banana leaf], stuffed potatos and soda on a mobile basis in a central location. Victoria sells her meals every day in order to get ahead and thus be able to help her husband with household expenses.

One of Victoria’s goals is save a little capital to buy a motorbike taxi for personal use. She requested the loan to buy a table, chairs and buckets, to give good service to her customers. Victoriais the third person standing on the left side of the picture; she is wearing a light blue shirt. She is very happy to have received the support of Kiva investors.

loans.use: buy a table, chairs, and buckets.

loans.name: Mujeres Sin Limites Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 5 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “MUJERES SIN LIMITES” una de ellas es la Sra. Carmen Rosa de 38 años soltera, se dedica a la venta de ceviche todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante. Con su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a su familia. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es tener un local donde pueda vender más de sus platos. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más insumos (platos, estantes, etc.) y así poder implementar más su local. A la vez la Sra. Carmen Rosa se encuentra sentada en medio y se le distingue con una chompa color acero con y cafarena marrón, se despide con un abrazo a Kiva y Edaprospo. Agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The communal group "Mujeres sin limites" ("Women without limits") has five members responsible for various businesses. One of them is Carmen Rosa, who is 38 years old and single. She makes a living by selling ceviche every day in order to get ahead. With her effort she has been able to improve her home and support her family. To keep improving her business, her greatest desire is to have a space where she can sell more of her dishes. She will invest the loan granted in buying more supplies (plates, shelves) so she can better establish her space. 

Carmen Rosa is seated in the middle of the photo and is wearing a steel-colored sweater and brown shirt. She says goodbye with a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo. She is grateful for the loan provided, as it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: Para comprar mas insumos (platos, estantes, etc.)

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal mujeres unidas está conformada por diez mujeres, madres solteras con veinte hijos menores de edad, son originarias de santa rosa del peñon y se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, en la actualidad luchan día día para hacer crecer sus negocios, y ofrecer a sus hijos los que necesitan y brindarles estabilidad económica y emocional. 
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Oneyda y tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general como ropa zapatos, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, faldas vestidos, ropa interior, ropa de niño, tenis, deportivos, sandalias, etc. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar determinado de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación mujeres unidas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Women United" communal association is formed by ten women, single mothers with twenty underage children. They are from Santa Rosa del Peñon, and they are known for being hardworking and responsible and having the desire to overcome personal obstacles. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources they were not able to study, and they saw the need to work at a young age to help with their household expenses. They are currently striving day after day to grow their businesses and to offer their children what they need and provide them with financial and emotional stability.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, Oneyda is the coordinator, and her business is the sale of general merchandise like clothing, shoes, pants, shirts, tee shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear, children's clothing, sneakers, sporting gear, sandals, etc. Her business is located in a particular part of the city. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business by buying and selling merchandise so that she can have more income in the near future.

The "Women United" association thanks the Kiva investors for the help they provide to people with scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like pants, skirts, dresses, shoes, sneakers, sporting gear, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Arca De Noe Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL ARCA DE NOE ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES SIETE MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES CON QUINCE HIJOS BAJO SUR RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS Y BRINDARLES MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES DE VIDA, LAMENTABLEMENTE ELLOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR DESDE TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES JOSEFA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICE LA ELABORACIÓN Y VENTA DE TORTILLAS, UBICADA EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN,  ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DIEZ HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO TORTILLAS POR ENCARGO A COMIDERIAS Y EN EL MERCADO, EL OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES COMPRA UN QUINTAL DE  MAÍZ PARA LA ELABORACIÓN DEL MISMO. LA ASOCIACIÓN ARCA DE NOE AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN  A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PIASES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The community group Arca de Now comprises eight people – seven women and one man – who are mothers and fathers with fifteen children between them.  They come from El Sauce in the north of the León region.  They are known for their hardworking and responsible nature and are motivated to improve their personal circumstances.  At the moment they are striving to make a good living for their children and provide better life opportunities for them.  Unfortunately they were not able to study and they found it necessary to work from a young age to help with the household costs.


Due to her appetite for moving forward, the group co-ordinator is Josefa, who has a business making and selling tortillas from her home.  She works ten hours every day selling tortillas to order both to businesses and in the market.  With her loan she plans to buy 100lbs of corn to make tortillas.  The Arca de Noe group is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people with few resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, to enable them to have a way of working with dignity.

loans.use: to buy 100lb of corn to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Yolani Rosmery

texts.es:
La joven Yolany Rosmery de 21  años de edad, es casada y  vive con su esposo y su  hijo  en su  casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 03  años al negocio de venta de ropa  y sandalias  pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, bresieres, biquinis,  también cuenta con un Molino eléctrico de quebrar maíz es una mujer con deseos de trabajar y salir adelante para poder vivir una vida mejor.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de Mercadería y poder surtir su negocio con productos que aún no tiene,  con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  2015.
texts.en:
Yolany Rosmery is 21 years old, married, and lives with her husband and her child in her own home. For three years, she has made a living selling clothing including sandals, trousers, shirts, shorts, boxers, lycra leggings, blouses, dresses, skirts, bras and bikinis. She also has an electric mill to grind corn. She wants to work and succeed so that she can live a better life.

Yolany Rosmery is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to stock her store with products she doesn't have yet. With the loan, she hopes to boost her earnings as well as her quality of life. She is looking forward to working with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a successful business and increase her customers, while forging a better future alongside her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  September 2015.

loans.use: to buy sandals, trousers, shirts, shorts, boxers and lycra leggings.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул, 26 лет, не замужем, образование- среднее. Уже 7 лет она занимается торговлей продуктами питания на рынке города. Благодаря упорному труду Айгул, в обороте у нее есть товар на сумму 150,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте. Доходы от бизнеса Айгул планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Aigul is 26 years old and unmarried. She has a secondary education. She has been selling food at the town market for seven years. Thanks to Aigul's hard work, she has goods in stock worth 150,000 som (KGS). Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Aigul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase her stock of goods. Aigul plans to invest the proceeds from the business in the further growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy food to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Syrga

texts.ru: Сырга, 64 года, замужем. У нее среднее образование, сейчас на пенсии. На протяжении многих лет в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается разведением скота и полеводством. У Сыргы в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 5 овец, на 0,31 Га земли она выращивает картофель для реализации. На сегодняшний день деятельность Сыргы приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 21,800 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита она направит на дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Syrga is 64 years old and married. She has a secondary education. She is now retired. She has been rearing livestock and growing crops for many years for additional income for her family. Syrga has two cows and five sheep, and she grows potatoes for sale on 0.31 hectares of land. Today Syrga's business brings her a monthly profit of 21,800 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock for breeding. She will direct the proceeds of the loan towards further increasing her herd of livestock and buying some furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Julian Andres

texts.es:
Julián es un hombre emprendedor, humilde, ingenioso y con aspiraciones, a sus 29 años de edad se dedica a la producción de alimentos, los cuales realiza a base de frutas, actividad que aprendió de un amigo y que decidió ejercerla como independiente para mejorar sus ingresos y tener su propia manera y políticas de trabajo.
Es padre de un pequeño de tan solo 3 años de edad el cual significa todo para él, ese niño lo motivo y lo hizo reflexionar de su vida, quiere ser un gran empresario y tener capital para asegurarle un gran futuro a su pequeño, es por ello que desea buscar un apoyo monetario para comprar una máquina procesadora, insumos y frutas en grandes cantidades.
Julián presenta una dificultad, que es global, el calentamiento global ha afectado muchos cultivos, por ende el precio de la fruta se ha elevado considerablemente.
texts.en:
Julián is an enterprising, humble, and clever man with aspirations. He is 29 years old and works producing food, which he makes from fruit. He learned this work from a friend and decided to do it independently to improve his income and have his own way of working.

He is the father of a three year old who means everything to him. His child motivates him and makes him reflect on his life. He wants to be a great businessman and have capital to assure a good future for his son. This is why he is requesting monetary support to purchase a food processor, supplies, and fruit in large quantities.

Julián is facing a difficulty, which is global, that global warming has affected many crops, so the price of fruit has risen considerably.

loans.use: to purchase a food processor, supplies, and fruit in large quantities.

loans.name: Juvenil Group

texts.es:
Cerca de un gran río y rodeada por sembradíos de caña y palma se ubica una comunidad oaxaqueña de donde es originario el grupo llamado Juvenil.  Dicha comunidad conserva las costumbres y la lengua mazateca, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a trabajar en el campo la caña de azúcar, el maíz, el frijol, el mango y las palmas.
   El grupo adquirió tal nombre por el simple gusto de escucharlo, además es un chascarrillo para ellos pues aseguran que están en la plena juventud. Ellos son: Venancio quien vende pollo; Karina, cosméticos; Jazmín, ropa; Azucena, zapatos; Praxedes, comida y servicio de molino; Silvino, tejidos; Evelyn, comida y calzado y Oleverio quien brinda servicio de albañilería. 
   Don Silvino es sordo mudo desde que era pequeño, y su personalidad carismática lo ha vuelto muy apreciado por todos los habitantes de su comunidad quienes lo conocen como “Mareto”. Él aprendió a tejer y bordar cuando apenas era un niño pues su madre realizaba dicha actividad con el propósito de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Por lo tanto, Mareto se ha dedicado a elaborar y vender blusas, vestidos, faldas y servilletas desde hace más de 30 años y con las ganancias obtenidas solventa todos sus gastos. Todas las tardes se le puede observar bajo la sombra de un árbol de mango mientras teje o borda los pedidos que le han solicitado sus clientes. Los vecinos refieren que cuando sale a tejer lo hace como cuando era un niño y cuando se percata de que lo ven sonríe alegremente; algunas vecinas incluso han aprendido a tejer gracias a él.
   Mediante señas expresó que el préstamo solicitado con VF México le será de utilidad para comprar hilos, agujas, servilletas, manta, ganchos con el fin de continuar con su actividad. “Gracias por creer en nosotros y brindarnos un nuevo préstamo, Dios los bendiga y cuide su camino hoy y siempre” manifestó mediante señas las cuales interpretó doña Praxedes.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de doña Praxedes, don Silvino viste playera blanca.
texts.en:
Close to a large river and surrounded by sugar cane and palm fields, there is a Oaxaquen community where the Juvenil group is from. This community keeps the Mazatec customs and language. The majority of the inhabitants work farming sugar cane, corn, beans, mango, and palm.

The group got their name simply because they like to listen to them, plus it is a funny story for them to assure themselves that they are youthful. The group member are Venancio, who sells chicken, Karina, who sells cosmetics, Jazmin, who sells clothing, Azucena, who sells shoes, Praxedes, who sells food and has a mill, Silvino, who sews, Evelyn, who sells food and shoes, and Oleverio, who is a construction worker.

Silvino has been deaf and mute since he was young. His charismatic personality has become very appreciated by all the members of his community, who know him as "Mareto". He learned to sew and embroider when he was a child since his mother did that work to support her husband with the household expenses. Mareto has worked for more than 30 years making and selling blouses, dresses, skirts, and napkins. The income he earns meets his expenses. You can find him every afternoon under the shade of a mango tree sewing or embroidering the orders that his customers have placed. His neighbors say he has done that since he was a child, and when he realizes they see him, he smiles happily. He has even taught some of his neighbors to sew.

Through signs, he said that the loan requested from VF Mexico will be used to purchase thread, needles, napkins, muslin, and hooks so that he can continue with his work. "Thank you for believing in us and providing us with a new loan. God bless you and care for your path today and always", he said using signs that Praxedes interpreted.

*The photograph was taken on Praxedes' patio. Silvino is dressed in the white shirt.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, napkins, muslin, and hooks.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maribel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Maribel is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, nails, etc., for her fishing business.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, nails, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like peanuts, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like peanuts, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 49 years old, widow with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nenita has an e-loading business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more prepaid load to resell.

Nenita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid load to resell.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan David es un joven visionario de tan solo 20 años de edad, que encontró una gran oportunidad de generar empresa gracias a sus conexiones y buenas relaciones, puesto que utilizó estos nexos para montar un negocio de venta de alimentos para eventos. 
Juan David quiere solicitar un préstamo para potenciar su negocio, el principal motivo del crédito es que, en el momento se encuentran en elecciones para alcalde y concejales y se generan muchos eventos y reuniones a las cuales él es el encargado de la alimentación, por ello necesita un apoyo económico para abastecerse de productos y así cubrir todos los eventos.
Necesita principalmente: abarrotes, granos, verduras, frutas, vajilla nueva, desechables y snack
texts.en:
Juan David is a young visionary who is 20 years old. He finds himself with a great opportunity to generate business thanks to his connections and good relationships. He used those links to start a business selling food for events.

Juan David wants to request a loan to strengthen his business. The main reason for the loan is that there are currently mayoral and council elections taking place, which include many events and meetings that he is in charge of providing food for. He needs financial support to stock up on products so that he can cover all of the events.

He will mainly purchase groceries, grains, vegetables, fruit, new utensils, disposable items, and snacks.

loans.use: to purchase food to cater various events related to the mayoral and council elections.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, chips, soy sauce, coffee, canned goods, milk, toothpaste, cooking oil, sugar, cosmetics and food supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an operation and to buy very expensive medicine for this father. In this way, he will be able to work normally and generate income for his daughter.

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es:
Rosa con 50 años de edad,de estado civil madre soltera, vive junto a su hijo,en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Bagua,provincia de Bagua, departamento Amazonas,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría al cultivo de arroz.

Rosa se dedica al cultivo de arroz, contando a la fecha por sembrar 1.5 hectáreas, variedad Nir, resistente a enfermedades, cultiva arroz en caserío Papaya Alta del distrito de El Milagro,dicha actividad la realiza hace 20 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de arroz. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor en su propio domicilio.El destino del crédito será para el mantenimiento y cultivo de 1.5 hectáreas de arroz en fase de quema de bordos, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Rosa es socia nueva en Edpyme Alternativa, socio bancarizado. Firma con aval.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old, is a single mother and lives with her son in her own home made of rustic materials. She lives in the Bagua district, in the Bagua province, of the Amazonas department of Perú. The people of this area mainly work in rice farming.

She works growing rice, growing 1.5 hectares to date. She grows the Nir variety, which is resistant to illness. She grows rice in the town of Papaya Alta, in the El Milagro district. She has done this work for 20 years, and has experience in the rice-farming sector. She also works selling groceries retail from her home.

The loan will be used to maintain and cultivate 1.5 hectares of rice in the phase of burning the borders, securing a good yield for the 2016 season. This will be reflected in a higher volume of sales and thus an increased income with which she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family. Rosa is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa, and is a banked member. Signed with endorsement.

loans.use: to maintain and plant 1.5 hectares of rice.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Zenaida successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business further. NWTF is presenting Zenaida's business profile for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking female entrepreneur with ten children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from making nipa roofing and raising livestock.

Lourdes is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional rice seed for her farm. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice seed for her farm.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with ten children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, noodles, etc..

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling school supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Fortunata dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Zhanyl

texts.ru: Жаныл, 52 года, замужем, есть сын. У Жаныл высшее образование, с 1995 года она занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 20 овец и лошадь. Есть все условия для содержания скота, заготовлено сено и корма. На 2,0 Га земли Жаныл выращивает люцерну. Ежемесячный доход от ведения бизнеса около 9,900 сом (KGS). Жаныл добивается всего своими силами, знает, как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zhanyl is 52 years old, married, and has a son. Zhanyl has a higher education. She has been farming since 1995. She has three cows, 20 sheep and a horse. She has all the conditions for keeping livestock, and harvested hay and feed. Zhanyl grows alfalfa on 2.0 hectares of land. Her monthly income from running the business is about 9,900 som (KGS). Zhanyl achieves everything with her own hands and knows how to plan and use her funds correctly. She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her number of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Tesie

texts.en:
Tesie is 44 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Tesie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 56 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. She works very hard to provide for them. Edith operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, diapers, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Edith requested a loan from NWTF for 17,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gildardo

texts.es:
Gildardo es un hombre humilde, trabajador, honesto y honrado que se dedica a fabricar alimentos (panela), el cual es un alimento muy típico en Colombia, él mismo tiene los campos, la procesa, la empaca y la vende. 
Está actividad la aprendió de su padre y hace un buen tiempo la ejerce como independiente.
Gildardo en el momento necesita un auxilio económico, dado que la sequía es una problemática ambiental que ha afectado mucho su cultivo y necesita de abonos para sacar rápido la producción.
Con tu apoyo, un empresario tendrá la oportunidad de sacar el máximo provecho a su cultivo, antes de que la sequía acabe con lo que tiene.
texts.en:
Gildardo is a modest, hardworking and honest man who makes a living producing food (cane sugar), which is a typically Colombian food.  He owns the fields, production, packing and sales elements.  He learned this business from his father and has been trading independently for a long time.

At the moment Gildardo needs a financial boost, given that drought is a problem for him; it has affected his crop and he needs fertilizer to speed up the growth of the crops.  

With your help, a businessman has the opportunity to make the most of his crop, before the drought destroys it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to make the most of his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is a single man and lives a simple life with his family in Tubigon, Bohol. He is 37 years old and is engaged in a duck-raising business. He has been in this for three years to help his parents with their day-to-day expenses, such as food, and to pay monthly bills. Jaime loves his parents so much; that is why he wishes to improve his business and have a sustainable means of living in the future. Thus, Jaime is asking for a loan to help him finance feed for his ducks in order to increase their growth and produce more eggs to sell.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 43 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom attend school. She lives in the rural town of Getafe, Bohol. She raises and sells hogs. In addition, she owns rice paddies and grows rice. During her leisure time, she makes hand-woven bamboo crap traps, which she also sells.

Carmelita requested a loan from CEVI, which she will use to buy feeds, pigs, farm supplies such as fertilizers, and materials such as bamboo for crab traps. With the loan, her income will improve and enable her to repay the loan. She will continue to send her children to school and provide healthy diets. In the future, she hopes to expand her livelihood by increasing the number of pigs she raises.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, pigs, farm supplies such as fertilizers, and materials such as bamboo.

loans.name: Maraldy

texts.ru: Маралды, 54 года, вдова, мать 2 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, сейчас на пенсии, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2003 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Маралды на сегодняшний день имеет 5 коров, лошадь и 10 овец. Маралды в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Маралды планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, что позволит направить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Maraldy is 54 years old, a widow, and the mother of two children. She has a secondary vocational education. She is now retired. She rears animals for income for her family, having started in 2003. Thanks to her hard work, today Maraldy has five cows, a horse and ten sheep. In order to develop her business further, Maraldy has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock. Maraldy plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business, which will enable her to direct some funds towards her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 29 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and other groceries.

In the future Rowena would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anatolio

texts.en:
Anatolio is a resident of Catigbian, Bohol. He is 52 years old. He has been engaged in driving “habal-habal” (term used most in Visayas region for a motorcycle with an extended seat to accommodate more passengers) business. He has been doing this for 11 years. 

Anatolio works hard to provide for the needs of his family. He is asking for a loan for motorcycle repair and to buy “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) leaves that are used by his wife in making baskets. His wife is engaged in basket weaving to earn a living. Anatolio is a supportive husband. He wants to improve this basket weaving to help them augment their livelihood.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and buy “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) leaves

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 64 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Monina requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Monina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Her husband owns a welding shop, which he has been doing for 15 years to meet the family’s expenses.

Zareena’s husband wants to buy welding materials, such as an iron and rod, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to do so. Therefore, Zareena requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to purchase raw welding materials. The loan will help him to earn an income.

loans.use: to purchase an iron for her husband's welding shop.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is the age of 39 and a mother of ten children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband owns a vegetable shop. 

He has been running the vegetable shop for 15 years to meet the family’s expenses, in which he sells potato, lady finger, motato, onion, etc. His vegetable shop is very famous in the colony, and that is the reason his business runs well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot.

Now, Aysha’s husband wants to invest in the vegetable shop for proper income but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase more items. Therefore, Aysha has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Aysha’s husband can purchase more items to earn a proper income.

Aysha and her family will be thankful to KIVA, lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Umut

texts.ru: Умут, 59 лет, вдова, мать 5 детей (3 дочери и 2 сына). У Умут- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она с 1992 года занимается животноводством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 6 коров, 10 овец, также выращивает фруктовые деревья. Ежемесячная прибыль Умут около 9,700 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на содержание семьи и достойную жизнь. Поэтому в целях развития своего хозяйства, а как следствие и увеличения семейных доходов, Умут обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Умут планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса и постройку дома.
texts.en: Umut is 59 years old, a widow, and the mother of five children (three daughters and two sons). Umut has a secondary education. She has been rearing animals since 1992 as her family's main income, and today she has six cows and ten sheep, and she also grows fruit trees. Umut's monthly profit is about 9,700 som (KGS) but these funds are insufficient to support the family and have a decent life. As a result in order to develop her business, and accordingly to increase her family's income, Umut has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy some calves for fattening and resale. Umut plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further expansion of her business and in building a house.

loans.use: to buy some calves to help bolster her income.

loans.name: Marianitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Marianitas se conformó en una comunidad muy reconocida por su feria ganadera, una de las más grandes del país que cuenta con más de mil participantes. El evento es una gran exhibición artesanal, industrial, cultural y de servicios, además de la exhibición de ganado vacuno.
Las integrantes eligieron el nombre del grupo por una de las integrantes con quien siempre suelen contar y por ser ella quien les invitara a formar la asociación para tener acceso a un préstamo de VFMéxico para invertir en sus actividades. Maricarmen vende zapatos y cosméticos; Lourdes, pollo, verdura y abarrotes; Mariana y Liliana, ropa; Juana, suplementos alimenticios; Beatriz, cosméticos y zapatos; Gladis, comida; María, tortillas y Alejandra y Esmeralda, ropa y bolsas de mano.
Lourdes tiene 46 años de edad, los conocidos de la colonia y sus familiares le llaman Lulis de cariño. Hace 5 años, Lulis comenzó a vender pollo y su rutina cambió por completo, desde entonces se tiene que levantar a las 5 am para limpiar los animales y ofrecer la carne más fresca a sus clientes. Las ganancias de esta actividad le permitieron comenzar a vender verduras como col, jitomate, chiles, cebollas, ajo y cilantro ya que sus clientes siempre preguntaban por esos cultivos para preparar mejor la carne de pollo. 
Tal ha sido el éxito de sus dos actividades que ha acondicionado un cuarto en casa donde su esposo y uno de sus hijos le ayudaron a instalar algunas tarimas de madera para exhibir los cultivos y al lado coloca el pollo en un contenedor de plástico, su báscula, una tabla y otros instrumentos. 
En promedio, Lulis vende de 10 a 15 pollos diario; recuerda que al principio le costó mucho trabajo aprender a filetear la pechuga de pollo para ofrecer bisteces a sus clientes. Además ella ofrece ofrece un trato único y precios  bajos comparados con los de la competencia que hay en la colonia y sus clientes prefieren comprar carne de pollo con ella ya que ahora también pueden comprar los demás ingredientes necesarios para preparar su comida.
El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de 20 pollos y verdura (cilantro, jitomate, cebolla, papas) y fortalecer de manera constante su actividad hasta tener una verdulería.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la novia del sol, doña Lulis es quien viste blusa rosa y se encuentra de pie detrás de doña Juana quien viste blusa verde limón.
texts.en:
The Marianitas Group was founded in a community well-known for its livestock fair, one of the biggest in the country with more than a thousand participants. The event is a great exhibition of traditional arts and crafts, industry, culture and services, as well as a cattle exhibition.

The members chose the name of the group after one of the members that they can always count on, and who invited them to form the association so that they could access a VFMéxico loan to invest in their businesses. Maricarmen sells shoes and cosmetics; Lourdes sells chicken, vegetables and groceries; Mariana and Liliana sell clothes; Juana sells food supplements; Beatriz sells cosmetics and shoes; Gladis sells food; Maria sells tortillas; Alejandra and Esmerelda sell clothes and handbags.

Lourdes is 46 years old. Her acquaintances in her community and her family members affectionately call her Lulis. Five years ago Lulis started selling chicken and her routine changed completely. Since then, she has to get up at 5 am to clean the animals and offer the freshest meat to her customers. The profits from this activity allowed her to start selling vegetables, such as cauliflower, tomatoes, chillies, onions, garlic and coriander. Her customers always ask for those crops so that they can better prepare the chicken meat.

Such is the success of her two jobs that she has set up a room at home where her husband and one of her children helped her to install wooden flooring to show off her crops and, to the side, keep the chicken in a plastic container, her scales, counter and other equipment.

On average, Lulis sells 10-15 chickens per day. She remembers that in the beginning it was a lot of work for her to learn how to fillet the chicken breast to offer fillets to her customers. She also offers unique service and low prices compared with her competition in the community. Her clients prefer to buy chicken meat from her now that they can also buy the other ingredients they need to prepare their meals.

She will invest the new loan in buying 20 chickens and vegetables (coriander, tomatoes, onions, potatoes) and strengthening her business until she has a greengrocer's shop.
*The photograph was taken in "la novia del sol", Lulis is the one wearing a pink shirt and standing behind Juana who is wearing a lime green shirt.

loans.use: to buy 20 chickens and vegetables (coriander, tomatoes, onions, potatoes)

loans.name: Mela Rosa

texts.en:
Mela Rosa is 47 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are enrolled in school.

Mela Rosa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Mela Rosa has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mela Rosa would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 30 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is 54 and the mother of five children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business 14 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Haleema buys materials such as hand-embroidery kit, ribbons, needles and an embroidery machine from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn a better profit for her family. She has become an expert in the embroidery business. Therefore, Haleema asked for a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

Haleema will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy embroidery raw material for herself

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 41 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Liza has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

Liza has been in this business for six years. In the future, Liza would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Carmelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming rice. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 42 and the mother of five children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for one year to meet the family’s expenses.

Now Nasreen’s husband wants to buy a new auto rickshaw for proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to buy the auto rickshaw. Therefore Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Nasreen’s husband can purchase the auto rickshaw and provide the proper transportation services to earn an income.

Nasreen and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Las Mariposas Group

texts.es:
“Las Mariposas” es un grupo ubicado en una de las comunidades con mayor producción de caña de azúcar en el país. Durante el recorrido hacia el punto de reunión de las integrantes, se puede apreciar los sembradíos de caña con algunos otros cultivos intercalados como azúcar, limón, maíz y papaya. Los trabajadores recorren el mismo camino a pie, en bicicleta, en motocicleta y de vez en cuando en automóviles. 
El grupo eligió en nombre ya que se sienten atraídos por el misticismo de las mariposas y su libertad, así se consideran todos los integrantes: Ana Bertha quien se dedica a la cría de borregos y pollos; Rafaela y Ángel, a la cría de cerdos; Nancy y María, a la venta de ropa; Abel C., a la reparación de motos; Salvador, a la venta de comida y plata; Alicia, a la venta de plata; Abel N., al servicio de eventos sociales y estilismo; María L., a la venta de tortillas y Mayra, a la venta de cosméticos. 
Abel N. tiene 57 años y desde hace 10 años se dedica al servicio de meseros, renta de manteles, sillas, equipo de sonido y decoración de salones para cualquier evento social. Después de haber regresado de EE.UU. por problemas de salud, quedan recuerdos de su estancia en un lugar lejano, pero lo importante es que ahora vuelve a estar al lado de las personas que ama.
Abel N. está muy contento ya que con sus ahorros y ganancias compró una casa, parte de la cual utiliza como bodega para guardar armazones, flores, cortinas, jarrones, sillas, mesas, manteles, que renta en los eventos. En el pasillo de la casa también tiene instalados sus espejos, sillas, un tocador donde coloca talco, peines, spray, tijeras para ofrecer el servicio de estilista. Claro está que como sus salidas son constantes debido a su labor como maestro de vals, sus clientes deben agendar con tiempo.
“Estoy feliz con lo que hago, con mi familia, con el grupo y con los préstamos de VFMéxico”. Los préstamos anteriores los ha invertido en la compra de telas, sillas, bases, alfileres, naturaleza muerta y algunos otros artículos que le hacen falta para sus nuevas creaciones de decoración. En esta ocasión invertirá en la compra de tela, flores artificiales, focos, jarrones, alfileres y una rasuradora. 
El éxito de Abel N. se debe a su  personalidad y amabilidad que lo distinguen y que se han convertido en un valor extra en sus negocios ya que se ha ganado el cariño de sus clientes.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de una de las integrantes del grupo, Abel N. es quien viste playera gris y se encuentra de pie detrás de doña María quien viste blusa beige.
texts.en:
“Las Mariposas” is a group located in one of the communities with the greatest sugarcane production in the country. On the way to the members' meeting place, one can appreciate the fields sown with sugarcane and interspersed with other crops such as sugar, lemons, corn and papaya. The workers walk the same path on foot, by bicycle, by motorcycle and once in awhile by car.

The group chose the name "Las Mariposas" because they feel drawn to, and identify with, the mysticism of butterflies and their freedom.

Ana Bertha raises sheep and chickens; Rafaela and Ángel raise pigs; Nancy and María sell clothing; Abel C. repairs motorcycles; Salvador sells food and silver; Alicia sells silver; Abel N. works in special events and fashion design; María L. sells tortillas, and Mayra sells cosmetics.

Abel N. is 57 years old. For 10 years, he has provided waiter services, table cloths, chairs, sound equipment rentals and room decorations for social events.

After returning from the U.S. because of health problems, memories of his stay in a faraway place remain; but the important thing is that he is now back by the side of the people he loves.

Abel N. is very happy; with his savings and earnings, he bought a house, part of which he uses to store frames, flowers, curtains, vases, chairs, tables and tablecloths that he rents out for events. In the hallway of his house, he has his mirrors, chairs, a dresser where he keeps talcum powder, combs, hairspray, and scissors so he can also offer his services as a stylist. Clearly, as he is constantly out and about due to his job as a waltz teacher, his customers must make their appointments in advance.

"I am happy with what I do, with my family, with the group and with VFMéxico's loans". He invested the previous loans in buying fabric, chairs, bases, razors, still life and some other items that he needs for his new decorative creations. At this time he will invest in buying fabric, fake flowers, spotlights, vases, pins and an electric shaver.

Abel N. owes his success to his personality and friendliness which makes him stand out and gives him extra strength in his businesses now that he has earned the affection of his customers.

*The photograph was taken in one of the member's homes. Abel N. is the one who is wearing a grey t-shirt and is standing behind María who is wearing a beige blouse.

loans.use: to buy fabric, fake flowers, spotlights, vases, pins, and a shaver.

loans.name: Ambreen

texts.en:
Ambreen is 30 and the mother of two children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for three years to meet the family’s expenses.

Now Ambreen’s husband wants to repair the auto rickshaw for proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to repair the auto rickshaw. Therefore Ambreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Ambreen’s husband can repair the auto rickshaw and provides the proper transportation services to earn an income.

Ambreen and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to repair the auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is a hog raiser from Dumanjug, Cebu. She's 50 years old and makes a living taking care of her pigs. It is challenging on her part because of the waiting period of up to four months before she can sell her fattened hogs. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, more piglets and food for family consumption. Once this is taken care of, she need not worry about taking feed on a per kilo basis from any sari-sari store which in turn makes it more expensive. In the future, she hopes to have enough funds for her expansion.

loans.use: to buy feed, more piglets and food for family consumption

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru, who is in her mid-30's, is married with four kids who are still in school. She has been running several businesses such as selling water, a beauty salon and chicken layers for seven years now. She works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Nuru's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the salon products sold, started water selling, and bought chicks and chicken feeds. She has paid back her loan successfully. She is happy. She used the profits to pay school fees, to repay a loan and cover household expenses.

Nuru will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon equipment and to buy chicken feeds. She dreams of expanding her business.

Nuru will make sure she pays back her loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon equipment and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en: Expedita is a married woman who lives in the town of Tubigon in Bohol, Philippines together with her family. She is the mother of four adult children. She earns a living by buying and selling personal collection (PC) products, where she sells home care, personal care, health, fragrance, baby care and beauty products. Expedita has been proficiently running this business for seven years. The profit that she earns is a great help in paying their daily expenses such as food and some of their household expenses such as bills and some for personal care. Thus, she is asking for a bigger loan amount to buy the commodities mentioned earlier to help her augment her earnings. In the future, Expedita wishes success for her business and to have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy personal collection (PC) products such as home care, personal care, health, fragrance, baby care and beauty products

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 58 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Antonieta works very hard to provide for them.

Antonieta has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Antonieta has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, and other groceries.

In the future, Antonieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Danah Fe

texts.en:
Danah Fe is 50 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Danah Fe has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Danah Fe has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Walivyo

texts.en:
Walivyo is 20 years old; she lives with her mother in Kilolo district, Tanzania. She works on the farm together with her mother. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches students life skills sessions.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to launch her small retail shop where she will sell groceries, including salt, cooking oil and soap. She plans to use the profit earned from the loan to buy home necessities like food, clothes, and decent meals, and to increase the products in her shop.

loans.use: to launch her small retail shop

loans.name: Laita

texts.en:
Laita, who is 28 years old and not married, is a mother of one child. She lives with her child in a small rented room in Kilolo district. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide she teaches students life skills sessions in her nearby secondary school.

She requests a loan from Kiva to expand her soft drinks business. The profit obtained from the loan will help Laita pay school fees for her child, improve her business by adding utensils, and buy basic needs for her family, like shelter, food and clothes.

loans.use: to expand her soft drinks business

loans.name: Vumilia

texts.en:
Vumilia, aged 27 years old, lives with her husband in Kilombero district; they have one child. She volunteers as a Camfed learner guide working with youth in her village. She teaches them life skills education to prepare them for being responsible adults and active citizens. Apart from volunteering to work with youth in her village, she also runs a pharmacy where she sells medicine.

Vumilia is requesting a Kiva loan to improve her business by increasing the variety of medicines to serve more customers. She plans to use the profit she will earn to take her child to school, cover home care costs such as rent and food, and to support her parents for social basic needs like food and medical expenses.

loans.use: to improve her business by increasing the variety of pharmacy stocks.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 23 years old and is not married. She is the mother of one child. She lives with her mother in Kilolo district. She volunteers as a Camfed Leaner Guide, teaching student life skills sessions in her nearby secondary school.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva to launch her soft drinks business. The profit obtained from the loan will help Rosemary pay her child's school fees, improve her business by adding utensils, and buy basic needs for her family like shelter, food and clothes.

loans.use: to launch her soft drinks business

loans.name: Rusia

texts.en:
Rusia is in her late 30s and is married with three schooling children. She has been making and selling porridge flour for six years. She works from 8am to 5pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Rusia's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the porridge ingredients and managed to make packets of porridge to resell. She is doing great with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on porridge flour to meet her customer's requirement. She dreams of owning a flour milling machine.

Rusia will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy porridge flour.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 27 years old and lives with her parents in Pangani district. She is a mother of one child.

Christina is a Camfed learner guide, teaching students life skills on self awareness to improve their performance. Christina requested a Kiva loan to start a business selling softdrinks near her village. Christina plans to use profit obtained from the loan to expand her business of selling softdrinks into a wholesale business. She has bigger dreams in business and she believes through Kiva loans her life will change and she will have a better life.

loans.use: to start a softdrink business.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 25 years old. She volunteers her time as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to students at the local secondary school. Through these lessons, Prisca encourages students to find their own strengths and to think about how to create a better world.

Prisca is living in Kilombero district. To earn a living, Prisca runs a palm oil business. She is now requesting her second Kiva loan to buy palm in bulk, and to expand her product. Prisca will use her profit to support her family with basic needs, and the loan interest will be repaid through her weekly two-and-a-half hours of teacher volunteering

loans.use: to buy more product to make palm oil.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is a 56-year-old married woman. She lives in Tsalenjikha district with her husband and 2 children.

Nargiza owns a small market. She runs the market to generate income. She needs some money to purchase an additional stock for her market in order to fulfill her customer needs and also increase profit.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables Nargiza to get a loan of 6000 GEL. With this received credit, she will purchase a stock of varied products and will expand her market. This will increase her income and Nargiza will be able to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to restock her market business.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 24 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Jenny earns a living from her oyster culture business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

Jenny has been culturing osyters for 15 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jenny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her oyster culture business.

loans.name: Zef

texts.en:
Zef is being photographed with his camera equipment. He is a married father of five children ranging in age from 13 to 20, with three of them attending high school and two studying in public university away from home. All in all there are eight members in his family, including his elderly mother. They live in the suburb of a little northern town where they have a front and back yard planted with orchards and seasonal veggies, enough for the family's consumption. They also have three pigs and thirty-five chickens.

Zef works for the town's water supply earning $165 monthly, his wife makes $160/month and his mother's monthly retirement pension is $73. In addition to all this, he works occasionally as a cameraman for the events in the town and villages around. "Even though we work and do our very best, our income is still very little in comparison to the expenses of our family, especially those of the kids," said Zef to the loan officer who interviewed him.

Zef is requesting a loan to pay for his two daughters' university and dormitory fees.

loans.use: to pay for his two daughters' university and dormitory fees.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Thank you for supporting Jamila with this loan. She had managed to repay back her first loan. Jamila used her first loan to improve her business by buying a refrigerator and paying household expenses for her family. She is requesting the second loan to buy more fish for her business. She will use the profit earned from the loan to increase fish in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.
